ExplntnTxt: CHS SERVICES, A RELATED ENTITY, MAINTAINS THE BOOKS AND RECORDS FOR MERCY MEDICAL CENTER AND CATHOLIC HEALTH SERVICES OF LONG ISLAND AND IS THEREFORE ABLE TO MONITOR THAT CATHOLIC HEALTH SERVICES OF LONG ISLAND USES THE GRANT FUNDS FOR MISSION SPONSORSHIP, OUTPATIENT CENTERS, GRANTS TO UNDESERVED COMMUNITIES AND CAPITAL SUPPORT.

NAME OF ORGANIZATION OR GOVERNMENT: CATHOLIC HEALTH SYSTEM OF LONG ISLAND (H) PURPOSE OF GRANT: 1) SUPPORT TO CATHOLIC HEALTH SYSTEM OF LONG ISLAND AS A PASS THROUGH TO PROVIDE GENERAL SUPPORT TO THE CATHOLIC MINISTRIES OF THE DIOCESE OF ROCKVILLE CENTRE IN CONNECTION WITH THE FORMATION OF YOUTH AND ADULTS IN THE FAITH, PROMOTION OF THE DIGNITY OF LIFE, PROMOTION OF QUALITY EDUCATION FOR YOUNG PEOPLE, AND FOSTERING OF VOCATIONS FOR THE PRIESTHOOD; 2) PROVIDE SUPPORT TO CATHOLIC HEALTH SYSTEM OF LONG ISLAND TO FUND OUTPATIENT CENTERS THAT PROVIDE CHARITY CARE TO THOSE CENTERS COMMUNITIES; AND 3) TO FUND SUPPORT PROVIDED THROUGH THE CATHOLIC HEALTH SERVICES OF LONG ISLAND CAREGIVERS FUND. THE CATHOLIC HEALTH SERVICES OF LONG ISLAND CAREGIVERS FUND WAS FORMED WITH THE MISSION TO ASSIST OUR FELLOW CAREGIVERS ON THE FRONT LINES, HERE AND ABROAD, WHO STRUGGLE JUST TO OBTAIN BASIC RESOURCES TO PROVIDE CARE TO THOSE DESPERATELY IN NEED.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN A SCHOLARSHIP MUST APPLY THROUGH A WRITTEN APPLICATION PROCESS. ALL APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO WHETHER OR NOT THE APPLICANT MEETS THE CRITERIA FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP (FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP SPECIFIES THAT RECIPIENTS MUST BE FROM INNER-CITY DETROIT, ONLY THOSE WHO ARE SO ARE CONSIDERED) AND THEN BASED ON NEED VERSUS AVAILABLE FUNDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATIONS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 ANY STUDENT THAT SUBMITS A COMPLETED APPLICATION FOR FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE ADMISSION TO SAINT JOSEPH'S UNIVERSITY IS AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A SELECT GROUP OF SCHOLARSHIPS THAT REQUIRE A SEPARATE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. ADDITIONALLY, ANY PROSPECTIVE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT THAT SUBMITS A FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID) AND MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE FEDERAL AID, IS AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR ALL AVAILABLE FORMS OF FEDERAL AND STATE AID, AS WELL AS UNIVERSITY NEED-BASED GRANT AID. MATRICULATING GRADUATE STUDENTS THAT SUBMIT THE FAFSA AND MEET THE REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE FEDERAL AID ARE ALSO CONSIDERED FOR AVAILABLE FEDERAL LOANS FOR WHICH THEY QUALIFY.
THE SCHOOL HAS GRANT RECIPIENTS SIGN THE AWARD LETTER TO ACCEPT CONDITIONS OF THE GRANT.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS POLICY INSTITUTED BY THE INSTITUTION. BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS EACH SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT THEY INDEED ARE CORRECT ON THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AND IN THE G/L SYSTEM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: PRINCIPIA DISTRIBUTES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ONLY TO STUDENTS WHO APPLY THROUGH AN OFFICIAL FINANCIAL AID PROCESS. ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S PRINCIPIA ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES. ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FROM INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS.

GRANTS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE THEN USED FOR TUITION AND OTHER EXPENSES RELATED TO EDUCATION (BOOKS, LAB EQUIPMENT, ETC). FUNDS ARE GENERALLY NOT ACTUALLY RELEASED TO THE STUDENTS, BUT ARE USED TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
OF THIS AMOUNT, $49,000 ARE FOR AWARDS THAT ARE RELEASED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A GRANTS ADMINISTRATOR WHO MONITORS ALL EXPENDITURES TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANTOR POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. IN ADDITION, AN ACCOUNTANT IS ASSIGNED TO RECORD AND REPORT ALL GRANT REVENUES AND EXPENDITURES TO THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR AND GRANTOR ON A REGULAR BASIS.

Ministries interested in having their project selected as an ORU missions project submit a Missions Project Proposal. The ORU Mission's Committee meets and approves of projects and numbers them according to their urgency of completion. Ministries are notified when funds have been collected to disburse the pledged amount to the missions project designation. Each ministry is required to send proof to the administrative liaison once the missions project is completed. This proof comes in forms such as photos and video testimonials. The administrative liaison reports this information back to the ORU Missions Committee. Scholarships/fellowships are applied directly to student accounts. No cash changes hands.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A STUDENT'S STATEMENT OF NEED.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A STUDENT'S STATEMENT OF NEED.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS ELIGIBLITY REQUIREMENTS AND MONITORS GRANTING OF AWARDS TO STUDENTS AND FOLLOWS U.S. FEDERAL AID REGULATIONS AND ALL STATES' REGULATIONS FOR GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND RECORDS OF THE AUTHORIZATION ARE MAINTAINED.

The financial aid office at William Jessup University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State, and institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Financial aid awarded is applied directly to student accounts, and no cash changes hands. Occasional grants are awarded to 501(c)(3) organizations that support education and whose exempt purpose are consistent with the University's mission.
ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED GRANTS IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE "FREE APPLICATION" FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY A STUDENT'S ADMISSION APPLICATION.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY ARE ENCOURAGED TO FILE A FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.CHAPMAN.EDU.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid Eligibility Requirements * Complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) annually and as early as January 1 (Temple's priority deadline is March 1) * Sign statements on the FAFSA stating that: * you are not in default on a federal student loan and do not owe money on a federal student grant and * you will use federal student aid only for educational purposes * Comply with Temple University's Satisfactory Academic Progress Standards * Remain in good standing on educational loans and grants per the National Student Loan Database System (NSLDS) * Remain enrolled at least part-time per semester for Federal loans (6 credits as an undergraduate student and 4.5 credits as a graduate student) * Be enrolled in an eligible degree program at Temple University * Be a citizen or eligible non-citizen with a valid Social Security Number * Have a high school diploma or recognized equivalent * Be registered for the Selective Service if you are male and 18-25 years of age * Comply with any and all federal verification requests made by Student Financial Services Research Administration Processing an Award - Negotiation of SubAward(s) If the University receives an award and a portion of the activity is to be sub-contracted to another entity, Sponsored Programs assists the PI in development of a sub-contract which outlines the sub-contractor's role in meeting the requirements of the award. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract to the sub-contractor for review and signature. Upon return of the executed document, the PI should complete a Financial Impact Statement. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract and Financial Impact Statement to University Counsel, where review and appropriate signature(s) and seal (if necessary) are obtained. When the University is the recipient of a sub-contract similar procedures are followed.

THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL PLANNING MONITORS ALL AWARDS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLEGE ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB A-133.

THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE COLLECTS GRANT AWARD LETTERS AND INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GRANTING AGENCIES OF THE BRIAR CLIFF UNIVERSITY (BCU) GRANT MANAGERS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE KEEPS A FISCAL FILE FOR EACH GRANT, INCLUDING AWARD LETTERS, INSTRUCTIONS, ANNUAL ACCOUNTING RECORDS, AND FINANCIAL REPORTS SUBMITTED TO THE GRANTORS. EITHER THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE OR THE GRANT MANAGER SUBMITS REPORTS TO AGENCIES, DEPENDING ON THE GRANT. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE CREATES A BUDGET FOR EACH GRANT IN THE GRANTS FUND, BASED ON AWARD LETTERS AND INPUT FROM THE BCU GRANT MANAGERS. IF THE GRANT ALLOWS, GRANT MANAGERS MAY REQUEST BUDGET TRANSFERS WITHIN THEIR GRANT, WHICH THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE OR THE ASSISTANT VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE ENTER IN DATATEL. THE GRANT MANAGER SIGNS OFF ON EXPENDITURES FOR THE GRANT. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE REVIEWS ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES MONTHLY, WITH MORE IN-DEPTH REVIEW AS NEEDED FOR REPORTING TO GRANTORS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE RECONCILES GRANT EXPENDITURES ANNUALLY FISCAL YEAR AND THE GRANT FISCAL YEAR, IF DIFFERENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPROVED AND REPORTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT. CHECKS FOR GRANT REVENUES ARE RECEIVED IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE: SOME AGENCIES MAIL THEM TO THE GRANT MANAGERS, WHO THEN TURN THEM IN TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE FOR DEPOSIT. SOME AGENCIES PAY BCU THROUGH DIRECT DEPOSIT INTO BCU CHECKING ACCOUNTS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE DRAWS DOWN FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ELECTRONICALLY THROUGH THE ONLINE G5 SYSTEM: DRAWDOWNS ARE USUALLY DONE MONTHLY.
THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON DOE TITLE IV REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY APPROVED POLICIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND RECORDS OF THE AUTHORIZATION ARE MAINTAINED.

THE COLLEGE MAKES GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE SELECTION OF GRANT RECIPIENTS IS MADE BASED UPON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA. NO ONE IS DISCRIMINATED AGAINST BASED UPON RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, ETHNIC BACKGROUND, AGE, HANDICAP OR ANY OTHER REASON. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ASSESSES AND MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. IT IS ASSISTED IN ITS ON-GOING REVIEW BY THE RESOURCES OF THE REGISTRAR AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS DEPARTMENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS - HIGHER EDUCATION - FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS. CARES HEERF EMERGENCY STUDENT AID - MAXIMUM ELIGIBILITY TIERS WERE ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY BASED UPON VARIOUS STUDENT SITUATIONAL EXPERIENCES. THE HIGHEST OF WHICH WAS SET JUST BELOW THE MAXIMUM PELL GRANT ELIGIBILITY FIGURE, AS RECOMMENDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWED REQUESTS AND DETERMINED STUDENT'S QUALIFYING AMOUNTS BASED UPON THEIR AMOUNTS REQUESTED TO COVER THEIR CURRENT FINANCIAL NEEDS WITH RESPECT TO THE ESTABLISHED TIER MAXIMUMS. A FOLLOW UP QUESTIONNAIRE WAS SENT TO STUDENTS WHOSE INITIAL APPLICATION WAS UNCLEAR ABOUT THEIR SHORT-TERM FINANCIAL NEEDS. AWARDS WERE FOCUSED ON THE SIX FINANCIAL CATEGORIES ENCOURAGED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. THESE INCLUDE FUNDING TO HELP STUDENTS PAY FOR HOUSING, FOOD, CHILDCARE, HEALTHCARE, TECHNOLOGY AND COURSE MATERIALS. DISTRIBUTIONS TO STUDENTS RANGED BETWEEN $100 TO $6,000.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarship Funds, both budgeted and investments, are monitored by the Board of Directors and appointed staff, with dividends being awarded as scholarships by decision of the Financial Aid Office and/or the Scholarship Committee, and distributed through the Business Office.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD FOR ITS STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON A COMBINATION OF MERIT AND NEED. THEY ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS AND MAINTAINS RECORDS REGARDING ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP, GRANT, LOAN, AND WORK STUDY OPPORTUNITIES TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS ON AN OBJECTIVE AND NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. EACH PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT CRITERIA AND EACH CASE IS CONSIDERED SEPARATELY. THERE ARE A WRITTEN POLICY AND GUIDELINES TO ASSIST STUDENTS AS THEY SEEK THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE GRANTS AWARDED.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE CREDITS ARE NON-CASH AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS RECORDS ASSESSING FINANCIAL NEED ELIGIBILITY OF THE RECIPIENTS.

VIRTUALLY ALL UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TIED TO THE STUDENTS' GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ANNUALLY, THE GPA AND NEED ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY STANDARD. IF A STUDENT'S GPA FALLS BELOW THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS EITHER REMOVED OR REDUCED BY HALF. STUDENTS CAN APPEAL TO HAVE THE SCHOLARSHIP RESTORED IF THEIR GPA RETURNS TO THE REQUIRED LEVEL. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CARRIED FORWARD EACH YEAR ONCE THE STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CERTAIN LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURAL SUPPORT TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE ASSISTANCE IS CONSIDERED A DONATION AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

The University is contributing funds to charitable oganizations in accordance with endowment agreements that govern the distribution of the underlying funds. The University also verifies that the grants given to the charitable organization are for the benefit of individual students for scholarships.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) and (c):
ExplntnTxt: Due to the timing of our year-end and the summer semester, some scholarships are refunded in one fiscal year, but were awarded in the previous fiscal year. This results in credit balances for these grants.
Student awards, grants and loans are awarded on basis of need. Scholarships are awarded based upon need and academic or special achievements.

STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT THEIR FAFSA FEDERAL FORM TO DOCUMENT THEIR NEED FOR FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. ONCE THE FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED, THE GRANTS ARE TRANSMITTED TO THE STUDENTS' INSTITUTIONAL ACCOUNTS TO PAY FOR TUITION CHARGES, THERE IS ALSO A FOLLOW UP PROCESS DURING THE SEMESTER AND SCHOOL YEAR TO ENSURE ACADEMIC CREDITS COMPLETION AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BEFORE ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS STUDENT AID BASED ON ENROLLMENT, NEED BASED ON THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND THE ABILITY TO MEET CERTAIN DONOR SPECIFIED CRITERIA.

Appalachian Bible College awards various scholarships to students for the purpose of assisting with tuition and related college expenses. Students must meet eligibility requirements before funds are awarded. Awards are applied directly to student accounts.

PACIFIC LUTHERAN UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.

The University awards scholarships to individual students based upon financial need, scholastic ability and other criteria. Monitoring of each student's enrollment status and GPA occurs throughout the award period to ensure grant criteria are met. No cash changes hands and funds are directly applied to student accounts.
Scholarships and Tuition Discounts are awarded based on demonstrated financial need and mission compatibilty of the student. Scholarships are applied directly to the student account.

WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID A STUDENT WILL RECEIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FIRST CALCULATES HOW MUCH THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD. THIS CALCULATION RELIES ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION: 1) A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA); AND 2) A FINANCIAL AID PROFILE; BOTH OF WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY THE FAMILY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE THAT FILLS THE GAP BETWEEN THE CALCULATED AMOUNT THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD AND THE COST OF ATTENDING MACALESTER COLLEGE. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SMALL GRANTS TO NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO MAKE OUR NEIGHBORHOOD A VIBRANT PLACE TO LIVE, AND TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS COMMITTED TO AREA LIVABILITY ISSUES. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT DESCRIBING USE OF GRANT FUNDS AT LEAST ANNUALLY OR AT THE CLOSE OF A SPECIFIC PROJECT. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SUBAWARDS FROM GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT AID IN THE RESEARCH BEING CONDUCTED. SUBRECIPIENTS MUST SUBMIT DETAILED REPORTS OF EXPENDITURES BEFORE MACALESTER WILL REIMBURSE THEM.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
THE COLLEGE OF THE MENOMINEE NATION FOLLOWS ITS POLICIES REGARDING GRANT APPLICANTS. GRANTS ARE FURTHER CONDITIONED ON SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS. ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SERVICE TO COMMUNITY, LEADERSHIP AND INVOLVEMENT IN SCHOOL ACTIVITIES. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE OFFERED FOR FOUR YEARS OF STUDY FOR FRESHMEN AND UNTIL THE COMPLETION OF DEGREE REQUIREMENTS FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. ALL STUDENTS MUST MEET THE STATED CRITERIA TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS EARNED BY THE STUDENT FROM EXTERNAL FUNDING SOURCES ARE FULLY CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITHOUT REDUCING ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS OFFERED BY OTTAWA UNIVERSITY. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES BASED ON A COMPETITIVE REVIEW BY THE GRANTING DEPARTMENT. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE AVAILABLE IN MUSIC, ART, THEATRE, FORENSICS, AND DEBATE. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE OFFERED ON THE BASIS OF AN EVALUATION BY THE COACH OF EACH SPORT. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS NEED BASED GRANTS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE AN EXCEPTIONAL LEVEL OF NEED AND THE POTENTIAL TO SUCCEED. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO BEING A RESIDENTIAL CAMPUS. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO LIVE ON-CAMPUS. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO HELP STUDENTS MEET A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE DIRECT COST OF EDUCATION THROUGH A COMBINATION OF RESOURCES. STUDENTS ARE HIGHLY ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR ADDITIONAL GRANTS, WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND LOW-INTEREST LOANS. THE ADMINISTRATIVE SOFTWARE MONITORS FINANCIAL AID ON AN ONGOING BASIS FOR GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER AID THAT MAY BE PENDING, AWARDED, ETC. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN POSTED TO THE GENERAL LEDGER AS WELL FOR BALANCING/REPORTING PURPOSES.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES AND PROCESSES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY. FUNDS ISSUED TO STUDENTS MAY NOT EXCEED THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND ARE POSTED TO THE SAME STUDENT ACCOUNT WHERE TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD ARE POSTED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS. UPON APPROVAL, FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AS AN OFFSET AGAINST CHARGES SUCH AS TUITION AND FEES. GRANTS CANNOT EXCEED THE STUDENT'S COST OF ATTENDANCE (COA). IN THE EVENT THAT THE COA IS REDUCED DUE TO A DECREASE IN THE STUDENT'S COURSE LOAD OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES IMPACTING SCHOOL CHARGES, THE RELATED GRANT IS ACCORDINGLY REDUCED.
Grants will only be made to 501(c)(3) organizations to ensure the funds will be used properly.

- GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED ON A DAILY BASIS VIA THE UNIVERSITY'S DAILY BUDGET REPORT. - GRANT FUNDS ARE LOCATED IN A CERTAIN DEPARTMENTAL SEQUENCE WITHIN THE GENERAL LEDGER. - UPON A GRANT BEING AWARDED A BUDGET REVISION IS CREATED BY DIRECTOR OF GRANT ACCOUNTING FOR THE CORRESPONDING AMOUNT OF THE AWARD. - GRANT FUNDS ARE RECEIVED IN THE FORM OF CHECK, ACH OR THEY ARE DRAWN DOWN VIA THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S G5 WEBSITE. - GRANT FUNDS ARE DEPOSITED INTO THE CORRESPONDING GRANTS INCOME LINE. - STATE AND FEDERAL GRANT, THE FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED AND THE ACCOUNTS HAVE BEEN RECONCILED FOR ACCURACY. - DRAW DOWN AND RECONCILIATION OF GRANT FUNDS ARE COMPLETED ON A MONTH BASIS. - RECEIPT OF FUNDS ARE DOCUMENT IN TWO SEPARATE LOCATIONS. WITHIN THE GENERAL LEDGER AS WELL AS IN THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANT SOFTWARE, AMPLIFUND. - AT YEAR END, JUNE 30, A RECONCILIATION IS COMPLETED OF THE ENTIRE GRANT DEPARTMENT TO ENSURE ACCURACY OF EXPENSES AND REVENUE.
THE COLLEGE HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ARE FOLLOWED IN ORDER TO AWARD STUDENTS INSTITUTIONAL AID.

Each charitable contribution or scholarship is monitored by Franciscan Missionaries of Our Lady University. The University has set different levels of monitoring depending upon the amount of the contribution or scholarship. Donor restrictions, if applicable, are considered in the level of monitoring performed.
THE FUNDS ARE USED AS SCHOLARSHIPS AT GRATZ COLLEGE AND ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED TO THE RECIPIENT'S TUITION

The University monitors their respective grants by establishing a separate accounting for each individual grant. All transactions are reviewed and approved by appropriate personnel prior to submission for processing to ensure they meet the requirements of the grant.

For all scholarship funds, student financial services has established specific criteria in regards to eligibility and selection. The eligibility requirements of the students are documented and monitored for compliance. The actual scholarships are credited to the student's tuition bills. No scholarships or grants are awarded directly to the recipients.
FINANCIAL AID VERIFIES ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDS APPROPRIATELY. FUNDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO COVER FEES. NO OVER-AWARDING IS PERMITTED.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 DAVIDSON COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND METHODOLOGIES FOR DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. FOR MERIT-BASED GRANTS, DAVIDSON AWARDS THE GRANTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STIPULATIONS OF THE UNDERLYING GOVERNING INSTRUMENT (I.E. DONOR ENDOWMENT AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DONOR DOCUMENTATION). DAVIDSON MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS OF COMPLIANCE FOR ALL GRANTS DISBURSED.

THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT AUDITABLE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN SUPPORT OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT CHARGES TO GRANTS, CONTRACTS, OR AGREEMENTS. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR INITIALLY APPROVES ALL EXPENDITURES OF A SPONSORED PROJECT AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING WHETHER THE SPONSOR WILL ALLOW AN ITEM OF DIRECT COST, BEFORE THE EXPENDITURE IS PROCESSED. IN ADDITION, THESE EXPENDITURES ARE ALSO CLOSELY REVIEWED AND MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS BEFORE THE EXPENDITURE REQUISITION IS APPROVED FOR PAYMENT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY UTILIZED FOR THE PURPOSES SPECIFIED IN THE GRANT CONTRACT/AGREEMENT.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY OF EACH STUDENT WHO APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID, USING FORMULAS AND CRITERIA PROMULGATED BY VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL BODIES, AS WELL AS MARYWOOD'S INTERNALLY ESTABLISHED RULES AND PROCEDURES.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US AU PARTNERS WITH OTHER UNIVERSITIES AS NECESSARY TO PERFORM THE SCOPE OF THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE GRANTS AGREEMENTS. PRIOR TO ENGAGING WITH THESE SUB-AWARDEES, AU PERFORMS A RISK ASSESSMENT INCLUDING A REVIEW OF THE MOST RECENT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS WELL AS ENSURING THEY ARE NOT LISTED AS A DEBARRED ENTITY WITH ANY FEDERAL AGENCY. AU WORKS TO MONITOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS EXPENDED USING ITS PROCESSES AND CONTROLS INHERENT IN AU'S SYSTEM. BEFORE SELECTING THE RECIPIENT AND PERIODICALLY AS REQUIRED DURING THE GRANT OR SCHOLARSHIP TERM, AU IMPOSES ITS INSTITUTIONAL CRITERIA AND THE DONOR'S (WHEN APPLICABLE) TO MAKE SURE THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSES. THIS MONITORING IS DONE THROUGH A COLLABORATION OF VARIOUS DEPARTMENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY. PERIODIC SPENDING REPORTS ARE PULLED TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL OVERSIGHT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AS NECESSARY TO REPORT BACK TO DONORS ON THE STATUS OF THEIR GIFTS.

GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE US ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND SIMILAR STANDARDS. APPROXIMATELY 75% OF FULL TIME FRESHMEN APPLIED FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY OUR STUDENT ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOR PROPER USE AND AWARDING. ALL GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS ARE FOLLOWED AND DOCUMENTED IN THE SAS OFFICE RECORDS.

NORTHWEST NAZARENE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF ITS GRANT FUNDS AS REQUIRED BY THE INDIVIDUAL GRANT PROGRAMS AND DONOR CRITERIA ESTABLISHED AT THE TIME OF THE ORIGINAL DONATION. THESE ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE ANNUAL AUDITING PROCESS AS WELL AS THROUGH FEDERAL AND STATE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. ISIR/FAFSA AND HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS SHOWING ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE STUDENT'S FILE FOR A PERIOD OF 7 YEARS AFTER THE STUDENT WITHDRAWS OR FINISHES THEIR PROGRAMS. GRANT AMOUNTS APPEAR ON THE AWARD LETTER IN THE FILE AS WELL AS ON THE INDIVIDUAL'S FINANCIAL AID RECORD IN THE DATABASE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NETTED AGAINST STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS.

THE UNIVERSITY ASSIGNS RESPONSIBILITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF RESEARCH FUNDS TO THE OFFICE OF POST AWARD FINANCIAL OPERATIONS. THIS OFFICE MONITORS ALL DOMESTIC SUBRECIPIENT GRANT MAKING ACTIVITY, INCLUDING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS CHARGED TO RESEARCH GRANTS, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES AND THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS ARE VERIFIED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE.

BOSTON UNIVERSITY SCHOOLS, COLLEGES, AND THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MAKE EVERY EFFORT TO ASSIST STUDENTS WITH CALCULATED FINANCIAL ELIGIBILITY AND HIGH ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, MEASURED AGAINST THE CREDENTIALS OF OTHER ACCEPTED STUDENTS. A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD IS AN IMPORTANT FACTOR IN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY FOR BOSTON UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED GRANTS. KEY INDICATORS SUCH AS HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA), RANK IN CLASS, AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES ARE CONSIDERED, AS WELL AS THE STRENGTH OF THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PROGRAM AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. ALL GRANTS AND OTHER STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS DESIGNATED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY. THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED $14,995,316 OF FUNDING UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT), USED TO PROVIDE EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2020.

Institutional scholarship funds are awarded by the PNWU Scholarship Committee after receiving authorization from the Controller/Finance office and according to the donor guidelines. All recipients reside in the US and funds are for US institutions. CARES Act student grants were awarded to students by two methods. In the first method, PNWU determined a $200 automatic emergency financial aid grant per eligible student. In the second method, eligible students could request additional funds (not over federal Pell grant maximum). Requests were approved by the Student Cares Team and authorized by the CFO. All recipients reside in the US and funds are for US institutions.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLEGE'S AND FEDERAL AGENCY POLICIES. AMOUNTS GIVEN ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT.

ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S. DUKE UNIVERSITY PERIODICALLY APPROVES GRANTS AND TRANSFERS GRANT FUNDS TO NUMEROUS ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES. FOR SUBGRANT RECIPIENTS, A SERIES OF INTERNAL CONTROLS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED WHICH INCLUDE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER AN AUDIT WILL BE REQUIRED. DUKE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED A DETAILED AND COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROCESS WHICH ENSURES PROPER PURPOSE AND USE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS PRIOR TO ENGAGEMENT. FOLLOWING THE PROCUREMENT PROCESS, DUKE UNIVERSITY MONITORS SUBSEQUENT BILLING AND PERFORMANCE OF THE GRANT RECIPIENTS. INVOICES MUST BE SUBMITTED ACCORDING TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS WHICH MIRROR THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE ULTIMATE GRANTOR. PRIOR TO PAYMENT, CENTRALIZED DEPARTMENTS REVIEW DOCUMENTATION TO ENSURE THE EXPENSES ARE ALLOWABLE WITHIN THE TERMS OF THE GRANT. ULTIMATELY, THE ORGANIZATIONS AWARDED THESE GRANTS MUST MONITOR THE APPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IN THE ORDINARY COURSE OF BUSINESS AND REPORT SUCH INFORMATION TO DUKE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS' INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS POSTED DIRECTLY TO THEIR BURSAR ACCOUNTS. THEREFORE, SUCH FUNDS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO APPROPRIATE CHARGES WITHIN THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. GRANT/FELLOWSHIP PAYMENTS ARE PROCESSED ACCORDING TO AWARD LETTERS, WHICH ARE REVIEWED AND SUBMITTED TO THE RECIPIENT IN ADVANCE OF ACCEPTING FOR THE APPLICABLE SEMESTER. EACH PAYMENT IS PREPARED ACCORDING TO THE AWARD LETTER BY A DEPARTMENTAL REPRESENTATIVE, WHICH IS THEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY A DEPARTMENTAL SUPERVISOR. PRIOR TO ISSUANCE, A FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL IS PROCESSED BY THE CENTRAL PAYMENT PROCESSING DEPARTMENT.

The University awards grants, scholarships & student loans based on various, predefined criteria. Students must qualify for the assistance. Student enrollment and continuing eligibility are verified on an ongoing basis. Amounts are applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN POLICIES REGARDING THE AWARDING OF SPECIFIC GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. SELECTION CRITERIA AND ELEGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE TYPE, PURPOSE, AND/OR RESTRICTION OF THE AWARD. AWARDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FOR GRANTS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE, GRANTS ARE CONTROLLED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONSIBLE PERSON ON CAMPUS, WHO IS TYPICALLY THE PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR THE GRANT. ALL PROPOSED EXPENDITURES FROM THE GRANT MUST BE APPROVED BY THAT PERSON. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE INVOICE FOR APPROPRIATENESS WITH THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, REVIEWS THE ACTUAL TRANSACTION TO MAKE SURE THAT IT IS ADEQUATELY SUPPORTED, AND REVIEWS THE TRANSACTION TO BE SURE THAT IT IS AN ALLOWABLE EXPENSE UNDER FEDERAL LAW. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED ITS OWN SET OF GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS TO SEGREGATE THE EXPENSES AND GRANT INCOME FROM OTHER EXPENDITURES AND REVENUES OF THE COLLEGE. IF THE GRANT IS A REIMBURSEMENT GRANT, THE COLLEGE PERIODICALLY DRAWS FUNDS DOWN FROM THE GRANTOR BASED ON THE ACTUAL EXPENSES INCURRED. WHEN REPORTS ARE DUE TO THE GOVERNMENT OR OTHER GRANTOR, THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON PREPARES THE REPORT WITH ASSISTANCE OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT. TYPICALLY, THESE REPORTS ARE SIGNED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON AND THE CFO OR PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE CERTIFYING THE ACCURACY OF THE REPORT. GRANTS SHOWN ON PART III ARE SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED IN TWO FORMS. FIRST, SOME SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY DONOR GIFTS OR INVESTMENT INCOME FROM DONOR GIFTS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE GRANTED AS THE DONOR HAS SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT. THE STUDENT MUST MEET THE DESIGNATED REQUIREMENTS OF THE DONOR. SECOND, THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS FROM GENERAL COLLEGE REVENUES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEEDS WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH INDUSTRY STANDARDS.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS. INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC MERIT OR AFFILIATION CRITERIA. RECIPIENTS OT TUITION REMISSION AND EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FOR WILSON COLLEGE EMPLOYEES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FROM OTHER COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

VF AWARDS INTERNAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE CADET'S GRADES (GPA) FROM HIS/HER PREVIOUS SCHOOL AND FINANCIAL NEED. THERE IS A MATRIX USED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED TO EACH CADET. THERE ARE ALSO AID AWARDS WHICH ARE BASED ON SUBMITTED FAFSA FORMS. BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS HAVE CHARTS DETERMINING AID SUCH AS THROUGH PHEAA AND PELL GRANTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA IDENTIFIED FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. APPLICATIONS ARE RECEIVED FROM STUDENTS AND REVIEWED BY THE RESPECTIVE COMMITTEE, EITHER THE FACULTY OR THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE AWARDS.

THE COLLEGE REVIEWS ALL AMERICAN SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA'S EXPENDITURES FOR WHICH ITS GRANTS ARE INTENDED. ASSISTANCE FOR INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IS PROVIDED THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE AND COLLEGE PROGRAMS AND EXTERNAL AGENCIES. THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERS THESE PROGRAMS. TYPICALLY, FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AWARDS ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED (AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, STATE AGENCIES, THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICES, AND BARD COLLEGE), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND PROMISE. THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID DISTRIBUTIONS. STUDENTS APPLY FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FASFA FORM WHICH DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS PERIODICALLY MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT GRANT AWARDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

The College follows federal, state, donor, and institutional guidelines for determining eligibility for scholarships, prizes, and other grants and awards. The College maintains records showing the selection criteria, recipient eligibility, how funds may be used, and any related party. Before paying grants to other entities, the College obtains documentation showing the recipient is eligible to receive deductible charitable contributions. Grants awarded by the Office of Financial Aid are credited directly to student accounts. Other grants are monitored in various ways, including reimbursing actual substantiated expenses, requiring written reports, and/or visiting sites of activities funded by the College grants.
Scholarships and other types of financial assistance are monitored through internal transfer of funds within the university.

POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR DISBURSEMENTS ARE SET BY THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD. INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS ONLY FOR TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD. THE FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE USED FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. THE GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL REGULATION. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A MONITORING POLICY FOR THE GRANTS, WHEN THEY ARE AWARDED A BUDGET IS APPROVED ESTABLISHING THE ALLOWABLE EXPENSES UNDER THE GRANT. IN THE CASE OF FUNDS PAID TO ANOTHER PERSON OR ENTITY THROUGH SUBCONTRACTING, PMSF HAS A WRITTEN POLICY ESTABLISHING REPORTING AND MONITORING GUIDELINES TO OVERSEE SUBCONTRACT. ONE OF THE REQUIREMENTS IS THAT SUB-RECIPIENTS HAVE PERFORMED AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133. SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE PMSF A DOCUMENT INDICATING THAT THEY MEET THE ESTABLISHED REQUIREMENTS AND PROVIDE A COPY OF THE A-133 REPORT. PMSF ALSO PERFORMS SITE VISITS AND REQUIRES THE SUB-RECIPIENT TO SUBMIT PROGRESS. PMSF HAS A COMPLIANCE OFFICE THAT APPROVES EVERY DISBURSEMENT AFTER VERIFYING THAT IT MEETS FEDERAL REGULATIONS. DISBURSEMENTS APPROVED BY THE COMPLIANCE OFFICE ARE THEN SUBMITTED TO THE BUDGET DEPARTMENT FOR APPROVAL OF THE DISBURSEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BUDGET APPROVED BY THE GRANTING AGENCY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II GW HILLEL
ExplntnTxt: IN RECOGNITION OF THE SERVICES THAT GW HILLEL PROVIDES TO STUDENTS AT GW, GW AND GW HILLEL CONDUCTED A JOINT FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN FOR THE RENOVATION, MAINTENANCE, FURNISHINGS, AND ENDOWMENT OF GW HILLEL'S FACILITIES LOCATED ON THE GW CAMPUS. ALL RESTRICTED CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED BY GW UNDER THE CAMPAIGN ARE AWARDED AS GRANTS TO GW HILLEL UNDER THE TERMS OF THE JOINT FUNDRAISING AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENT AND ORGANIZATIONS: GW MAINTAINS A FORMAL SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING POLICY WHICH APPLIES TO ALL SUBAWARDS ISSUED UNDER ALL SPONSORED PROJECTS AWARDED. THE POLICY APPLIES TO SUBRECIPIENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONDUCTING A PORTION OF GW'S SPONSORED PROJECT WORK. GW IS RESPONSIBLE TO THE SPONSOR FOR MANAGEMENT OF FUNDS AND FOR MEETING PERFORMANCE GOALS. GW HAS INTERNAL PROCEDURES FOR ASSESSING THE SUBRECIPIENT ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATUS AND INTERNAL CONTROLS IN ORDER TO DETERMINE WHETHER TO PROCEED WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT. BASED ON THE ASSESSMENT, TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE ESTABLISHED IN THE SUBAWARD AGREEMENT TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE LEVEL OF PERCEIVED RISK AND IDENTIFY SPECIFIC MONITORING ACTIVITIES. GW UNDERTAKES CERTAIN ACTIVITIES TO MONITOR SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE REASONABLE ASSURANCE THAT THEY ADMINISTER, PERFORM AND ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PRIME AWARD AND GW'S SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS. RISK ASSESSMENT AND AWARD MONITORING PROCEDURES ARE DEFINED BY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES AT GW AND INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR, DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS, CENTRAL RESEARCH, AND FINANCIAL OFFICES WITHIN GW. GW HILLEL ONLY - THE ORGANIZATION PRESENTED PLANS FOR THE RENOVATION, MAINTENANCE, FURNISHING, AND ENDOWMENT OF GW HILLEL'S FACILITIES LOCATED ON THE GW CAMPUS. DETAILS, SUCH AS BUDGETS, ARE PROVIDED TO GW ON REQUEST IN CONNECTION WITH ITS REVIEW. A REPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO GW UPON COMPLETION OF THE RENOVATION. MEDICAL FACULTY ASSOCIATES, INC. JOINT FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN ONLY - MFA AGREES TO SPEND PHILANTHROPICALLY RAISED FUNDS CONSISTENT WITH DONOR INTENT AND TO PROVIDE ANNUAL REPORTS ON THE USE OF EXPENSED FUNDS AND RELATED DETAIL TO GW. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS RECORDS ON ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM THAT SUBSTANTIATES THE AMOUNT GRANTED TO EACH STUDENT, THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR EACH STUDENT, AND THE SELECTION PROCESS USED IN AWARDING ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE INITIALLY CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IN ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO PAY FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND/OR TEXTBOOK CHARGES. A CHANGE IN ENROLLMENT STATUS RESULTS IN WEEKLY REPORTS THAT FINANCIAL AID STAFF REVIEW FOR POSSIBLE ADJUSTMENTS. THE BALANCE OF AID IN EXCESS OF THE ABOVE CHARGES CAN BE REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES. THE SYSTEM CHECKS THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ENROLLED BEFORE ISSUING THE REFUND. AT THE GRADUATE LEVEL, AWARDS ARE INITIATED, CHECKED TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY AND APPROVED BEFORE AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO A STUDENT AND A STUDENT MUST ACCEPT THE AWARD BEFORE PAYMENT PROCESSES BEGIN. QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENDOWMENT AWARDS ARE CHECKED AND THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDS ARE CHECKED FOR EVERY ENDOWMENT AWARDEE. PAPERWORK IS KEPT IN THE OFFICE FOR THREE YEARS AND THE AWARD LETTERS ELECTRONICALLY FOR FIVE YEARS. OUR ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS, BANNER AND EAS, HAVE THE RECORDS OF PAYMENTS.

EACH ACADEMIC YEAR THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT PROVIDES THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID A DETAILED LIST OF THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS, ALONG WITH THE CURRENT MARKET VALUE OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP, AND STATED CRITERIA RESTRICTIONS, IF ANY, REQUIRED FOR RECIPIENTS OF THOSE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, FROM THAT LIST PROVIDED BY THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL AID, MATCHES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE INSTITUTIONAL AID WITH THOSE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE. THE LIST OF MATCHES IS THEN RETURNED TO THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID AND ADMISSION OFFICES. ANNUAL REVIEW OF QUALIFICATIONS FOR EACH LEVEL OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS DONE AFTER THE SPRING TERM. SATISFACTORY PROGRESS GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION ARE FOLLOWED FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING ANY TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP AID. OUR ADVANCEMENT OFFICE ASSIGNS ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS (FUNDED INSTITUTIONAL AID) REPRESENTS LESS THAN 20% OF OUR AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS.

Need Scholarships: Manhattan College awards grants-in-aid to accepted students who demonstrate financial need. These awards are renewed annually and adjusted in line with changes on the FAFSA. These awards are given for a maximum of four years (eight semesters). Grant recipients must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Full time enrollment is necessary to receive grant. Academic Scholarships: Eligibility is based on exceptional SAT or ACT scores, secondary school grade point average, and rank in class. The amount of the Scholarship is determined at the time of admission and is offered for four years (eight semesters maximum) provided the student remains eligible. Athletic Scholarships: Manhattan College has available a strictly-budgeted fund to offer grants-in-aid to students who, by the possession of certain athletic skills can add to the community spirit and morale of the campus. The College firmly states that recipients must come to Manhattan as students, with their first interest in studies. They must meet the same entrance requirements as other students and must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Manhattan adheres to and endorses the principles and policies of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference, Eastern College Athletic Conference and the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Graduate Scholarships are awarded as part of grants, grad assistance or by departments. HEOP Scholarships are awarded as part of the New York State Program. Endowment scholarships are awarded based upon the donors written restrictions.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE THREE MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID, AND FINANCING ALTERNATIVES. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AWARDS THE GRANT MONIES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE TOTAL AMOUNTS GIVEN BY GRANT.

SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 2: AS PART OF THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT), DOMINICAN UNIVERSITY RECEIVED A FEDERAL GRANT AS PART OF THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF). OF THAT AMOUNT $466,200 WAS GRANTED TO 1,237 STUDENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS SEVERAL TYPES OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS UPON ADMISSION AND CREDITED AGAINST THEIR TUITION EACH QUARTER AS LONG AS GPA REQUIREMENTS ARE MET AND MAINTAINED. GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE AND VERIFIED THROUGH THE STUDENT RECORDS PROGRAM. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE UPON ADMISSION BASED ON APPLICATION AND ESSAY SUBMISSION. THE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE ONE TIME OR RECUR EACH QUARTER, DEPENDING ON THE TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP. THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT MONITORS APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS, AND THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE REGISTRAR, MONITORS QUARTERLY ELIGIBILITY OF RECURRING SCHOLARSHIPS. OTHER LIMITED ONE-TIME SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE AWARDED AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT. THE CURRENT YEAR DISBURSEMENTS WERE FUNDED BY THE SCHOOL AS LENDER PROGRAM.

FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED CONSISTENT WITH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT. THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICES MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.
THE USE OF FUNDS IS MONITORED VIA THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE PROCESS. ALL FUNDS DISBURSED ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE WITH DONOR INTENT.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF FUNDS TO ENHANCE ITS RESEARCH AGENDA AND PROVIDE VALUABLE TRAINING IN POLICY ANALYSIS, THE RAND CORPORATION PARTICIPATES IN A NUMBER OF PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE FUNDING FOR FELLOWSHIPS. OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS, AGENCIES, AND FOUNDATIONS OCCASIONALLY MAKE FELLOWSHIPS AVAILABLE THROUGH GRANTS AWARDED TO RAND. SUCH OPPORTUNITIES ARE GENERALLY WIDELY ADVERTISED AND A COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROCESS DETERMINES THE FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENT. FELLOWSHIP FUNDS ARE SEGREGATED AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVELY MONITORS SPENDING TO ENSURE ANY AND ALL REQUIREMENTS ARE MET, WHICH INCLUDES SUBMITTING PROGRESS REPORTS ATTESTING TO THE WORK COMPLETED BY THESE FELLOWS.

The College has established programs for each type of scholarship and awards funds according to the parameters of each program and as funding is available. The scholarships and grants are awarded to students to be used for educational expenses at the College including tuition, fees, and books. The awards are allocated directly to each student's account.

ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE THAT ARE PROVIDED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE ARE PART OF A NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM THAT ASSISTS STUDENTS WITH THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. BESIDES GRANTS, THE ONLY OTHER ASSISTANCE OFFERED IS A NEED-BASED EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, THE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY FOR THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA USED TO AWARD THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE. ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE CAREFULLY MONITORED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE. THE AMOUNTS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY INTO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND CONSEQUENTLY, THE COLLEGE HAS FULL CONTROL OVER HOW THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE USED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants and other assistance awarded to individuals in the U.S. represent student financial aid. Student financial aid awards are determined by the university's assessment of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Student financial services continuously monitors student eligibility for these awards. Student financial services is responsible for regulatory compliance. Student financial services ensures equity by applying all need analysis formulas consistently across the institution's population of student financial aid applicants and provides services that do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, disability, age, or economic status. The university receives various forms of financial aid from the government to support financial assistance provided to the students. The types of government assistance the university receives include the following: -Federal Pell Grant -Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant (SEOG) -Federal Direct Loan Program -Federal Work Study Program The university receives government funding to support its organized research programs. These governmental grants help to further the university's mission by supporting organized research efforts in the areas of education, training, and public services. The public agencies that support the university's research activities are: -National Science Foundation -Department of Health and Human Services -United States Department of Education -United States Department of Energy -United States Department of Defense -Department of Veteran Affairs -The National Endowment for the Arts -The National Endowment for the Humanities

THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE ASSISTANCE TO COMPLETE APPLICATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE AND DEMONSTRATE THEIR NEED. ONCE ASSISTANCE IS RECEIVED BY A STUDENT THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT THE COURSES FOR WHICH ASSISTANCE WAS RECEIVED ARE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED.
To be considered for need based aid, a student is required to complete a Free Application for Federal Student Aid. Financial aid awards are not automatically renewed each year.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED. COLLEGE FUNDED INSTITUTIONAL AND ENDOWED GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE COLLEGE MONITORS THESE GRANTS AND AWARDS BY SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT RECIPIENTS ARE MAINTAINING THE MINIMUM STANDARDS REQUIRED TO RECEIVE THE GRANT OR AWARD.
The Institutions scholarship committee awards scholarships on a non-discriminatory basis, considering academic qualifications or distinctive scholarship criteria.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 LONG ISLAND UNIVERSITY OFFERS A NUMBER OF INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS ENROLLED IN DEGREE PROGRAMS. EACH GRANT OR OTHER FORMS OF ASSISTANCE HAVE SPECIFIC AWARDING CRITERIA AND INDIVIDUAL RULES FOR SELECTION BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND/OR PERFORMANCE. THE CAMPUS ENROLLMENT SERVICES OFFICES ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR PREPARING INDIVIDUAL STUDENT AWARD PACKAGES. THE DISBURSAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS SEGREGATED AND PERFORMED BY THE CENTRAL FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE POSTS TRANSACTIONS TO EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, INTERNAL CONTROLS ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE AMOUNTS ARE AWARDED ACCURATELY TO STUDENTS WHO PROPERLY MEET AND MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS ARE ROUTINELY RECONCILED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S ERP SYSTEM AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE CONSISTENTLY MONITORED BY ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF.
NATIONAL UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE GRANTEES RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY PURPOSES. GRANTEES ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE THROUGH PERIODIC REPORTS AND SITE INSPECTIONS.

Procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds - Defiance College awards financial aid on the basis of demostrated need determined in conjunction with the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA). Defiance College scholarships are awared to eligible students in varying amounts up to full tuition the first year and are renewed each year according to established renewal requirements. Defiance College awards are coordinated with federal, state, and other outside financial aid award programs.

FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO INCOMING FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND BY THE USE OF A FINANCIAL AID MATRIX. THE FINANCIAL AID MATRIX IS BASED ON ACADEMIC ABILITY AND FINANCIAL NEED. WITHIN EACH CELL OF THE MATRIX THERE IS A FLOOR AND A CEILING RANGE USED FOR THE AWARDING OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS. A STUDENT IS PLACED INTO A FINANCIAL AID MATRIX CELL BASED ON BOTH HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND SAT AND/OR ACT SCORES. THE AMOUNT A STUDENT IS AWARDED BETWEEN THE FLOOR AND CEILING VALUE IN THE CELL IS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA. INSTITUTIONAL MERIT AWARDS (AWARDED BY ADMISSIONS) THESE ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS REGARDLESS OF FINANCIAL NEED. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS (UNFUNDED AID) ACCEPTED FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ARE AWARDED A MERIT SCHOLARSHIP DETERMINED BY WHERE THEY FALL IN THE MATRIX BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND SAT AND/OR ACT SCORES. THE MERIT SCHOLARSHIP AWARD IS THE FLOOR VALUE FROM THE RESPECTIVE MATRIX CELL. STUDENTS WHO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE TOP MERIT SCHOLARSHIP ARE FURTHER CONSIDERED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE FOR WESTMINSTER COLLEGE'S FULL TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS, THE PRESIDENTIAL AND THE LEMMON SCHOLARSHIPS. THERE ARE A LIMITED NUMBER OF EACH OF THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. NOMINATED MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS (UNFUNDED AID) THE NOMINATED SCHOLARSHIPS AVAILABLE TO INCOMING FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ARE: 1) THE YOUNG PRESBYTERIAN SCHOLARSHIP -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST BE A MEMBER OF THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH USA, BE NOMINATED BY HIS/HER CHURCH AND PRESENT A MINIMUM GPA OF 3.5. 2) JERB MILLER SCHOLARSHIP -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST BE NOMINATED BY AN EDUCATOR WHO IS A WESTMINSTER COLLEGE GRADUATE AND PRESENT A MINIMUM GPA OF 3.5. 3) LEGACY SCHOLARSHIP (FUNDED AID) -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST PRESENT A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 AND HAVE A PARENT OR GRANDPARENT WHO EARNED A DEGREE FROM WESTMINSTER COLLEGE. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO THREE YEARS. THE STUDENT NEEDS TO MAINTAIN THE REQUIRED SCHOLARSHIP GPA (IF ONE EXISTS), OTHERWISE REMAIN IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS (UNFUNDED AID) NEED BASED INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA AND THE DETERMINATION OF THE STUDENTS DEMONSTRATED NEED. A STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO FILE A FAFSA FORM IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA DETERMINE THE STUDENT'S EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC). THE CALCULATION USED TO DETERMINE THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED IS: COST OF ATTENDANCE* - EFC = STUDENT'S NEED (*COST OF ATTENDANCE: TUITION & FEES, ROOM & BOARD, BOOKS AND PERSONAL EXPENSES FOR RESIDENT AND OFF CAMPUS STUDENTS, TUITION & FEES, COMMUTER COSTS, BOOKS AND PERSONAL EXPENSES FOR COMMUTERS) THE CALCULATED STUDENT NEED IS REDUCED BY: FEDERAL NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID STATE NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID FUNDED GIFT AID INSTITUTIONAL MERIT AID THE REMAINING UNMET NEED, AFTER THE REDUCTIONS, IS MET BY USING INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED GIFT AID WITH THE TOTAL OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BEING CAPPED BY THE CEILING VALUE FROM THE MATRIX CELL FOR THE STUDENT. INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS ARE USUALLY RENEWED PROVIDED THAT THE STUDENT CONTINUES TO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING STUDENTS RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE WHICH INCLUDES ALL ELIGIBLE AND QUALIFIED FINANCIAL AID. AWARDS THAT MAY BE INCLUDED IN A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE ARE: FEDERAL GRANTS (PELL AND SEOG) STATE GRANTS INSTITUTIONAL MERIT AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL ENDOWED AWARDS FEDERAL DIRECT STAFFORD LOANS FEDERAL WORK STUDY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL SERVICES DETERMINES THE AMOUNT AVAILABLE IN ALL INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. WESTMINSTER COLLEGE UNFUNDED AND FUNDED AID IS PORTABLE FOR OFF-CAMPUS STUDIES IF THE PROGRAM IS REQUIRED BY THE STUDENT'S MAJOR. THESE FUNDS ARE PORTABLE UP TO THE LESSER OF 1) THE TUITION OF THE OFF-CAMPUS STUDIES PROGRAM, OR 2) THE LIMIT OF A STUDENT'S WESTMINSTER COLLEGE AWARDED AID WHERE A PARTICULAR STUDY-ABROAD PROGRAM'S TUITION IS GREATER THAN THE WESTMINSTER COLLEGE AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT. BEFORE THESE FUNDS WILL BE PAID TO THE STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM ON THE STUDENT'S BEHALF, THE STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A COPY OF THE INVOICE FOR THE STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM, WITH A SEPARATE LINE ITEM FOR TUITION. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO HAVE THE INSTITUTION PROVIDE A COPY OF THE ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS FOR THE TERM(S) ABROAD TO WESTMINSTER COLLEGE. WESTMINSTER COLLEGES FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THE FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM POWERFAIDS TO MAINTAIN FINANCIAL AID AWARD RECORDS AND AMOUNTS.

EACH YEAR APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF VERIFY THE INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE APPLICATION AND AWARD EACH SCHOLARSHIP TO A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DOES NOT AWARD ANY AID TO A STUDENT WHO IS NOT ENROLLED. EACH SEMESTER A LIST OF ENROLLED STUDENTS IS COMPARED TO A LIST OF STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN AWARDED ANY TYPE OF FINANCIAL AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE INSTITUTE ASSIGNS RESPONSIBILITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ITS OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH. THIS OFFICE MONITORS ALL GRANT MAKING ACTIVITY INCLUDING ALL APPLICABLE COMPLIANCE REGULATIONS. MONITORING INCLUDES PERIODIC REVIEWS OF BUDGET TO ACTUAL REPORTS BY BOTH THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED ACCORDING TO THE AGREEMENT. EXPENSES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR ON AN ACCRUAL BASIS.

Our grant monitoring procedure brings together all key personnel involved in the grant at the onset of the award to discuss management, responsibilities, budgets, and reporting. This initial meeting is documented and disbursed to all involved. The actual grant monitoring is done by the hospital department implementing the grant. MedStar Corporate's Grants and Philanthropy Department ensures that each grant has a cost center and/or grant account set up based on the terms of the grant award. MedStar Corporate's Grants and Philanthropy Department also tracks and reminds hospital departments when progress reports are due througout the life of the grant.

All students who are applying for Federal financial aid are required to complete the FAFSA and the Gordon-Conwell financial aid application. The information obtained from these documents is used by the Financial Aid Office to determine eligibility of Federal and institutional aid. To assist with determining their eligibility, each student is assigned an institutional budget for the cost of attendance. This budget includes tuition, books and fees, room and board, health insurance, transportation, and a miscellaneous category. In general, Gordon-Conwell scholarships are either need-based or merit-based and any Gordon-Conwell aid that is awarded is factored into the eligibility for Federal aid.

Students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Scholarships are awarded on a non-discriminatory basis.
THE GRANTS (SCHOLARSHIPS) MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION AND FEES PAID BY THE STUDENT TO THE SCHOOL. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT SENT TO OUTSIDE ENTITIES.

Procedure for Monitoring Grants: Grants to organizations and individuals awarded for the purpose of conducting research are monitored as follows: Subcontracts are issued with a defined scope of work and a budget and include other terms and conditions such as frequency of required reporting. The faculty member at the University of Miami responsible for the grant monitors the scientific progress via site visits, correspondence, reports, etc. Invoices submitted for payments by the outside organization or by an individual are approved by the University of Miami Faculty member responsible for the grant.

Assistance to the University students in the form of scholarships are awarded for the purpose of aiding with the cost of attending the University (i.e., for tuition, housing and meals). Scholarships are based on need and academic achievement. Total scholarships, grants and loans cannot exceed the total cost of attendance. The University publishes criteria for the eligibility requirements needed to award a scholarship. The amount of aid awarded is based on a need analysis formula developed by the federal government and includes verification of the information submitted by the student.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON SUPERIOR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING AWARDS FROM JOHN CARROLL UNIVERSITY ARE CHOSEN BASED UPON OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY.

Students submit the Federal FAFSA and this form is reviewed to award scholarships and other tuition discounts. Students also receive awards based on service (athletics) as well as academic or extracurricular activities. The Director of Financial Aid and the VP of Enrollment appropriate records to substantiate any financial assistance students receive. That information is subject to annual audit under OMB A-133 for any federal money the school receives. Awards are credited to students' accounts. Accounts are reconciled throughout the year.
Student Financial Aid is credited to the individual student accounts and their net balances are monitored by the Business Office
Student Financial Aid is credited to the individual student accounts and their net balance are monitored by the Business Office

The Business office reviews the recipient's Form 990 and Uniform Guidance audit report if available. The Director of the program at VLS works closely with the recipient of the funds that will be paid by the grant to coordinate activities/training essential for program effectiveness. The recipient submits invoices to VLS which are reviewed and approved by the Program Director to substantiate the grant related purpose. The invoice is then forwarded to the business office for review and coding to the proper accounts. The funds are then forwarded to the recipient.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING PROCEDURES- FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS BY THE UNIVERSITY OF RICHMOND CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING THESE GRANTS ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY ON THE BASIS OF THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR CRITERIA. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND STANDARDS. GRANTS MADE TO ORGANIZATIONS LOCATED IN THE UNITED STATES WERE MADE PURSUANT TO THE UNIVERSITYS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR GRANT SUBAWARDS. SUBAWARD ACTIVITY IS MONITORED PRIMARILY BY THE GRANTS ACCOUNTING OFFICE. SUBAWARD DOCUMENTATION, INCLUDING INVOICES, RECEIPTS, PAYMENT REQUESTS, AND SIMILAR RECORDS, IS REVIEWED TO ENSURE THAT THEY COMPLY WITH INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES, THE REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE AND THE SPECIFIC GRANT AGREEMENT, AND HAVE THE APPROVAL OF THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR.

CCA MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT COMPLETE ADMISSION APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND PORTFOLIO REVIEW. NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WITH DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. RECIPIENTS OF NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND SEOG FUNDS MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION, BE US CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS, AND BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME.

DISBURSEMENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE INSTITUTION'S EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROCEDURES OR SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE INSTITUTION'S GOVERNING BOARD DESIGNED TO INSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM THIS ORGANIZATION IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS AS TO ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.
NATIONAL UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE GRANTEES RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY PURPOSES. GRANTEES ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE THROUGH PERIODIC REPORTS AND SITE INSPECTIONS.

The College reviews the fund balances for the endowed scholarships annually and the Board approves proposed amounts to award from the endowment scholarship funds each year. Other institutional scholarships and grants are included in the College's budget that is approved by the Board. Each scholarship or grant awarded has written criteria used to determine how the funds are awarded. College scholarships and grants awarded must first be applied to tuition, fees and housing charges (if applicable) before it can be disbursed to the student.

FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF EACH RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN LIMESTONE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. AS FUNDS ARE RECEIVED, THEY ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. FOR CARES EMERGENCY GRANTS, AWARDS WERE BASED ON NEED AND NOT REQUIRED TO BE SPENT BY THE RECIPIENTS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE THAT WOULD REQUIRED MONITORING AFTER THE GRANT FUNDS WERE AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART II, COLUMN H LINE 1 - SAINT ANNE'S SHRINE - THE CONTRIBUTION TO SAINT ANNE'S SHRINE WAS MADE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT OF THEIR MISSION TO SERVE AS A WELCOMING PLACE OF PEACE AND HOPE MINISTERING TO ALL GOD'S PEOPLE THROUGH PRAYER, DEVOTION, HOSPITALITY, AND SPIRITUAL RENEWAL. THE SHRINE WAS DEVELOPED AND MAINTAINED FOR THE PAST 100+ YEARS BY THE SOCIETY OF SAINT EDMUND, THE CATHOLIC RELIGIOUS COMMUNITY WHICH IS ALSO THE FOUNDER OF SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE SHARES A SIMILAR MISSION TO CONTRIBUTE THROUGH HIGHER EDUCATION TO THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE HUMAN PERSON AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF HUMAN CULTURE IN THE LIGHT OF THE CATHOLIC FAITH. ADDITIONAL LAND WAS ACQUIRED BY THE SOCIETY AND LODGING WAS CONSTRUCTED TO PROVIDE OVERNIGHT FACILITIES TO CONDUCT PROGRAMMING NEEDS OF THE COLLEGE FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF CAMPUS MINISTRY, STUDENT LIFE, ATHLETICS, AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. THE COLLEGE BENEFITS FROM USE OF THE FACILITIES AT THE SHRINE FOR CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENT, STUDENT AND STAFF RETREATS, AND WORSHIP. EMPLOYEES FROM CAMPUS MINISTRY AND OTHER COLLEGE EMPLOYEES WORK TO DEVELOP, MONITOR, AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMMING GOALS ENSURING THAT DONATIONS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. LINE 2 - NORTHEAST DISABLED ATHLETIC ASSOCIATION - THE CONTRIBUTION TO NORTHEAST DISABLED ATHLETIC ASSOCIATION (NDAA) WAS MADE TO SUPPORT THEIR MISSION TO PROVIDE RECREATIONAL AND COMPETITIVE ATHLETIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL DISABILITIES AND TO SUPPORT DISABLED ATHLETES IN THEIR PURSUIT OF EXCELLENCE. THIS ORGANIZATION WAS CHOSEN TO RECEIVE THIS DONATION BY THE COLLEGE'S STUDENT ASSOCIATION WHICH INVITES LOCAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO APPLY FOR A $10,000 DONATION THROUGH AN APPLICATIONS PROCESS. THREE ORGANIZATIONS ARE THEN CHOSEN TO EACH MAKE A PRESENTATION TO THE STUDENT BODY DESCRIBING THEIR ORGANIZATION AND ITS MISSION. THE COLLEGE'S STUDENTS THEN VOTE FOR THE ORGANIZATION THEY WANT TO RECEIVE THE DONATION. THE ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO COME BACK TO THE STUDENT ASSOCIATION IN TWO YEARS TO PRESENT THE IMPACT OF THE AWARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART III THE COLLEGE RECOGNIZES THE HIGH COST OF A PRIVATE EDUCATION AND ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS AS MUCH AS WE PRACTICALLY CAN TO CLOSE THE GAP BETWEEN THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND FAMILY RESOURCES USING A VARIETY OF SOURCES, INCLUDING FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL (COLLEGE) FUNDING. THE THREE TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WE EMPLOY INCLUDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS, AND STUDENT EMPLOYMENT. IN 2019-2020, THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERED OVER $56 MILLION IN ASSISTANCE, OF WHICH APPROXIMATELY $36 MILLION WAS PRIMARILY COLLEGE FUNDED AID, SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE'S PRACTICE HAS BEEN TO AWARD AID BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED TO ALL STUDENTS ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION. THE AMOUNT OF AID A STUDENT RECEIVES UPON INITIAL ENROLLMENT GENERALLY IS AWARDED FOR EACH YEAR HE/SHE ATTENDS SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE.

STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP, GRANTS, AND LOANS BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL FAFSA APPLICATIONS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE COLLEGE ARE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL AUDITS BY INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. IN ADDITION, COVID-19 CARES FUNDING PROVIDED THROUGH THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND - STUDENT AID PORTION WAS AWARDED TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS THE NUMBER OF GRANTS AWARDED FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR.

ALL FEDERAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DURING THE AWARD PROCESS. FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ARE RECONCILED TO THE AWARD BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE CONTROLLER. THE MONEY IS DISBURSED TO THOSE APPLICABLE STUDENTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE BURSAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

Part I Line 2 - The University maintains a formal policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to the University. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of a sponsored project in compliance with laws, regulations and terms and conditions of awards and subawards and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. The policy addresses the roles and responsibilities of the central offices and academic departments of the University and describes the monitoring procedures for each area. The full text of the Universitys Subrecipent Policy is available online at the following web address http//financialservices.wustl.edu/wfin-topic/sponsored-projects-accounting/.

The grants reported in Part III line 1 are scholarships to students. The use of scholarships is controlled by applying such amounts directly against balances owed by the student for tuition, fees and other qualifying educational expenses.

The grants reported in Part III line 2 are fellowships awarded to students who may use them to pay qualified educational expenses or to support their living expenses while completing their course of study. The use of fellowship awards is not monitored by the University however an award is discontinued if the recipient student discontinues his/her course of study.

Prizes and awards reported in Part III Line 3 are awarded to students or other individuals for, among other reasons, academic excellence, writing competitions, design competitions, research and service to the local community and other students.

The University's Enrollment Services Division, Office of Student Financial Services, and Office of Research Services and Sponsored Projects responsible for the administration of all grants and student aid according to current law, regulations, and policies prescribed by grantors. The University is subject to annual audits conducted in accordance with OMB Circular A-133.

Gustavus offers both merit-based and need-based scholarship assistance. Merit-based scholarships do not require a student to demonstrate financial eligibility and must be awarded during the Admission process. They also may be awarded as part of a need-based financial aid package. To be renewed, the student needs to maintain the established minimum standards. Need-based scholarships are offered to students who demonstrate financial eligibility by filing the FAFSA. The offered amounts can vary from year to year as determined by the family's Estimated Family Contribution (EFC) on the FAFSA and availability of funds. The Registrar's office monitors any changes to a student's enrollment status. Any changes are communicated to the Student Accounts office and the Financial Assistance office to ensure funds are being properly disbursed. Also see Schedule F, Part V with respect to monitoring of students taking J-Term or semester studies outside of the United States.

GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS REQUIRE QUARTERLY PROGRAM REPORTING INCLUDING A NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL SUMMARY THAT IS REVIEWED BY THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY.
NSF SUBAWARD - STEP CENTER/INTEGRATE: INTERDISCIPLINARY TEACHING OF GEOSCIENCE FOR A SUSTAINABLE FUTURE
ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY IS MONITORED TO ASSURE THAT IT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. ALL EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED ON A WEEKLY BASIS FOR ALLOWABILITY.
RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON A VARIETY OF FACTORS, SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND COURSE OF STUDY, AS STIPULATED BY THE AWARD/ENDOWMENT CRITERIA.
ONCE TROCAIRE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTS, AND/OR STUDENT AID, AND THE STUDENT ACCEPTS THOSE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY CREDITS THE STUDENTS TUITION BILL.

MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MODEST AND ARE APPROVED BY OUR OFFICE OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND MONITORED BY THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS TAKE THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO OUR STUDENTS. THE SOURCE OF FUNDING OF THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE UNIVERSITY INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, GOVERNMENT FUNDS OR DONOR FUNDS. UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ADMISSIONS OFFICE, BOTH GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE, AND AWARDED USING A CALCULATION DRIVEN BY PRIOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE STATISTICS. GOVERNMENT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS AND AWARD CRITERIA. DONOR FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS, WHETHER SPONSORED OR ENDOWED, ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO THE DONOR'S WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY'S DEVELOPMENT OFFICE WORKS WITH THE DONOR AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT TO ESTABLISH THE WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA AND THESE CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED FOR REFERENCE IN BOTH THE UNIVERSITY'S DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICES. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2020, THE UNIVERSITY DISTRIBUTED EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AND PRESIDENT RELIEF FUND HARDSHIP GRANTS TO STUDENTS UNDER SECTION 18004(A)(1) OF THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF AND ECONOMIC SECURITY (CARES) ACT. THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (DOE) PROVIDED INSTITUTIONS WITH SIGNIFICANT DISCRETION FOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GRANTS.
