DISBURSEMENTS ARE REVIEWED DAILY TO INSURE ACCURACY.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND MAKES AWARDS FOR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDS ACADEMIC MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. BOTH OFFICES PERFORM POST AWARD MONITORING TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY. THE RESEARCH AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES OFFICE (RAS) PERFORMS SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY. RAS AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS MONITOR STATEMENT OF WORK COMPLETION, PROGRESS REPORTS, DELIVERABLES, CHANGE TO SCOPE AND BUDGETS. THEY ALSO REVIEW AND APPROVE SUB-RECIPIENT INVOICES.

Schedule I, Part 1, Line 2 - EMU awards student financial assistance grants & scholarships to eligible students. Use of funds is monitored by the EMU Financial Aid Department and tracked by applying aid to the student account to offset charges to tuition and fees.

The University provides funding to faculty and students for scholarships, research and other projects. Expenses must be substantiated under the Accountability Plan to ensure proper use of funds. Students must meet the requirements specified in the respective award program in order to receive the award. The requirements include criteria such as financial need, obtaining/maintaining the required grade point average and studying in a certain economic discipline, etc. If the scholarship is ongoing, the student must continue to meet the scholarship requirements in order to be awarded a scholarship in subsequent years. Financial need, grade point averages and other scholarship criteria are continually monitored to determine whether the student meets the criteria.

The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act was enacted into law on March 27, 2020 as a $2 Trillion National Economic Rescue Package. Approximately $14B of the funding was reserved for higher education institutions and the students they serve through the higher education emergency relief fund (HEERF). Clarkson was allocated approximately $2,590,707 from the Fund, all of which was awarded as emergency financial aid to students during the year ending June 30, 2020.
SER National does desk reviews and monitors on site for use of grant funds.
Part II Column H: Administration of Senior Community Service Employment Program(SCSEP) in Fresno,California.

CMU DISTRIBUTES LIMITED FINANCIAL AID AND GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. BASED ON A STATISTICAL MODEL THAT TAKES INTO ACCOUNT A STUDENT'S INTENDED COLLEGE MAJOR, ACADEMIC AND ARTISTIC TALENTS, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. FOR STUDENTS, SUCH FUNDS ARE TYPICALLY APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AT CMU. OTHER TYPES OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE MIGHT INCLUDE, FOR EXAMPLE, RECIPIENTS OF PRIZES AND AWARDS WHO HAVE MET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR THE PARTICULAR PRIZE OR AWARD TO BE SELECTED. IN THE CASE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, THE RECIPIENT IS OFTEN REQUIRED TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AND RESEARCH AT CMU. GRANTS ARE ALSO MADE IN THE CONTEXT OF ACADEMIC OR RESEARCH PROGRAMS AND RECIPIENTS SPEND THEIR GRANT FUNDS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PROGRAM FOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SPONSORED PROJECT FUNDS ARE PASSED THROUGH TO SUB-GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS BY CARNEGIE MELLON WHEN SUCH SUB-GRANTEE ARRANGEMENTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRIMARY GRANT SPONSOR. FUNDS ARE SPENT UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS AND ARE ACCOUNTABLE TO FEDERAL AND SPONSOR TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS The College has a fair, equitable and consistent awarding policy that meets federal, state and institutional requirements. Students are offered a combination of federal, state and institutional aid. Packaging parameters are periodically reviewed with the help of an outside consultant to evaluate the MMC grants and scholarship programs offered to all student populations at MMC. Students are monitored each semester to ensure they meet the requirements attached to the aid they are receiving. The review includes both enrollment and academic progress components. MMC students must maintain their gpa and complete their credits as described in the College Catalogue under academic satisfactory academic progress standards. Additionally each grant received has unique standards (see college catalogue) which must be maintained for continued awarding. A review is conducted each semester by the financial aid staff under the direct supervision of the Director of Financial Aid.

THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE DETERMINES AND APPROVES ALL AWARDS ELIGIBILITY FOR A NEW YORK THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIP IS PRIMARILY BASED ON NEED AND AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. APPLICANTS MUST BE REGISTERED FOR A MINIMUM OF EIGHT CREDITS PER SEMESTER. A CREDIT FOR THE AWARDED AMOUNT IS APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENT'S ACCOUNT, NO ACTUAL CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS.

TO RECEIVE GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE FROM CRANBROOK EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY ALL CANDIDATES MUST DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED TO THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE BASED ON AN ANALYSIS OF THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION. THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS (1) PARENTS' FINANCIAL STATEMENT (PFS) COMPLETED THROUGH WWW.NAIS.ORG, (2) INCOME VERIFICATION BY CURRENT W-2'S, END OF YEAR PAY STUBS, EMPLOYER LETTER VERIFYING INCOME, (3) SIGNED COPY OF IRS FORM 4506, (4) SIGNED COPY OF CURRENT YEAR FEDERAL TAX RETURN INCLUDING ALL SCHEDULES, (5) FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION SUBMITTED TO THE SCHOOL. AID PACKAGES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY ON THE BASIS OF THE FAMILY'S CURRENT FINANCIAL STATUS. AID AT CRANBROOK SCHOOLS IS DISTRIBUTED WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, RELIGION OR ETHNIC BACKGROUND. ALL RECIPIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO DEMONSTRATE DILIGENCE IN THEIR ACADEMIC SUBJECTS, MAINTAIN ACCEPTABLE CITIZENSHIP STANDARDS, AND CONTRIBUTE POSITIVELY TO THE SCHOOL COMMUNITY. REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION FOR CRANBROOK ART ACADEMY IS A TIMELY FILED FAFSA THROUGH THE GOVERNMENT, AFTER COMPLETION A SAR IS RECEIVED ELECTRONICALLY AT THE SCHOOL. ALSO, A COPY OF A SIGNED FEDERAL TAX RETURN IS REQUIRED. ASSISTANCE IS BASED UPON THE APPLICANT'S TIMELY APPLICATION AND DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. ALL ASSISTANCE IS DETERMINED THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE AT THE ART ACADEMY.

MONIES GIVEN TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE FOR THE SUPPORT OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT THE COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION BELIEVES IS WORTHY OF THEIR SUPPORT. THE USE OF THE FUNDS IS MONITORED IN THAT THE COLLEGE KNOWS THAT THE SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE ON THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS MINISTERING TO STUDENTS. REGARDING SCHOLARSHIPS, THESE ARE VERY SELDOM PAID IN CASH. THE SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW SMALL HONORS DAY AWARDS) ARE PLACED DIRECTLY ON THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS NEVER EXCEED THE TOTAL COSTS CHARGED. FOR CARES ACT GRANTS, THE INSTITUTION FORMED A STUDENT EMERGENCY AID REVIEW COMMITTEE (MADE UP OF FACULTY AND STAFF) TO DEVELOP A METHOD FOR DISTRIBUTION AND ALLOCATION OF THE EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS. THE COMMITTEE DECIDED TO PRIORITIZE THE STUDENTS WITH THE GREATEST NEED FIRST BY ALLOCATING $1000 TO EACH PELL-ELIGIBLE STUDENT WHO WAS LIVING ON-CAMPUS DURING THE SPRING 2020 SEMESTER AND $750 TO EACH PELL-ELIGIBLE STUDENT WHO LIVED OFF-CAMPUS DURING THE SPRING 2020 SEMESTER. AFTER THE PELL-ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WERE ADDRESSED, THE COMMITTEE DECIDED TO ALLOCATE THE REMAINING FUNDS THROUGH AN ONLINE APPLICATION PROCESS.

The University's Office of Student Financial Services awards all Federal and State Financial aid grants in accordance with the Federal and State regulations. Donor restricted grants are awarded in accordance with the donor's wishes.
ASSISTANCE WAS PROVIDED TO PERSONS IN THE COMMUNITY AFFECTED BY THE JANUARY 2020 EARTHQUAKES AND THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC

DESCRIBE ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES THAT WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS TO SUBRECIPIENTS, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES MUST BE VERIFIED ALONG WITH THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE. THIS VERIFICATION INCLUDES SIGN OFF BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE ON THE INVOICE APPROVING IT FOR PAYMENT. SUBRECIPIENT INVOICES SHOULD INCLUDE INFORMATION THAT CONFORMS TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS AS PRESCRIBED IN 2 CFR 200, AS APPLICABLE. ALL SUBRECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAKE THEIR FINANCIAL RECORDS AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW OR AUDIT BY FEDERAL AGENCIES OR PASS-THRU ENTITIES AS REQUESTED, UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THEIR AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Shore Health System works in close connection with the County Health Departments to ensure grants are used in support of common goals.
All grants are issued through the UDM Financial Aid office. The FA counselors communicate with students and monitor students' status and educational programs.

THE COLLEGE HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS OVER THE AWARDING, DISBURSING, AND MONITORING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE OF NEW YORK REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE NOT PROVIDED DIRECTLY TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS; INSTEAD THEY ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION INVOICE AS A CREDIT.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - ALL GRANT-RELATED REVENUES AND EXPENSES AWARDED TO THE COLLEGE ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE AND DISTINCT RESTRICTED FUNDS WITHIN THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL SYSTEM. WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE, A GRANT FILE IS ESTABLISHED FOR EACH RESTRICTED GRANT FUND WHICH CONTAINS THE GRANTOR-APPROVED BUDGET AND AWARD LETTER AMONG OTHER PERTINENT INFORMATION RELATED TO THE GRANTS, SUCH AS POLICIES OF THE GRANTOR. A FULL-TIME STAFF ACCOUNTANT IS ASSIGNED TO MONITOR THE EXPENDITURE OF THE GRANT FUNDS IN TERMS OF THE GRANT BUDGET, FUNDS AVAILABILITY AND ALLOWABILITY. FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE PREPARED BY THE STAFF ACCOUNTANT AND REVIEWED BY THE CONTROLLER PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE GRANTING AGENCY. LAKE ERIE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS RECORDS TO COMPLY WITH GRANTOR'S CRITERIA FOR AWARDING FUNDS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS. STUDENT INFORMATION IS REVIEWED AND MAINTAINED IN A POWERFAIDS DATABASE AND STUDENT FILES TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS.
NICHOLS COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM TO APPLY FOR AID.

WLC AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS MEETING CERTAIN FINANCIAL NEED TESTS AND ACADEMIC MERIT LEVELS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINE ARTS ABILITIES, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS SET BY THE BOARD OF REGENTS OR DONORS OF RESTRICTED OR ENDOWED FUNDS.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS MERIT AND TALENT SCHOLARSHIPS ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS TO ALL STUDENTS. THESE AWARDS DO AFFECT CONSIDERATION FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID. IF ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID, THESE AWARDS WILL BE COUNTED AS RESOURCES AND WILL BECOME PART OF THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO ALL STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS WHO FILE THE FINANCIAL AID FORM WILL AUTOMATICALLY BE CONSIDERED WHEN FINANCIAL NEED IS REQUIRED. GRANTS ARE AVAILABLE ANNUALLY FROM CURRENT FUNDS TO FULL-TIME STUDENTS WITH DOCUMENTED FINANCIAL NEED. FINANCIAL AID CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND PAID EMPLOYMENT. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS DO NOT HAVE TO BE REPAID. LOANS ARE OFFERED AT LOW INTEREST RATES ON THE CONDITION THAT MAY BE REPAID. PAID EMPLOYMENT IS AN EARNING PROGRAM. THE AMOUNT OFFERED IS THE AMOUNT THAT THEY MAY EARN. THE STUDENT IS PAID AN HOURLY RATE FOR WORK ACTUALLY PERFORMED.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS CONTRIBUTIONS MADE BY LANCASTER GENERAL HOSPITAL MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE MISSION AND COMMUNITY BENEFIT COMMITTEE: 1) GAPS IN HEALTHCARE SERVICES WILL BE REDUCED, 2) RESOURCES WILL BE DIRECTED TO DESIGNATED PRIMARY AND SECONDARY HEALTH PRIORITIES, HEALTH PROMOTION, AND PREVENTION INITIATIVES, 3) INITIATIVES WILL DRIVE COST-EFFECTIVE, COMMUNITY CARE/INTERVENTIONS THAT PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITY, 4) INITIATIVES WILL BE RESPONSIVE TO THE NEEDS OF SPECIAL/DISPARATE POPULATIONS, 5) ENDOWMENT OR CAPITAL CAMPAIGN REQUESTS WILL NOT BE FINANCIALLY SUPPORTED, 6) ONLY TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS AND GOVERNMENTAL INITIATIVES AT THE LOCAL LEVEL THAT RELATE TO LANCASTER HOSPITAL'S MISSION WILL BE SUPPORTED, AND 7) ONGOING DEFICIT FUNDING WILL NOT BE PROVIDED UNLESS FUNDAMENTAL TO A LANCASTER GENERAL HOSPITAL HEALTH PRIORITY AND/OR THE CARE OF THE MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED. SCHOLARSHIPS AND LOANS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS AT THE PENNSYLVANIA COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES ON A NON-DISCRIMINATORY BASIS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND CLINICAL PERFORMANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE SCHOOL RECEIVES FUNDS FROM THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES THROUGH HEALTH RESOURCES AND SERVICE ADMINISTRATION (HRSA)GRANTS, AS PART OF THEIR "NURSE ANESTHETIST TRAINEESHIPS- AND "PROFESSIONAL NURSE TRAINEESHIPS" PROGRAMS. ALL FUNDS RECEIVED BY THE SCHOOL ARE DISTRIBUTED PROPORTIONATELY TO STUDENTS IN THE FORMS OF STIPENDS, FOLLOWING THE REQUIREMENTS LAID OUT IN THE TERMS OF THE HRSA GRANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are awarded to students based on the scholarship criteria. For example, a student may need to be an accounting major, with a GPA of 2.0 or higher. Students complete a scholarship application and the applications are given to a scholarship committee for review. The scholarship committee verifies the student meets the scholarship criteria and then determines the distribution.

DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTED FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AS WELL AS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. IF A STUDENT IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FEDERAL OR STATE BASED FINANCIAL AID, THE AID WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT AND NEED CRITERIA.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT TO AID WITH TUITION AND FEES. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE A REDUCTION OF TUITION AND FEES AND PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE UNIVERSITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

THE UNIVERSITY GRANT POLICY IS CONTAINED IN ALL ADMISSIONS MATERIAL, IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, AND CAN ALSO BE FOUND ON THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE. THE UNIVERSITY USES A MATRIX MODEL TO AWARD MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP AID AT THE TIME A STUDENT IS ADMITTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE AMOUNT AWARDED IS BASED ON THE STUDENT'S HIGHEST SAT OR ACT SCORES AND WEIGHTED CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE. ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DETERMINED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC AND THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION TO DETERMINE THE EXACT SIZE AND COMPOSITION OF THE FINAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES. THE TYPICAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN A WORK STUDY PROGRAM WHICH SUPPLEMENTS EACH FAMILY'S CONTRIBUTION TO THE TOTAL COST OF EDUCATION. THE AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) CONTAINING INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND PARENTS.
BECKER COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM IN ORDER TO APPLY FOR AID.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICER WHO MONITORS CORRESPONDENCES WITH THE GOVERNMENT AND WORKS WITH STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICER IS IN CHARGE OF MONITORING THEIR PERFORMANCE THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER BY MONITORING THEM THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICER RECEIVES FEEDBACK FROM BILLING AS WELL AS ADMISSIONS AND OTHER FUNCTIONAL AREAS OF THE ORGANIZATION. (SEE NEXT PAGE FOR CONTINUATION) FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ADMINISTRATION, STUDENTS ACCOUNTS OFFICE WORK WITH THE REGISTRAR AND ENSURES THAT EACH STUDENT MEETS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA BEFORE ANY OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED ON A SEMESTER BASIS, LOOKING BACK TO PRIOR SEMESTERS. IF THE STUDENT RECEIVED MERIT OR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS DEPENDENT ON MAINTAINING A CERTAIN LEVEL OF GPA, STUDENTS ACCOUNTS OFFICE AND REGISTRAR ENSURES THE LEVEL IS MAINTAINED PRIOR TO APPLYING THE SCHOLARSHIP TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT.

EACH TRANSACTION INVOLVING GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, OR FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED THROUGH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT BY OUR STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICES. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES ANNUAL AUDITS OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROCESS AND PROCEDURES. THE EXTERNAL AUDITORS TEST THE UNIVERSITY'S COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE RULES AND REGULATIONS.

ALL STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED IN COLLEGE COURSES TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS MUST ALSO MAINTAIN CERTAIN GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND MAKE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. OUR COMPUTER SYSTEM IS SET UP NOT TO AWARD ANY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO NON-REGISTERED STUDENTS. A REPORT IS GENERATED AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER BY THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE SHOWING STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT MAINTAINING THE PROPER GRADE POINT AVERAGE OR WHO ARE NOT MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. THIS REPORT IS REVIEWED BY THE FINACIAL AID OFFICE, ANY STUDENTS WHO DO NOT QUALIFY ACADEMICALLY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS WILL NOT RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIPS. CARES GRANTS RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON THE CRITERIA OF THE HEERF CARES GRANTS FUNDS.

A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND MUSIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS IN THE U.S. CONSIST OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS WHICH ARE APPLIED AGAINST STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE BALANCES DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THESE GRANTS BY CONTROLLING THE APPLICATION OF GRANTS TO STUDENTS' BALANCES.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED DIRECT EMERGENCY AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS FOR THEIR EXPENSES RELATED TO THE DISRUPTION OF CAMPUS OPERATIONS DUE TO CORONAVIRUS. $579,172 WAS FUNDED BY THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF) ESTABLISHED UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT).

Grants are awarded to students based on eligibility requirements which are determined on the basis of financial need, academic ability and (or) special abilities. Need based financial aid is determined by using federal regulations. Students must also maintain satisfactory academic progress which is monitored at the end of each semester. All grants are applied to tuition and fees accounts.

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA. THE FINANCE OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

The College monitors the use of grant funds by verifying student enrollment records maintained by the Office of the Registrar and the Office of Student Accounts. Enrollment verification is performed prior to awarding of grant funds and throughout the academic year. The Office of Financial Aid monitors the College's compliance with grant agreement requirements throughout the academic year, and keeps current with compliance requirements by participating in professional development workshops and reviewing federal compliance updates from the Department of Education and NASFAA.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SPECIFIC DEPARTMENT RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID THAT TRACKS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED TO STUDENTS.

STUDENTS REQUESTING FINANCIAL AID ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A FINANCIAL AID FORM FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THIS INFORMATION TO DETERMINE WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS (FOR EXAMPLE - PELL, PERKINS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY, SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, ETC.)

SUMMIT'S TUITION COST IS $6,750 PER STUDENT. SOME STUDENTS MAY NOT QUALIFY FOR ANY AID FROM TITLE IV OR STATE PROGRAMS. STUDENTS REQUESTING ASSISTANCE COMPLETE A FORMAL REQUEST AND SUBMIT IT TO THE SUPPORT SERVICE OFFICE. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY THE SUPPORT SERVICES MANAGER, CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER.

THE COLLEGE HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. STUDENTS ARE PROPERLY VETTED TO ENSURE QUALIFICATION. STUDENT QUALIFICATION IS BASED UPON THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT OF THE STUDENTS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER RELEVANT STANDARDS/FACTORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE UPLOADED DIRECTLY INTO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT TO WHICH EACH STUDENT HAS ACCESS THROUGH AN ONLINE PORTAL.

HERITAGE UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN FEDERAL GRANTS AND LOAN PROGRAMS. ALL OF THE STUDENT AWARDING PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE SOFTWARE USED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND TRACK STUDENT AWARDS. FOR THOSE AWARDS WITH SUBJECTIVE SELECTION CRITERIA, THE DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED BY THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR SUCH AWARDS OR GRANTS. HERITAGE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES A YEARLY AUDIT OF THE GRANTS AND OTHER FEDERAL FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH A-133; A-87; AND OTHERS.

Students' eligibility to receive financial assistance from Concordia University Chicago is determined by policy approved by the Board of Regents. On a basis of careful analysis of the financial statements, the Director of Financial Aid determines the amount of aid available from various sources. Next, the amount that the student and his or her family can reasonably be expected to provide is calculated. The difference is called "demonstrated need." Financial assistance is awarded based on the student's demonstrated need for that year. Concordia-Chicago provides scholarships. All recipients are unrelated except for tuition benefits provided under Concordia-Chicago's tuition grant program to eligible employees, their spouses, and dependents. This tuition grant program is in accordance with IRC section 117(d). Concordia University Chicago also provides student assistance through work-study.

The College maintains records for all Muhlenberg students receiving financial assistance administered by the College. Records include academic performance and information regarding family/household income.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.

MOST GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ADMINISTERED BY BELLIN COLLEGE FOLLOW A SCORING GRID BASED ON A VARIETY OF FACTORS. SOME ARE AUTOMATIC BASED ON THE INCOMING STUDENTS ACADEMIC RECORD AND OTHER REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO APPLY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP. THE BURSAR AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID RECONCILE AWARDS/PAYMENTS ON A REGULAR BASIS TO ENSURE ACCURACY ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

FINANCIAL AID AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS: TO REMAIN AT KNOX, ALL DEGREE-SEEKING STUDENTS ARE EXPECTED TO MAKE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. SATISFACTORY PROGRESS IS DEFINED BOTH IN TERMS OF THE ACCUMULATION OF CREDITS TOWARDS A DEGREE, AND THE MAINTENANCE OF A GRADE POINT AVERAGE CONSISTENT WITH GRADUATION REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOLLOWS THE DECISION OF THE ACADEMIC STANDING COMMITTEE IN DETERMINING WHETHER A STUDENT IS MEETING THE COLLEGE'S SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS.

GRANTS ISSUED BY IMMACULATA UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS AWARDED AS PART OF FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E. TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ASSESSED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEEDS AND SIMILAR STANDARDS.
THE ORGANIZATION ONLY GAVE NONCASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

The Chicago School - Washington DC, Inc. provides institutional aid in the form of scholarships, fellowships, and grants to new and continuing students. The awarding of institutional aid depends on factors such as recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission or participation in a program. The Chicago School maintains records of institutional aid awards, criteria for awarding institutional aid, and evidence of the criteria for institutional aid being met by recipients.

The Chicago School - California, Inc. provides institutional aid in the form of scholarships, fellowships, and grants to new and continuing students. The awarding of institutional aid depends on factors such as recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission or participation in a program. The Chicago School maintains records of institutional aid awards, criteria for awarding institutional aid, and evidence of the criteria for institutional aid being met by recipients.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE UNIVERSITY'S OVERSIGHT AND CONTROLS OVER GRANT FUNDS IS FACILITATED BY PROCESSES AND CONTROLS INHERENT IN OUR UNIVERSITY'S ERP SYSTEM. DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS IS CONTROLLED BY DONOR AND INSTITUTIONAL CRITERIA THAT ARE MONITORED BY BOTH THE SYSTEM AND COLLABORATION BETWEEN VARIOUS DEPARTMENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY. A MONTHLY REVIEW OF FUNDING IS PRODUCED TO MONITOR SPENDING AND REPORTS ARE PRODUCED BY DEVELOPMENT TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL OVERSIGHT OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS WHEN PROVIDING REPORTS TO DONORS ON THE STATUS OF THEIR GIFTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (a) LINE 3: TYPE OF GRANT
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY FROM TIME TO TIME FORGIVES THE LOANS OF FORMER STUDENTS DUE TO BANKRUPTCY, DEATH AND/OR DISABILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (a) LINE 4: TYPE OF GRANT
ExplntnTxt: The CARES Act's Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund (HEERF) provides financial relief to be applied as emergency operational funds to universities, and as cash grants to students for expenses related to disruptions to their education due to COVID-19, including course material, technology, food, housing, healthcare, and childcare. Midwestern University's leadership elected to give the entirety of its $2.25 million in HEERF funds to University students as need-based grants.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY AWARDS ITS INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. EACH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, APPLICATION DEADLINES AND SEPARATE APPLICATION PROCEDURES. APPLICATIONS FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCEPTED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS CAN RANGE FROM A FEW HUNDRED DOLLARS TO SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS. ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT HAS BEEN SELECTED AND THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD DETERMINED, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES IS NOTIFIED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE OR DEPARTMENT. THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND MAINTAINS RECORDS FOR GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ITS STUDENTS.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS/FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION ACCOUNTS.

MONITORING USE OF FUNDS THE COLLEGE AWARDS AID TO MEET 100% OF A STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED NEED. ALL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IF THE STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM WELLESLEY, THE AID IS ADJUSTED ACCORDINGLY. FOR INTERNSHIPS, THE COLLEGE IS IN CONTACT WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING THE INTERNSHIP TO ENSURE THAT HIGH-QUALITY PROGRAMS ARE PROVIDED TO THE STUDENTS.

HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND IN FISCAL YEAR 2020, WELLESLEY COLLEGE WAS AWARDED $985,000 FROM THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENECY RELIEF FUND (HEERF). THE FUNDS WERE USED FOR EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS UNDER THE 18004(A)(1) CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT). THE COLLEGE DISBURSED $724,000 OF THE TOTAL RECEIVED TO STUDENTS TO ASSIST THE STUDENTS IN THEIR TRANSITION TO REMOTE LEARNING, WITH THE REMAINING $261,000 TO BE DISBURSED IN FISCAL YEAR 2021.

VIRTUALLY ALL UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TIED TO THE STUDENTS' GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ANNUALLY, THE GPA AND NEED ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY STANDARD. IF A STUDENT'S GPA FALLS BELOW THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS EITHER REMOVED OR REDUCED BY HALF. STUDENTS CAN APPEAL TO HAVE THE SCHOLARSHIP RESTORED IF THEIR GPA RETURNS TO THE REQUIRED LEVEL. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CARRIED FORWARD EACH YEAR ONCE THE STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CERTAIN LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURAL SUPPORT TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE ASSISTANCE IS CONSIDERED A DONATION AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

EACH ACADEMIC YEAR THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT PROVIDES THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID A DETAILED LIST OF THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS, ALONG WITH THE CURRENT MARKET VALUE OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP, AND STATED CRITERIA RESTRICTIONS, IF ANY, REQUIRED FOR RECIPIENTS OF THOSE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, FROM THAT LIST PROVIDED BY THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL AID, MATCHES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE INSTITUTIONAL AID WITH THOSE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE. THE LIST OF MATCHES IS THEN RETURNED TO THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND LOANS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED (AS DETERMINED BY A STANDARDIZED FINANCIAL AID FORM), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR LEADERSHIP. RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF SEX, RACE, COLOR, OR NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY ESTIMATES UTILIZED ARE BASED ON CALCULATED AVERAGE AWARDS EXTENDED TO COMPARABLE GROUPS. ALL AWARDS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT TO THE RECIPIENT.
ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE GIVEN ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD THROUGH THE VARIOUS COMMITTEES PER DONOR AND OTHER RESTRICTIONS AND REQUIREMENTS.
THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THIS INSTITUTION WHICH ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

THE UNIVERSITY OF DENVER HAS A UNIVERSITY WIDE SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT ALLOCATION SYSTEM THAT DISTRIBUTES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO ALL DIVISIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE AND ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE FUND LEVEL. THE EXPENDITURE OF THIS FINANCIAL RESOURCE IS MONITORED THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE SOFTWARE SYSTEM WHICH ALLOWS FOR RECONCILIATION, ELIGIBILITY CHECKS, AND PREVENTS OVER EXPENDITURE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO PARTICIPATES IN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDITS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN RECIPIENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENTS' TUITION AND FEE RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT AND IS APPLIED TO ANY OUTSTANDING CHARGES PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF ANY EXCESS AMOUNTS.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE NC BUDGET OFFICE REQUIRES PERIODIC REPORTING FOR ALL GRANTS. THE REPORTING IS COMPLETED BY THE RESPONSIBLE DEPARTMENT AND THEN ENTERED INTO THE STATE WEBSITE BY THE CONTROLLER ANNUALLY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III Student Scholarships and Financial Assistance
ExplntnTxt: ECMC Education, Inc. (formerly Zenith Education Group, Inc.) provides scholarship and financial assistance to students for tuition, books and fees. In 2019, Scholarship and grant programs include Zenith American Dream Scholarships, Zenith Student Grants, Altierus Alumni Scholarship, Scholarship Employee and Military Scholarships. Awards are based on eligibility and are credited to each student's account.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: A variety of student financing options are available to help students finance their education costs. Information about programs and eligibility requirements is available through the Student Finance Office. Enrollment and eligibility in ECMC Education, Inc. (formerly Zenith Education Group, Inc.) scholarships and grants are monitored internally. Other awards are monitored by the respective granting agencies.

BETHANY COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS ON EVERY INDIVIDUAL WHO RECEIVES FUNDS. THESE RECORDS INCLUDE THE AMOUNT RECEIVED AND QUALIFICATIONS MET IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THOSE FUNDS. THEY ARE KEPT FOR THE DURATION OF TIME AS SPECIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND ARE PROPERLY DIPOSED OF AFTERWARDS. THE COLLEGE ALSO HAS A POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH STATES HOW SPECIFIC GRANT MONIES, SUCH AS THE KANSAS COMPREHENSIVE GRANT AND THE SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, ARE AWARDED.

Emergency aid: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Tuition assistance: Tuition is discounted to apply aid.

ALL INSTITUTIONAL MONEY, GRANTS, ETC. FOLLOW THE FINANCIAL AID MATRIX THAT WAS DESIGNED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET, OR IF MONEY WAS DONATED FOR SPECIFIC PURPOSES, BY THE WISHES OF THE INDIVIDUAL DONOR.
The Business Office receives a copy of all grant contacts and reconciles project expenses monthly.
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE COLLEGE TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, TALENT, LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON UNIVERSITY HERITAGE AND MISSION. THIS IS PRIMARILY FROM THE APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION, TRANSCRIPTS AND TEST SCORES, BUT MAY ALSO INCLUDE AUDITIONS AND TRY-OUTS. AWARDS WITH SPECIFIC RENEWAL CRITERIA ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL SERVICES.

THE COLLEGE HAS A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT IS AVAILABLE TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS THROUGH ITS SCHOLARSHIP FUND. AWARDS ARE MADE ANNUALLY AND ARE DIVIDED OVER THE FALL AND SPRING TERM ENROLLMENTS. GENERAL QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS OF SOME OF THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AS FOLLOWS: CHRISTIAN WORKERS GRANT - FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHOSE PARENTS ARE IN FULL-TIME CHRISTIAN MINISTRY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS GRANT. TRINITY COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP - NEW FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE A MINIMUM ACT COMPOSITE SCORE OF 19 OR A MINIMUM COMBINED SAT SCORE OF 950 ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP. TRINITY COLLEGE GRANT - THIS GRANT IS AWARDED TO NEW OR CONTINUING FULL-TIME STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED. PAST OR EXPECTED STUDENT LEADERSHIP IS CONSIDERED. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS DOCUMENTING THE SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA, THE RECIPIENT SELECTION PROCESS, THE AMOUNT REWARDED, AND THE QUALIFIED EXPENSES FOR WHICH THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP GRANTED.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS A SET OF CRITERIA BY WHICH COLLEGE AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS OF ALL STUDENT AID AWARDED AND SUBSTANTIATION FOR THE AWARDS.

THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (GRANTS) ARE NON-CASH TUITION DISCOUNTS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM INTENDED USES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED ABOVE WAS COMPILED FROM SCHOLARSHIP DISBURSEMENT RECORDS FOR THE REPORTED FISCAL YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC STANDING AND FINANCIAL NEED.

THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE MAINTAINS ALL DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THAT THE AWARDED STUDENTS HAVE SATISFIED THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR STUDENTS. CRITERIA FOR AWARDING ANY GRANTS IS ALSO MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE AND IS APPROVED BY THE VP OF ENROLLMENT.

NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. AMOUNTS OF AID AWARDED ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH GOVERNING REGULATIONS OR INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. IN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV REGULATIONS, TOTAL AID FROM ALL SOURCES CANNOT EXCEED NEED OR THE ANNUAL COST OF TUITION, REGARDLESS OF THE LEVEL OF NEED. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT ACCOUNT AND FUNDS ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS. OVERPAYMENT OR CREDIT BALANCES OF STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE ANALYZED PRIOR TO DISTRIBUTING REFUNDS TO STUDENTS TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROPERLY AWARDED AND UTILIZED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

Every full-time traditional undergraduate student is considered for merit-based financial aid. Merit-based aid is determined by the Admissions and Financial Aid Department's analysis of a student's academic credentials, such as standardized test scores and high school transcripts. A student interested in receiving need-based financial aid is required to submit a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) for each school year. Once all the eligibility criteria are met and all necessary documents are obtained, either through review of the ISIR or by efforts of the Financial Aid Counselor, the financial need of the student is determined by the difference between the cost of attendance at Xavier and the EFC toward those costs. After the financial need for the student is calculated, the financial aid package for each student is determined by the Banner system based on the student's financial need, academic merit, talent, enrollment status, level in school, and dependency status. Award letters (via e-mail or regular mail) are then prepared and sent to each student, notifying them of what types of awards they are deemed eligible to receive. The student then has the option to decline any aid that is offered to them. Xavier uses passive acceptance of aid offered.

ALL HOOD COLLEGE GRANTS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY AWARDS, PERKINS LOANS AND MOST STAFFORD LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED. HOOD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AS EVALUATED THROUGH THE STUDENT'S HIGH SCHOOL RECORD AND SAT SCORES. MANY SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES ALSO INTEGRATE NEED BASED AWARDS. ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS REQUIRE REPORTING OF FUND USAGE.

THE UNIVERSITY UTILIZES THE POWERFAIDS FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WHICH REQUIRES THE END USER TO TIE HIGHLY SPECIFIC ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA TO INDIVIDUAL FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. DURING EXECUTION OF THE AUTOMATED AWARDING MODULE WITHIN POWERFAIDS, AID IS ALLOCATED BASED ON THE PRE-ESTABLISHED CRITERIA ENSURING THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY DISTRIBUTED TO APPROPRIATE, QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS. POST AUTO-AWARDING A SERIES OF MIS INFORMATION REPORTS PERFORM A STUDENT-BY-STUDENT TEST OF AWARD EFFICACY MONITORING THAT STUDENT GRANT AID HAS BEEN APPROPRIATELY DISTRIBUTED. WITHIN THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS SYSTEM AND GENERAL LEDGER STUDENT GRANT PROGRAMS EXPENDITURES ARE ASSIGNED SUB-CODES THAT UNIQUELY IDENTIFY THEM AS SUCH THUS PROHIBITING ANY INADVERTANT OR INAPPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED APPROPRIATE CONTROLS THROUGH SEPARATION OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND INTERNAL AUDIT PROCEDURES THAT PRECLUDE ANY ENTITY WITHIN THE ADMINISTRATIVE STRUCTURE FROM DIVERTING STUDENT GRANT AID TO NONQUALIFIED USES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN D
ExplntnTxt: THE "NON-CASH ASSISTANCE" REPORTED ARE CREDITS AGAINST STUDENT TUITION CHARGES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE RECIPIENTS OF GRANT FUNDS ARE TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED IN 501(C)(3) OR GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES AND THEREFORE THE CORPORATION DOES NOT MONITOR THE USE OF THOSE FUNDS.

ALL APPLICATIONS ARE PRESCREENED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE BEING PASSED TO RESPECTIVE ACADEMIC PROGRAM CHAIRS/HEADS FOR REVIEW AND RECOMMENDATION. RECOMMENDED APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE OR RESPECTIVE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEES BEFORE BEING FORWARDED TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE FOR APPROVAL. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES EACH AWARDEE AND DISBURSES SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS INTO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT AFTER VERIFYING EACH AWARDEE'S ENROLLMENT STATUS AND ACADEMIC STANDING AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SEMESTER.

SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID, BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND FEDERAL OR STATE MANDATED REGULATIONS. DONOR RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND DISTRIBUTED THROUGH FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES TO COVER EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES ESTIMATED OR CHARGED BY THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS EACH YEAR BASED UPON A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES INSTITUTIONAL AID VIA UNIVERSITY GRANTS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER STANDARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID VERIFIES THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS AND THE PERSONAL INCOME DATA PROVIDED FOR ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) OF EACH STUDENT TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF AID AWARDED ON AN AS NEEDED BASIS. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDED THROUGH SPECIAL ENDOWMENTS AND DONATIONS, WHICH ARE AWARDED BASED ON SIMILAR STANDARDS AS WELL AS DONOR'S CRITERIA. THE OFFICES OF FINANCIAL AID AND FINANCE CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

Although students and their families bear the primary responsibility for meeting costs, many find they cannot pay the full cost of an education by themselves. In most cases a financial aid package will involve family contributions, acceptance of federal assistance (including grants and loans), and financial aid from John Brown University. These financial assistance programs help fill the gap between the amount a family is expected to pay and the total educational cost. The amount the family is expected to pay is based on information provided on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). The tuition assistance is applied to the student's account and therefore, no cash changes hands.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: All WellSpan entities follow WellSpan policies and procedures regarding grant projects to ensure that the use of grant funds are consistent with WellSpan's commitment to endeavor to improve the health status of the communities that we serve.The WellSpan foundations are supporting organizations and substantially all of the grants and other assistance they make furthers the exempt purposes of their "supported organizations", each of which are exempt affiliated organizations within the WellSpan Health system. Because the supported organizations identify the projects and exempt activities that will be funded by the foundations' grants and other assistance, and because there is a cross-over between the respective governing bodies and management of the foundations and their supported organizations, the foundations are able to effectively monitor that the grants they make are used for their intended purposes.

IN AS MUCH AS ALL GRANTS ARE FOR NON-CASH ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENT RECIPIENTS' TUITION, ROOM, BOARD OR BOOKS, WHEN SUCH REMISSION OCCURS, IT IS A DIRECT REDUCTION OF THE STUDENTS FEES TO THE UNIVERSITY. SINCE NO GRANT FUNDS ARE IN DIRECT CONTROL OF THE RECIPIENT, THE RECIPIENT IS NOT IN A POSITION TO DIVERT THE GRANT FROM ITS INTENDED USE. FOR ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS, THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR AND DIRECTOR OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES, TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH NAIA RULES, MUST MONITOR SCHOLARSHIP EXPENDITURES FOR EACH STUDENT AND PROGRAM.

DURING FISCAL YEAR 2020, HILLSDALE COLLEGE AWARDED MONETARY GRANTS/PRIZES TO TWO INSTITUTION BASED ON SPECIFIED CRITERIA. ONE GRANT IS THE HENRY SALVATORI PRIZE FOR EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING, WHICH HONORS ONE K-12 SCHOOL EACH YEAR FOR ITS OUTSTANDING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM. ALL PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS WHOSE TEACHING REFLECTS THE BEST TRADITIONS OF WESTERN EDUCATION ARE WELCOME TO APPLY. THE WINNING SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO PREPARE AN ANNUAL REPORT ON THE EXPENDITURE(S) OF THE PRIZE UNTIL SUCH FUNDS ARE ENTIRELY EXPENDED. ONE OTHER GRANT SUPPORTED ONE OF THE 24 CLASSICAL K-12 CHARTER SCHOOLS AFFILIATED WITH HILLSDALE'S BARNEY CHARTER SCHOOL INITIATIVE. THE INITIATIVE GUIDES FOUNDING GROUPS IN OBTAINING A CHARTER AND PROVIDES CURRICULAR SUPPORT AND TEACHER AND PRINCIPAL TRAINING. THIS GRANT SUPPORTED THE LAUNCH OF THE CHARTER SCHOOL. THE RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE HILLSDALE COLLEGE DOCUMENTATION ON THE USE OF THE FUNDS, AND HILLSDALE COLLEGE STAFF VISIT THE SCHOOLS EACH YEAR.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANT FUNDS AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID TO ITS STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS NEED AND MERIT BASE AID BASED ON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY. THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM AT SETON HILL UNIVERSITY ASSISTS STUDENTS WHO WOULD FIND IT DIFFICULT OR IMPOSSIBLE TO ATTEND COLLEGE WITHOUT SOME FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT, AND DEFERRED PAYMENT SCHEDULES, AND COORDINATES ITS PROGRAMS WITH THE FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY OF THESE FORMS OF FINANCIAL AID MAY BE OFFERED INDEPENDENTLY OR IN VARIOUS COMBINATIONS TO A STUDENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ESTIMATES THE COST OF ATTENDING SETON HILL UNIVERSITY BY ADDING TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES PLUS AN ESTIMATE FOR BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION FROM HOME TO SCHOOL AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID AN APPLICANT RECEIVES IS BASED ON THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL COSTS AND THE AMOUNT THE STUDENT AND FAMILY ARE ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARD COSTS AS DETERMINED BY THE NEEDS ANALYSIS FORM.

LAKE TECHNICAL COLLEGE, INC. PREPARES ANNUAL BUDGETS AND MONITORS COSTS ON A MONTHLY BASIS. MOST DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DONE BY THE SCHOOL, WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF STATE-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS REIMBURSED BY THE DISTRICT AFTER THE SCHOOL SUBMITS PURCHASE ORDERS AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION. THEREFORE, THERE IS ANOTHER LAYER OF REVIEW AND APPROVAL FOR ALLOWABLE COSTS.

The Financial Aid office maintains a database of all students, their eligibility for grant funds determined through FAFSA, and other analytical procedures, the amount awarded and accepted by each student, and documentation of verifying the data. The College also has a federal awards audit performed each year in addition to the financial statement audit.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE UTILIZES SYSTEMS DESIGNED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AND MONITORS THE ACTIVITY AND USES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GRANTS FUNDS WITH THE APPROPRIATE CRITERIA ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATED STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AND GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 EACH SEMESTER.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID RECORDS AND FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE SELECTION CRITERIA FOR ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDIT CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 EACH YEAR. FOR THE YEAR ENDED 6/30/2020, THE AUDIT REPORTED THAT THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIED, IN ALL MATERIAL RESPECTS, WITH THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF ITS MAJOR FEDERAL PROGRAMS.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS THE FOLLOWING POLICIES TO ASSURE THAT INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES: THE AGGREGATE OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS THAT AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT RECEIVES IS RESTRICTED TO AN AMOUNT EQUIVALENT TO TUITION AND FEES; ENROLLMENT IS CONFIRMED EACH SEMESTER PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS; ELIGIBILITY FOR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS IS LIMITED TO A MAXIMUM OF EIGHT SEMESTERS. RENEWAL GRADE POINT AVERAGE REQUIREMENTS ARE CHECKED AT THE END OF EACH ACADEMIC YEAR; ELIGIBILITY FOR INSTITUTIONAL GENERAL GRANTS REQUIRES A DEMONSTRATION OF NEED, BASED ON SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA); ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS HAVE SELECTION CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO EACH FUND AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID OVERSEES THE SELECTION OF ELIGIBLE STUDENTS; WHEN A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM SCHOOL, THE PERCENTAGE ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO INSTITUTIONAL AID ARE THE SAME AS THE PERCENTAGE ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO TUITION AS SPECIFIED IN THE CATALOG.

Monitoring the use of grants to organizations in the US includes the following procedures: 1) obtain pre-award survey (for new grant recipients only); 2) obtain and review monthly or quarterly financial statements from recipients; 3) pay sub-recipient based on financial reports and operational cash-flow status of recipients; 4) review recipients' annual A-133 audit reports; 5) review programmatic reports from recipients; and 6) conduct monitoring and evaluation to assess sub-recipient performance. World Learning offers grants and scholarships to US students based on several criteria, including need and demonstrated commitment to the SIT's mission. Financial Aid Office awards financial aid to qualifying students based on several criteria and donors restrictions. Furthermore, in collaboration with Accounts Receivable office, Financial Aid office monitors financial aid disbursements throughout the year.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE THAT IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY TO STUDENTS IS DESIGNATED FOR TUITION, FEES, BOOKS, AND OTHER DIRECT EDUCATIONAL COSTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND FINANCE OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS AND CONTROLS DISBURSEMENT OF ALL ASSISTANCE.
Stetson University ensures each scholarship is used for its intended purpose by applying the award amount directly to the recipient's student ledger.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: For contributions under $1,000,000, Wheaton College will generally retain 25%; for contributions of over $1,000,000, Wheaton College will generally retain 10%. The remaining portion of each donor's contribution is available for distribution to other public charities at the donor's recommendation, subject to the approval of the Wheaton College Charity Selection Committee. The Committee must review and approve all recommendations. Such review includes: verifying exempt status, identifying the mission of the organization and the purpose of the grant, and review of the organization's Form 990, if applicable.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants and scholarships are awarded to students who apply for financial assistance at Wheaton College. Grant recipients are based on financial need. Scholarships and other assistance is merit-based. All funds are used for tuition and books and living expenses at Wheaton College. This process is monitored by the Financial Aid Office at the College.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND ACADEMIA ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR.

AS UNION DOES NOT USUALLY PROVIDE GRANT FUNDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, STANDARD POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ARE NOT IN PLACE FOR GRANTING FUNDS. BOTH GRANTS REPORTED WERE GRANTED FROM PROGRAM SPECIFIC FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS PARTNERING WITH UNION TO DELIVER MISSION CENTRIC PROGRAMMING. GRANTEES ARE SUBJECT TO ALL COMPLIANCE AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AS UNION. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE GRANTS APPLICATION. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES.
PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS.

The College of Idaho uses a combination of federal methodology and instructional policy to provide a uniform method to assess a family's financial strength and the students academic performance to estimate the expected family contribution toward the student's cost of education. The cost of education includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, room, board, personal expenses and transportation allowance.

The College determines the eligibility for each student's needs, the awards are credited to the student's account and the Office of Financial Aid monitors the student's continued eligibility to receive the assistance.

ALL APPLICATIONS ARE PRESCREENED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE BEING PASSED TO THE RESPECTIVE ACADEMIC PROGRAM CHAIRS/HEADS FOR REVIEW AND RECOMMENDATION. RECOMMENDED APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE OR THE RESPECTIVE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE BEFORE BEING FORWARDED TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE FOR APPROVAL. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES EACH AWARDEE AND DISBURSES SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS INTO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT AFTER VERIFYING EACH AWARDEE'S ENROLLMENT STATUS AND ACADEMIC STANDING AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SEMESTER.

Students requesting financial aid are screened for financial need, academic merit, and other scholarship criteria prior to the awarding of scholarships. The combined total of scholarships, grants and other tuition related awards may not exceed the cost of tuition. Students must meet the enrollment guidelines and maintain satisfactory academic progress to retain awards received. Monitoring of these criteria is a combined effort of the Financial Aid office, the Registrar's office and the Business office. Scholarships are applied directly to student accounts.

THE COLLEGES PROVIDE FUNDING TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THAT SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH THE COLLEGES OPERATE. THE AMOUNTS PROVIDED ARE USED BY THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS TO FURTHER THEIR MISSION AND DO NOT REQUIRE ANY MONITORING. HOBART AND WILLIAM SMITH COLLEGES OFFER GRANTS TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES SUBMIT STANDARDIZED APPLICATION MATERIALS TO THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHICH OVERSEES THE PROCESS OF AWARDING SUCH GRANTS. ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS IS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGES. THE COLLEGES CREDIT THE TUITION ACCOUNTS OF THE STUDENTS WHO ARE AWARDED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS.

A.C.T. GRANTS ARE TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE CONSERVATORY PROGRAM. TUITION SCHOLARSHIP AWARD AMOUNTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND THE CONSERVATORY DIRECTOR. GRANT MONITORING IS ACCOMPLISHED BY A.C.T. APPLYING THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD DIRECTLY AS A REDUCTION IN TUITION EXPENSES OWED.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.

Scholarships issued to University students are applied to the student's account. A list of scholarship, fellowship and grant assistance awarded is on file at the University. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having interest in the University, such persons are selected on an equal and objective basis as with other recipients. All students receiving assistance are selected on the University's criteria for academic and financial need, and other similar criteria. The University does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, ethnic or racial origin, physical or mental disability, marital or veteran status in administration of scholarships or loans. Also, note that the University provides remitted tuition to qualified faculty, staff and certain dependents as a benefit of employment. The University monitors the student accounts and eligibility.
HOPE SCHOLARSHIP/GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE RECIPIENT UPON PROOF OF ELIGILIBITY (I.E. FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT) AND UPON PROOF OF EXPENSE INCURRED.

The Organization only awards financial assistance or grant-in-aid to individuals who are designated to meet the educational expenses of students attending Fuller Theological Seminary. The Organization has established institutional policies for awarding and monitoring of financial assistance. Each award is done in accordance with the policies and compliance is monitored by senior management, to ensure that the amount and eligibility of individuals is in accordance with established policies. No cash changes hands and funds are directly tied to student accounts.

STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE GRANTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE DETERMINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S STANDARD POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. IN SUMMARY, A STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FAFSA TO BE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID ASSISTANCE. UPON COMPLETION OF THE FAFSA, THE UNIVERSITY IS PROVIDED THE STUDENT'S ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTIONS (EFC). BASED ON THE EFC AND OTHER CRITERIA (I.E. ENROLLMENT STATUS, ACADEMIC STANDING, ETC.), THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAY AWARD A STUDENT AN INSTITUTIONAL GRANT. THERE ARE SYSTEMIC PROCEDURES IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANT IS APPLIED AGAINST TUITION AND MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE SPECIFIC GRANT. STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID STATUS WHILE AT THE UNIVERSITY.

AS PART OF THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT), THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED A FEDERAL GRANT AS PART OF THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF). OF THAT AMOUNT $1,676,616 WAS GRANTED TO 1,909 STUDENTS FOR THE REFUNDING OF STUDENT ROOM AND BOARD.

PROCEDURES FOR APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID: WHENEVER POSSIBLE, CATAWBA COLLEGE WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF A STUDENT THROUGH MERIT, PERFORMANCE-BASED, AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. A POTENTIAL STUDENT APPLIES AND IS ACCEPTED TO CATAWBA COLLEGE. AT THE TIME OF THEIR ACCEPTANCE, MERIT AID IS DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS COUNSELOR ACCEPTING THE APPLICATION BASED ON A MATRIX CHART THAT HAS BEEN SET UP WITH REGARD TO GPA AND SAT SCORES, LIVING ON OR OFF CAMPUS, AND A SEPARATE TRANSFER STUDENT MATRIX. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AND, THUS, MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. WITH REGARDS TO ATHLETICS AT CATAWBA COLLEGE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL ATHLETES TO MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT GO OVER CONFERENCE REGULATIONS REGARDING BOOKS AND SUPPLIES. CATAWBA COLLEGE REFERS TO THE NCAA DIVISION II MANUAL FOR POLICIES REGARDING STUDENT ATHLETES. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR SIGNS OFF ON THE SQUAD LISTS AND CHECKS FOR ELIGIBILITY WITH THE COMPLIANCE DIRECTOR. THE ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENTERING THE ATHLETIC INFORMATION INTO THE CAI SYSTEM. THE CAI SYSTEM IS ALSO USED TO DETERMINE EQUIVALENCY COMPUTATIONS.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

A SCHOLARSHIP IS AN ACHIEVEMENT AWARD. AWARDS CAN BE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S AFFILIATION WITH A PARTICULAR MAJOR, BEING A PART OF A CLUB/GROUP, OR BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE AWARD. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED IS ALSO PROVIDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANTS TO DOMESTIC ORGANIZATIONS ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA STIPULATED BY OUR MISSION.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE INSTITUTION AWARDS GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH IN INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. THE CRITERIA IS EXPLAINED IN THE COLLEGE CATALOG. ANY "NEED BASED" GRANT IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA).

THE INSTITUTION AWARDS GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH IN THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. THIS CRITERIA IS EXPLAINED IN THE COLLEGE CATALOG. ANY "NEED BASED" GRANT IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA).

THE COLLEGE (PRIMARILY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT) MONITORS STUDENTS' FILES TO ENSURE THAT THEY RECEIVE THE NECESSARY FINANCIAL AID ASSISTANCE BASED ON GRADES, COURSE OF STUDY, FINANCIAL NEED, ETC. STUDENT FILES ARE REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS A WIDE VARIETY OF FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. ITS MAJOR OBJECTIVE IS THE EQUITABLE DISTRIBUTION OF FINANCIAL AID TO ALL STUDENTS WITH AN ULTIMATE GOAL OF HELPING THEM FINANCE THEIR EDUCATION. RECIPIENTS ARE DETERMINED BY ACADEMIC MERIT AS WELL AS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN CERTAIN ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. SAINT XAVIER UNIVERSITY WAS AWARDED FUNDS FROM THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY (CARES) ACT. 50 PERCENT OF THE FUNDS RECEIVED UNDER SECTION 18004(A)(1) OF THE CARES ACT WAS USED TO PROVIDE EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO SXU STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ESTIMATES THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FROM RECORDS MAINTAINED IN OUR FINANCIAL AID (SCHOLARSHIPS) AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SYSTEM (GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANCE STIPENDS AND FELLOWSHIPS) WHICH HAVE BEEN CLASSIFIED BY THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND OTHER STUDENT RELATED FINANCIAL AID MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM AUTHORIZED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

Tuition discounts, scholarships, and awards are given by the College. The College notifies the business office of the award amount for each student. That amount is applied directly to each student's account and no cash changes hands.

GRANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND STUDENT LOANS ARE MADE UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND THE ACADEMIC PROMISE OF STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE MADE TO STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE MONITORED COLLABORATIVELY BY THE OFFICE OF THE REGISTRAR, OFFICE OF THE BURSAR, FINANCIAL PLANNING, AND THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE TO VERIFY ELIGIBILITY, APPROPRIATE SELECTION CRITERIA AND APPLICATION OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS IN THE APPLICATION FOR SUPPORT, A DETAILED EXPLANATION OF THE KIND OF SERVICES PROVIDED TO THE COMMUNITY ALONG WITH SPECIFIC FINANCIAL DATA IS REQUESTED. IF THE APPLICATION FOR SUPPORT IS APPROVED, A LETTER IS SENT INDICATING THE AMOUNT OF THE SUPPORT ALONG WITH A REQUEST FOR DOCUMENTATION OF HOW THE FUNDS WERE USED, ALONG WITH A REPORT OF THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN/FAMILIES SERVED OVER THE YEAR. GRANTS MADE TO AFFILIATED FOUNDATIONS ARE MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AS THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE READILY AVAILABLE. OTHER GRANTS ARE MADE THAT COMPLY WITH THE MISSION AND FURTHER THE TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE ORGANIZATION.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL BUDGETED TO ACTUAL GRANT ACTIVITY IS MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND THE FINANCIAL AID FOR EACH STUDENT IS APPROVED PRIOR TO DISBURSING FUNDS. GRANT REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ARE MONITORED BY THE BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE ACCURACY.
THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THIS INSTITUTION WHICH ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES ONGOING OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING TO ASSURE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE INTENDED PURPOSES AND TIMELY EXPENDITURES OF GRANT FUNDS.

The Chicago School - Washington DC, Inc. provides institutional aid in the form of scholarships, fellowships, and grants to new and continuing students. The awarding of institutional aid depends on factors such as recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission or participation in a program. The Chicago School maintains records of institutional aid awards, criteria for awarding institutional aid, and evidence of the criteria for institutional aid being met by recipients.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE FUNDED THROUGH A VARIETY OF SOURCES. IT IS INTENDED THAT THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BE USED TO RECOGNIZE ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, SERVANT LEADERSHIP, AND SPECIAL ACHIEVEMENT AND TO MEET FINANCIAL NEEDS OR PROVIDE SELF-HELP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH STUDENT WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND PARENT/STUDENT LOANS. WHILE IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO GUARANTEE THAT FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EVERY NEEDY APPLICANT, THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE DESIGNED TO HELP COVER THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE DIRECT COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND THE STUDENTS OWN RESOURCES. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BASED UPON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF RESOURCES THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE STUDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO UNIVERSITY POLICY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED BY MANAGEMENT. RECONCILIATION BETWEEN FINANCIAL AID AND ACCOUNTING ARE DONE ON A MONTHLY BASIS. SCHEDULE I, PART III CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE ALL AMOUNTS GIVEN IN FINANCIAL AID.

THE COLLEGE OFFERS FINANCIAL AID TO ASSIST STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF FULL-TIME ENROLLMENT. FACTORS INFLUENCING THE AMOUNT AND TYPE OF AID AWARDED INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, LEADERSHIP AND OTHER PERSONAL QUALITATIVE ATTRIBUTES. THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), WHICH HELPS TO ESTABLISH A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, SERVES AS THE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. FILES DETAILING GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS AND CRITERIA ARE REVIEWED TO ENSURE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ELIGIBILITY BEFORE AWARDS ARE MADE. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST ANY PERSON ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, AGE, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR EXPRESSION, DISABILITY, VETERAN STATUS, OR ANY OTHER LEGALLY PROTECTED BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE MASSACHUSETTS CONFERENCE FOR WOMEN. THIS ENTITY PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR BUSINESS NETWORKING, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION, AND PERSONAL GROWTH FOR WOMEN. PART III, LINE 1 SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. MANY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC STRENGTH, ATHLETIC ABILITY, AND LEADERSHIP OR COMMUNITY SERVICE. NON-NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING IS AWARDED THROUGH THE ADMISSIONS PROCESS AND USUALLY HAS A GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR OTHER REQUIREMENT FOR RENEWAL IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS. TYPES OF MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE THE TRUSTEE SCHOLARSHIP, THE PRESIDENT'S SCHOLARSHIP, AND THE INTERNATIONAL SCHOLARSHIP. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS GRANT FUNDS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND DO NOT HAVE TO BE REPAID. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE DETERMINES THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF A STUDENT'S NEED-BASED GRANT FUNDING ACCORDING TO FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL FORMULAS. TYPES OF NEED BASED GRANTS INCLUDE BENTLEY SCHOLARSHIPS, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE SOURCES. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S STUDENT ACCOUNT. PART III, LINE 2 HEERF - STUDENT AID On March 27, 2020, Congress passed the Coronavirus Aid, Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act to ease the financial strain across the country created by COVID-19. A portion of that economic relief package included a Higher Education Emergency Relief fund to provide emergency grants to students to help them pay expenses caused by the pandemic's disruption. Bentley received $1,332,814 for emergency financial aid for students.

SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO INDIGENT CANCER PATIENTS TO ASSIST THEM WITH ANCILLARY COSTS DURING TREATMENT. ASSISTANCE IS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE CENTER'S CHARITY CARE POLICY AND IS COORDINATED THROUGH THE SOCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT. SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE INCLUDES TRANSPORTATION REIMBURSEMENT TO THE TREATMENT FACILITY, LODGING, FOOD, EXERCISE PROGRAMS, MEDICAL SUPPLIES AND SUPPORT GROUP COSTS.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY OF ALL STUDENTS AT THE COLLEGE AND MAINTAINS APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT PACKAGES AID BASED ON INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S NEED. ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS IS ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
THE COLLEGE HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ARE FOLLOWED IN ORDER TO AWARD STUDENTS INSTITUTIONAL AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: JD Admissions Scholarships:JD Admissions scholarships are awarded primarily based on academic merit (i.e. LSAT score and cumulative undergraduate grade point average). There is no separate application (beyond the application for admission) required for most of the scholarships. Merit Based Scholarships:California Western School of Law (the School) offers two forms of merit based scholarships that are awarded to students at the completion of their first year of law school. The Academic Merit Scholarship is typically awarded to students with GPAs from 3.33 to 4.33. It is awarded based solely on the student's GPA. The Dean's Diversity Scholarship is typically awarded to students with GPAs from 2.67 to 4.33. It is awarded through a competitive application process. The number of scholarships offered each year varies, based on the number of eligible students and the availability of funds.LL.M./M.C.L. Scholarships:Scholarships for our on-campus LL.M/M.C.L program are awarded to the School's most academically outstanding applicants based upon academic credentials, relevant work experience, impressive academic and professional recommendations, and strong command of English (as evidenced by quality writing on the applicant's personal statement and by the applicant's "Test of English as a Foreign Language"("TOEFL") score).Students enrolled in the School's Spanish on-line LL.M. program may apply for a scholarship if they can demonstrate a commitment to trial advocacy, education, and justice system reforms. In addition, students in this program may also receive a small scholarship if they graduated from a school in Mexico that has a cooperation agreement (a "convenio") with the School.

ALL UNIVERSITY STUDENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR GRANTS AND/OR ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED BASED UPON INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MANAGEMENT AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY BASED UPON DONOR STIPULATIONS AND AWARD FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE NEED-BASED AWARDS BASED ON FEDERAL OR OTHER GUIDELINES. STUDENTS RECEIVING AWARDS PROVIDE INFORMATION AND PARTICIPATE IN INTERVIEWS TO ENSURE THAT GUIDELINES AND RESIDENCY RULES AND REGULATIONS ARE MET.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MANUAL AND/OR ELECTRONIC VERIFICATION OF ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THE SYSTEM DISBURSEMENT OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS OCCURS ONLY AFTER GLOBAL AND ITEM SPECIFIC DISBURSEMENT ELIGIBILITY RULES ARE MET. UPON DISBURSEMENT, PAYMENT ALLOCATION RULES IN THE SYSTEM ALLOCATE THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO APPROPRIATE PREDEFINED CHARGES. AFTERWARDS DISBURSEMENT AUDITS ARE COMPLETED AT VARIOUS TIME INTERVALS TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT AND BASED ON NEED. THE BURSAR'S OFFICE MONITORS THE USE OF SUCH FUNDS TO THE EXTENT THAT THEY ARE USED EXCLUSIVELY FOR TUITION AND FEES. WHEN SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED, THE AMOUNT DISBURSED GOES DIRECTLY AGAINST THE BALANCE A STUDENT HAS WITH THE BURSAR'S OFFICE. During the 2019-20 academic year, funding from the Coronavirus Aid, Relief and Economic Security Act (CARES Act) provided students with $186,835 of direct emergency aid. WITH RESPECT TO GRANTS RECEIVED BY ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, THE COLLEGE REQUIRES PASS-THROUGH REPORTS (ATTESTATION OF EFFORT) FROM ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AS OUTLINED IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT. THE TIME AND EFFORT ATTESTATION MUST BE APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OF THE GRANT TO ENSURE RECEIPT OF WORK PERFORMED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds and scholarships are credited directly to the students' accounts to ensure the appropriate use of funds.

ALL GRANTS REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO U.S. STUDENTS STUDYING AT THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS IN THE UNITED STATES. BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.

REGARDING THE MONITORING OF GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS, ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED AND ELIGIBLE FOR THE AWARDED AMOUNTS. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AND USED TO PAY FOR THE EDUCATIONAL COSTS AS DESCRIBED BY THE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Universitys financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The University also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.
APPLICATIONS ARE RECEIVED AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR NEED BASED ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AND FOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: NYACK COLLEGE GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO SDTUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND NYACK COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT PROGRAMS.
