NYACK COLLEGE GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND OTHER SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS OUTLINED IN NYACK'S SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT PROGRAM.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS WITHIN ITS FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE TO ACCOUNT FOR ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

Boricua College Scholarship (BCS) Scholarships are only awarded to studenYs that attend the College and are reviewed annually for compliance and need by the School committee that oversees the selection process. Criteria for Eligibility and Selection: Academic Excellence: A student must be in good academic standing and should have acquired 12-15 credits per term with acceptable G.P.A. Financial Need: This is a Non Need-Based Fund therefore distribution of funds will be determined based on tuition costs after all conventional financial sources have been exhausted. Procedure: The College will notify the student of the intended award. If student accepts the award, the students account is credited via a financial aid award letter. Priority: Preference may be given to students: 1.In Bachelors and Masters Programs. 2.Who may have exhausted all conventional SFA award eligibility. 3.Determined ineligible based on SFA agencies conventional methodology 4.With recommendations from academic administrators and Faculty Facilitators.

ALL FUNDS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS ARE DONE SO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID POLICIES. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON VARYING AWARD CRITERIA INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED AND ESSAYS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS RANGE IN NATURE FROM SIBLING AND LEGACY SCHOLARSHIPS TO ATHLETIC AND PROGRAM SPECIFIC AWARDS. THE HARCUM GRANTS AND COMMUNITY BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NEED BASED AND DETERMINED BY THE STUDENT'S EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DISPLAY SUPERIOR ATHLETIC ABILITIES.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE AWARDED PURSUANT TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WHICH CONSIDER A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ABILITY, ARTISTIC ABILITY AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TO CONTINUE RECEIVING INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDED BY DONORS MUST MEET THE SPECIFIED SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS, IF ANY, AS WELL AS MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS GRADUATION.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENTS ADHERENCE TO ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS GPA AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

ALAYA PRESCHOOL HAS CHILDREN WHO RECEIVE SOME SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION IN ADDITION TO OTHER CHILDREN THAT RECEIVE SUPPORT VIA CCCAP (COLORADO CHILD CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM). THIS IS A STATE FUNDED PROGRAM FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT GET FULLY REIMBURSED FOR THE REGULAR COST OF CARE SO SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED TO FUND THE DIFFERENCE FOR THESE FAMILIES.

THE INSTITUTION MONITORS, PROCESSES, RECONCILES, AND ADMINISTERS ITS AID PROGRAMS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH. PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IS THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE; THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER'S OFFICE HANDLES THE FISCAL DUTIES, WHICH INCLUDE REQUESTING CASH DRAWS FROM G-5, TRACKING FEDERAL AUTHORIZATION, DETERMINING MATCHING REQUIREMENTS, AND PROGRAM RECONCILIATIONS. THE STUDENT BILLING OFFICE APPLIES PAYMENTS TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THIS SHARED APPROACH ALLOWS FOR SEGREGATION OF DUTIES BETWEEN THE DETERMINATION OF AWARDS AND PROCESSING PAYMENTS AND ALLOWS THE UNIVERSITY TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U. S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVERALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

Students qualify for federal, state and institutional scholarships, grants and loans based on their individual FAFSA application. Merit awards are based on levels of achievement academically, musically, or artistically. Entitlement grants are given for students with a family connection to the College, denominational affiliation and travel grants for students traveling a long distance from campus. International students may be awarded grants and scholarships to come to study. Grants are awarded by the financial aid office following federal, state and institutional guidelines, which are also monitored and applied in the business office. Funds are audited annually by independent auditors.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS MONITORED BY THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT THE COLLEGE MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF TITLE 2, US CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS (CFR) PART 200, UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS, COST PRINCIPLES AND AUDIT REQUIREMENTS FOR FEDERAL AWARDS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROL OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. MONITORING OF FEDERAL AND FOUNDATION GRANTS SUPPORTING COLLEGE OPERATING ACTIVITIES IS COORDINATED BETWEEN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, THE CHANCELLOR'S OFFICE, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE AND THE VP OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT. THESE OFFICES AND INDIVIDUALS ENSURE THAT APPROPRIATE CONTROLS ARE ESTABLISHED AND THAT GRANT REQUIREMENTS FOR DOCUMENTATION, TRACKING, EXPENDITURE OF FUNDS AND REPORTING ARE MET. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, ATHLETIC ABILITY AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Funds are credited to the students' accounts for tuition and fees, room and board, books and other supplies. The Office of Student Financial Services consists of both Financial Aid and Bursar functions, who work closely together to ensure proper usage of grant funds.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BY FINANCIAL PROFESSIONAL IN ACCORDANCE WITH COLLEGE POLICIES.

Monitoring Use of Grants ASSISTANCE TO MERCER UNIVERSITY STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF AIDING WITH THE COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY, I.E. FOR TUITION, HOUSING, AND MEALS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, NEED, AND OTHER DONOR REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS LOCATION OF RESIDENCE. MERCER UNIVERSITY HAS CRITERIA FOR THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS NEEDED TO AWARD A SCHOLARSHIP. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON SAT SCORES AND GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND ARE AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS. NEED BASED GRANTS ARE MADE BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL PLANNING AND ARE MADE UTILIZING THE FEDERAL NEED FORMULA (FAFSA APPLICATION). STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME TO RECEIVE UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS. GENERALLY SPEAKING, FAFSA DATA IS VERIFIED FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE SELECTED FOR VERIFICATION BY THE FEDERAL STUDENT AID PROGRAM.

SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 1 AND 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION BALANCE; THEREFORE, THE STUDENT CAN EXERCISE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SINCE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS DEFRAY COST OF TUITION, NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS REQUIRED. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 PROGRAM MANAGERS WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE GRANTEES RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS AND MONITOR THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT AGREEMENT. MONITORING INCLUDES CONDUCTING REGULAR CONTACT/WORKING SESSIONS WITH THE GRANTEE OR DIRECT ASSISTANCE WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRANT ACTIVITIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: Student Financial Aid STUDENY FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT, DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, AND ACADEMIC INTERESTS. FUNDS ARE PROVIDED BY SOURCES SUCH AS FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; PRIVATE DONORS SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, INDIVIDUALS AND FOUNDATIONS; THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED FINANCIAL AID FUNDS; AND THE COLLEGE'S OPERATING BUDGET. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE UP TO A LIMIT OF THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE MONITORED EXTENSIVELY IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT STUDENTS ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND THAT THEY DO NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THEIR DEMONSTRATED NEED. ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN APPROPRIATE.
Morehouse College Grant EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS & FINANCE. ACTIVITIES ARE RELATED TO NSF GRANT ENTITLED "TARGETED INFUSION PROJECT: DSX".

SCHOLARSHIPS - AFTER GIA RECEIVES THE SIGNED ACCEPTANCE FORM AND THE STUDENT ENROLLS, AN AWARD LINE IS SET UP IN PEOPLESOFT TO READY THE AWARD FOR DISBURSEMENT. THE AWARD IS DISBURSED THROUGH THE PEOPLESOFT SYSTEM AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT. THE FUNDS ARE NOT DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT UNLESS THE PROVISIONS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP INCLUDE LIVING EXPENSES; ANY SUCH AWARD IS DISBURSED THROUGH PEOPLESOFT IN THE SAME MANNER AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID DESIGNATED FOR LIVING EXPENSES. OTHER GRANTS - GIA MAKES LIMITED GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN ORDER TO FURTHER ITS MISSION, UPON REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY SENIOR EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT.

GIA REGULARLY ORGANIZES AND CONDUCTS SEMINARS FOR THE FBI AND OTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS. IN 2019, GIA OFFERED A GEMOLOGY TRAINING SEMINAR FREE OF CHARGE FOR FBI AND OTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS IN CARLSBAD, CALIFORNIA. THE PURPOSE OF THE TRAINING SEMINAR WAS TO ASSIST THE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS IN THE INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF JEWELRY RELATED CRIMES. GIA DIRECTLY PAID THE SEMINAR-RELATED EXPENSES AND PROVIDED EXPERT INSTRUCTORS FOR THE PROGRAM. IN 2019, GIA CONTINUED ITS PRACTICE OF FLAGGING STOLEN GEMSTONES IN ITS DATABASE, AND RECOVERED MULTIPLE GEMSTONES IN CASES IN WHICH STONES WERE RESUBMITTED TO THE LABORATORY AFTER HAVING BEEN STOLEN. GIA ALSO GRADED STONES FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AT NO COST AND RESPONDED TO MANY INFORMATION REQUESTS FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. FURTHERMORE, GIA PROVIDED MANY DOCUMENTS AT THE REQUEST OF LAW ENFORCEMENT TO ASSIST THEM IN THEIR DUTIES. GIA PARTICIPATED IN AN AGREEMENT WITH U.S. IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT TO MAINTAIN A DATABASE OF GEMSTONES TO FACILITATE THE EFFORTS OF TRADE AND LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS RELATED TO IDENTIFICATION OF NATURAL, TREATED, AND SYNTHETIC STONES AND COUNTRIES OF ORIGIN. GIA ENCOURAGES LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL TO ENROLL IN GIA EDUCATIONAL COURSES RELATED TO THEIR OFFICIAL DUTIES AND DOES NOT CHARGE FOR SUCH ENROLLMENTS.

Schedule I, Part I, line 2 THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS LISTED ON SCHEDULE I REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIPS OFFERED TO STUDENTS WHO MATRICULATE AT THE UNIVERSITY. AS SUCH, NO MONITORING OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE REQUIRED BECAUSE THE STUDENT MAY ONLY USE THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION.

THE UNIVERSITY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ADVERTISING AVAILABILITY OF SPECIFIC SCHOLARSHIPS, REVIEWING APPLICATIONS AND AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED, MERIT, OR OTHER SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS PUT IN PLACE BY DONORS OF THE FUNDS OR THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

GONZAGA UNIVERSITY IS NOT A "GRANTMAKER" PER SE IN THAT ITS FUNDAMENTAL MISSION, AND PURPOSE FOR TAX-EXEMPTION, RELATES TO EDUCATION. HOWEVER, IN THE COURSE OF THESE MISSION-RELATED ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY DOES MAKE PAYMENTS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR "GRANTMAKING" AS DEFINED BY THE INSTRUCTIONS TO SCHEDULE I OF THE FORM 990. THESE PAYMENTS FALL INTO TWO CATEGORIES. (1) STUDENT FINANCIAL AID: STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT, THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES WHO QUALIFIES FOR LOANS BASED ON ANALYSIS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. LOANS ARE AWARDED AS PART OF A PACKAGE CONSISTING OF FEDERAL GRANTS, FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY LOANS, FEDERAL WORK-STUDY AND UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. IN ALL CASES, THOSE WHO RECEIVE LOANS HAVE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND HAVE COMPLETED A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION FORM. THE AMOUNTS RECEIVED ARE ADDED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES. (2) CHARITABLE: CONTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY.

REGIS UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS BY ENSURING EXPENSES COMPLY WITH ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE LAWS AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES, REGULATIONS, AND GUIDELINES, INCLUDING THE DEPT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK AND THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S POLICY GUIDELINES AND AUDIT GUIDE.

THE SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED BY ADRIAN COLLEGE ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AND FEE CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE SCHOOL IS ALSO ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER STUDENTS REMAIN AT THE COLLEGE THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT AND DEAN OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY FACULTY, AND HOUSING RECORDS MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT AFFAIRS.

IT IS THE POLICY OF GRACE CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY TO PROCESS ALL INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AWARDS THROUGH THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHICH CONSISTS OF THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, VICE PRESIDENT FOR BUSINESS AND FINANCE, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR COMMUNITY LIFE AND STUDENT SERVICE. THE COMMITTEE MAY ALSO CHOOSE TO OCCASIONALLY INCLUDE OTHER PERTINENT FACULTY OR STAFF.
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE DESCRIBED ON SCHEDULE F, PART V.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE DETERMINED BY PROGRAM COMMITTEES AND ARE RECORDED ON STUDENT LEDGERS. EACH PROGRAM SELECTS ITS INTERNAL SCHOLARSHIP AWARDEES, SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SDS SCHOLARSHIPS. THE UNIVERSITY ACCOUNTING OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS OF AMOUNTS AWARDED AND DISBURSED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: AN ACCOUNTING OF THE EXPENDITURE OF GRANT FUNDS AS WELL AS A RESEARCH ABSTRACT WRITTEN ABOUT THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THE LAND INSTITUTE MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE LAND INSTITUTE.
THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS AND APPLIES CRITERIA BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCE, GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND NEED. THE PROCESS IS APPLIED CONSISTENTLY TO ALL STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION.
MONITORING OF GRANT USE: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.
THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT WHEREBY STUDENT'S TUITION PAID IS CREDITED WITH GRANT SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS AS EARNED.

MEREDITH COLLEGE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OFFICE HAS SYSTEMS AND INTERNAL PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ENSURES THE PROPER DETERMINATION, DISBURSEMENT AND MONITORING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL STUDENT TITLE IV AID REGULATIONS, NORTH CAROLINA STATE EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AUTHORITY RULES, AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES. FOR CARES EMERGENCY GRANT AWARDS, FOR ELIGIBLE STUDENTS, THE INDIVIDUAL GRANT AMOUNT RELATED TO THE DISRUPTION BECAUSE OF CORONAVIRUS AND WAS CALCULATED USING AN ALLOCATION BASED ON RATES FOR HOUSING AND/OR FOOD, PLUS CONSIDERATIONS FOR OTHER CARES ACT PRIORITIES (I.E., TECHNOLOGY, COURSE MATERIALS, HEALTH CARE, CHILD CARE), APPLIED OVER THE PERIOD OF TIME REMAINING IN THE SEMESTER AFTER THE CHANGE TO ONLINE INSTRUCTION.
THERE ARE A NUMBER OF SCHOLARSHIP ACCOUNTS THAT THE COLLEGE MONITORS ON THE GENERAL LEDGER. THOSE ACCOUNTS ARE RECONCILED WITH THE GRANTS AWARDED TO THE STUDENT'S POPULI ACCOUNTS.

Scholarships and Tuition Discounts are awarded based on demonstrated financial need and mission compatibilty of the student. Scholarships are applied directly to the student account. CIU requires that any gifts granted from the Donor Advised Fund be to a charitable/non-profit organization. This is managed by requesting the IRS documentation for the organization that is receiving the grant prior to any funds being disbursed. This is managed within the advancement department at CIU.

RIPON COLLEGE TRACKS ALL GRANTS ISSUED BY GRANT, DOLLAR AMOUNT, STUDENT, AND TERM. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON THE GRANTEES ELIGIBILITY FOR ANY GRANT. ELIGIBILITY MAY BE BASED ON NEED, GRADES, MAJORS, ETC. IF NEED BASED, THE FAFSA WILL BE UTILIZED. EACH GRANT MAY HAVE UNIQUE SELECTION CRITERIA WHICH IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

COMMUNITY MEDICAL CENTER (CMC) DOES NOT AWARD GRANTS; CMC PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR 501(C)(3) STATUS UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, LIMITED 501(C)(4) ORGANIZATIONS BASED ON EXPLICIT CRITERIA, PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE ACTIVITIES FURTHER THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF CMC. CMC NOTIFIES THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS OF THE INTENT AND PURPOSE OF THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION. ORGANIZATIONS SEEKING SUPPORT MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT THEY EFFECTIVELY MEET AN IMPORTANT COMMUNITY HEALTH NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Rush provides grants and assistance to organizations that are recognized public charities and to individuals primarily associated with the medical field. Rush maintains contact with the grantees through the performance of its exempt purpose.

The College awards scholarships and financial aid awards. These funds are disbursed by the College's Financial Aid Department in strict adherence to all Federal and state regulations. The funds are applied directly to student accounts, and no cash changes hands. The College also grants money to Earlham Foundation, a related organization, to hold and invest the assets on the College's behalf.

The King's College continuously monitors the academic progress of students receiving scholarship and financial aid funds. All scholarships and financial aid and housing grants are applied directly to the student accounts and therefore, no cash changes hands.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, BRANDMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.BRANDMAN.EDU.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The financial aid office notifies students when our comprehensive endowment scholarship application goes live (first week of february). Once notified, students fill out an application to apply for the respective scholarship. If the scholarship is for a specific program, the dean or other faculty member for that program will review the applications and make recommendations to the financial aid office and who should receive the award. Financial aid verifies again if the student is still eligible for the award and issues the funds to the recommended students. The financial aid office monitors the use of the funds to ensure that they are used for their intended purpose.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MIT PROVIDES SEVERAL TYPES OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS. FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS, THE INDIVIDUAL OR ORGANIZATION MUST HAVE MET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA TO BE SELECTED FOR THE PRIZE OR AWARD. IN THE CASE OF FELLOWSHIPS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, THE INDIVIDUAL IS REQUIRED TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND STUDY AT MIT. MIT MAKES GRANTS TO SEVERAL LOCAL CHAPTERS OF NATIONAL FRATERNITIES, SORORITIES AND INDEPENDENT LIVING GROUPS. THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE COMPRISED OF MIT STUDENTS, AND HOUSE THESE STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE MADE TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONAL COSTS OF THE EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES OF THE HOUSES (SO THAT THE HOUSES STAY CONSISTENT WITH MIT'S MISSION). IN ORDER FOR AN ORGANIZATION TO RECEIVE AN INDEPENDENT RESIDENCE DEVELOPMENT FUND (IRDF) GRANT, THEY MUST GO THROUGH A RIGOROUS APPLICATION PROCESS. MIT GENERALLY DOES NOT MAKE DISBURSEMENTS TO INDIVIDUALS OR ORGANIZATIONS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES, EXCEPT THROUGH THE MIT COMMUNITY SERVICE FUND. THIS FUND'S RESOURCES COME PRIMARILY FROM CONTRIBUTIONS FROM MEMBERS OF THE MIT COMMUNITY. MIT DISBURSES THESE FUNDS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES INCLUDING SMALL GRANTS, INSUBSTANTIAL IN THE AGGREGATE, TO LOCALLY BASED CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF FOSTERING BETTER COMMUNITY RELATIONS. PROCEDURES OF THE INSTITUTE WITH RESPECT TO ADMISSIONS, SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND STUDENT LOANS ARE PUBLICIZED IN THE INSTITUTE BULLETIN WHICH CONSTITUTES ITS CATALOGUE. GRANTS THAT ARE MADE IN THE CONTEXT OF ACADEMIC OR RESEARCH PROGRAMS: RECIPIENTS SPEND THEIR GRANT FUNDS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PROGRAM AND ARE ACCOUNTABLE THROUGH THE PROGRAM FOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS CHARGED WITH DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY, ALLLOCATIONS OF GRANT FUNDS, AND MONITORING OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED AFTER AN ANALYSIS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) IS COMPLETED. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, WITHOUT REGARD TO NEED, TO ENTERING NEW AND TRANSFER STUDENTS WITH OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC RECORDS. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS CHARGED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: A list of scholarship recipients is on file at the institution and is available upon request. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having an interest in the institution, such recipients are selected on an equal, objectively determinable basis with other recipients. Saint Mary's College is committed to making it possible for qualified students to enroll at the college regardless of financial circumstances. As part of this commitment, Saint Mary's College offers various levels of academic scholarships, need-based scholarships and institutional grants. Academic scholarship recipients are selected at the time of admission, on the basis of their academic achievements in high school. Need-based scholarships are named for a specific donor or group, and are awarded as part of need-based institutional grant assistance, in accordance with the specific requirements of the scholarship donor. Institutional grants are awarded primarily on financial need as the College is committed to making a Saint Mary's education a possibility for students who demonstrate financial need; each student who applies for financial aid receives consideration for grant assistance. All students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need or other similar standards. Criteria for all scholarships is published and made available to all students and their families. Grant funds/scholarships are credited directly to a student's account to ensure they are used appropriately and for their intended purpose.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - The University does not provide grants or assistance to organizations other than assistance in the form of student scholarships. Should the University consider future grants awards to organizations, monitoring will be done in accordance with OMB Uniform Guidance and sub-recipient monitoring procedures.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL AID TO INDIVIDUALS IS AWARDED BY FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLEGE POLICIES. GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN PART II ARE TO SUPPORT LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. Williams has close proximity to these local schools, community organizations, and 501(C)3 organizations in order to monitor the use of its funds.

The financial aid office determines students eligibility for federal, state, and institutional scholarships according to the University's established criteria which follows federal and state guidelines for awarding any grant funds. There is an annual audit to ensure compliance with these regulations.

HESSTON COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPT. OF ED., THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

AS FEDERALLY MANDATED, THE SCHOOL PREPARES ANNUALLY A STUDENT COST OF ATTENDANCE BUDGET, WHICH INCLUDES TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND AN ESTIMATE FOR THE COST OF BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION, AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE SCHOOL THEN AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED UPON THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND THE FAMILY'S EXPECTED CONTRIBUTION, AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL NEEDS ANALYSIS FORMULA. STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE FUNDING IN EXCESS OF THE COST OF ATTENDANCE, AND IN CASES WHERE OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE RECEIVED, STUDENT SELF-HELP AID (I.E. LOANS AND WORK-STUDY) IS REDUCED FIRST TO ENSURE THAT AID IS NOT OVER-AWARDED. STUDENTS MUST DOCUMENT ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONALLY-RELATED EXPENSES IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FUNDING ABOVE THEIR UNMET NEEDS.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN ITS PROGRAMS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA, AS WELL AS PERFORMANCE IN ACADEMICS, LEADERSHIP, MUSIC, THEATRE AND ATHLETICS. TO BE CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE, STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR ADMISSION, SUBMIT ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS OF PRIOR EDUCATIONAL WORK AND SUBMIT TEST SCORES (ACT/SAT/CLT). FOR GRANT CONSIDERATION STUDENTS MUST ADDITIONALLY SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE RENEWABLE BASED ON MEETING PUBLISHED ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS. STUDENT PROGRESS IS MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY EARN A MINIMUM NUMBER OF COLLEGE CREDITS AND A MINIMUM GPA EACH ACADEMIC YEAR IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY.

Schedule I Part I Line 2: Donations made by Covenant Medical Center, Inc. to charitable organizations are made in furtherance of the recipient organization's exempt purpose. Donations are included in community benefits in Schedule H if the contribution has been formally restricted to a community benefit activity that meets the criteria to be reported on Schedule H.

Procedures and conditions are designed to insure that individuals receiving disbursements are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy based on the institution's assessment of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.
GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF COST CENTERS AND OTHER INFORMATION; INCLUDING WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION AND RECEIPTS.

GONZAGA UNIVERSITY IS NOT A "GRANTMAKER" PER SE IN THAT ITS FUNDAMENTAL MISSION, AND PURPOSE FOR TAX-EXEMPTION, RELATES TO EDUCATION. HOWEVER, IN THE COURSE OF THESE MISSION-RELATED ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY DOES MAKE PAYMENTS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR "GRANTMAKING" AS DEFINED BY THE INSTRUCTIONS TO SCHEDULE I OF THE FORM 990. THESE PAYMENTS FALL INTO TWO CATEGORIES. (1) STUDENT FINANCIAL AID: STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT, THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES WHO QUALIFIES FOR LOANS BASED ON ANALYSIS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. LOANS ARE AWARDED AS PART OF A PACKAGE CONSISTING OF FEDERAL GRANTS, FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY LOANS, FEDERAL WORK-STUDY AND UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. IN ALL CASES, THOSE WHO RECEIVE LOANS HAVE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND HAVE COMPLETED A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION FORM. THE AMOUNTS RECEIVED ARE ADDED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES. (2) CHARITABLE: CONTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. ALL FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BASED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

CABRINI UNIVERSITY DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, HOWEVER ON OCCASION DONATIONS ARE MADE TO OTHER CHARITABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. SINCE THESE ARE DONATIONS, THEY ARE NOT MONITORED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S CABRINI UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEES. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY CABRINI UNIVERSITY. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF STUDENT CONTINUES TO DEMONSTRATE NEED, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE, AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE CABRINI UNIVERSITY POLICY. RENEWAL OF AID IS ALSO DEPENDENT ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY PRIMARILY CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED AND MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED UPON A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT CRITERIA, INCLUDING MERIT, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND FINANCIAL NEED. 1,008 STUDENTS RECEIVED FINANCIAL AID DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR FROM A COMBINATION OF ALL SOURCES (FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL). OF THE 1,008 STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID, 1,008 RECEIVED FUNDING FROM INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES.
ALL STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES AT THE UNIVERSITY.
The Organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the student's account directly. This system ensures the funds are used appropriately.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The College awards scholarships using established policies on the basis of both need and scholarship merit. Awards to students with need are based on the students' financial information contained in the financial aid profile filed with the college scholarship services and the free application for financial aid filed with the federal processor. All aid is objectively determined and awarded on an equal basis to recipients with similar attributes.
The use of grant funds is monitored through the student financial aid and billing process.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TOWARDS THE PAYMENT OF TUITION AND FEES IN WHICH CASE THE GRANT AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR VARIOUS REASONS TO STUDENTS, FACULTY AND STAFF FOR EDUCATIONAL OR WORK RELATED ACTIVITIES. IN THESE CASES EXPENSE VERIFICATION IS REQUIRED IN THE FORM OF RECEIPTS AND OTHER APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION.

THE INSTITUTION MONITORS, PROCESSES, RECONCILES, AND ADMINISTERS ITS AID PROGRAMS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH. PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IS THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE; THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER'S OFFICE HANDLES THE FISCAL DUTIES, WHICH INCLUDE REQUESTING CASH DRAWS FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GRANT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, TRACKING FEDERAL AUTHORIZATIONS, DETERMINING MATCHING REQUIREMENTS, AND PERFORMING RECONCILIATIONS. THE STUDENT BILLING OFFICE APPLIES PAYMENTS TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THIS SHARED APPROACH ALLOWS FOR SEGREGATION OF DUTIES BETWEEN THE DETERMINATION OF AWARDS AND PROCESSING PAYMENTS AND ALLOWS THE UNIVERSITY TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. CARES ACT AWARDS - STUDENT MAY REQUEST FUNDS BASED ON ANY NEED RESULTING FROM THE IMPACT OF COVID-19. THE REQUEST IS REVIEWED BY AN INDEPENDENT COMMITTEE. IF APPROVED, THE COMMITTEE NOTIFIES THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT, WHO RECORDS THE AWARD ON THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT. AMOUNTS ARE DISASTER RELIEF PAYMENTS TO REIMBURSE OR PAY FOR REASONABLE AND NECESSARY PERSONAL, FAMILY, LIVING, OR FUNERAL EXPENSES INCURRED AS A RESULT OF COVID-19.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 1 MAINTAINING RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY
ExplntnTxt: MAINTAINING RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY, AMOUNT OF AWARD, AND SELECTION CRITERIA THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MAINTAINS RECORDS AS TO STUDENTS FINANCIAL AND ACADEMIC STANDING AND THE Eligibility REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT. THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES AN AUDIT UNDER OMB's Uniform Guidance as a review of COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE RULES AND REGULATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE STUDENTS FINANCIAL AND ACADEMIC STANDING IS MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENTS REMAIN IN GOOD STANDING AND CONTINUE TO MEET ANY SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT. THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES AN AUDIT (REQUIRED BY OMB'S UNIFORM GUIDANCE) TO AUDIT COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE RULES AND REGULATIONS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS A SET OF CRITERIA BY WHICH COLLEGE AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS OF ALL STUDENT AID AWARDED AND SUBSTANTIATION FOR THE AWARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE BASED ON APPLICATION PROCESS, EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTIONS AND COST OF TUITION.

IN ORDER TO BE AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME AND MAKING SATISFACTORY PROGRESS. UNDERGRADUATE ON-CAMPUS STUDENTS COMPLETE A CROWN FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION TO HELP DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS. SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT AND SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE CROWN GRANT IS NEED-BASED USING PERCENTAGES AND MINIMUM AWARD ADOPTED FROM NOEL-LEVITZ.

THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID REVIEWS EACH ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP AWARD CRITERIA AND AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON DONOR INTENT. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID BASED ON A REVIEW OF THE ACT SCORES AND INCOMING GPA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) Estimated Number of Recipients
ExplntnTxt: Tuition and Fees: Estimate is based on the percentage of students who received assistance for tuition and fees in the prior year.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) Estimated Number of Recipients
ExplntnTxt: Fellows - Tuition and Fees: Estimate is based on the percentage of students who received Fellowships for tuition and fees in the prior year.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) Estimated Number of Recipients
ExplntnTxt: Stipends and Allowances: Estimate is based on the percentage of students who received stipends in the prior year.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Office of Sponsored Projects administration directs and facilitates pre- and post-award processes by ensuring compliance with federal, state and University guidelines. It also oversees regulatory compliance activities to ensure safe, ethical and responsible conduct of research. In addition, the office is responsible for enhancing the research infrastructure of the institution as well as developing and monitoring policies related to the stewardship of research activities.
ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS USED FOR TUITION AND FEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. THE COLLEGE MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT.

DOANE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ACCORDING TO POLICY CRITERIA WHICH RECOGNIZE FACTORS SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SPECIAL ABILITIES, AND FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. RESTRICTED GRANT FUNDS WITH SPECIFIC AWARD CRITERIA ARE ADMINISTERED BY FINANCIAL AID TO SELECT STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE GRANT.

The University's Enrollment Services Division, Office of Student Financial Services, and Office of Research Services and Sponsored Projects responsible for the administration of all grants and student aid according to current law, regulations, and policies prescribed by grantors. The University is subject to annual audits conducted in accordance with OMB Circular A-133.
PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US: GRANTS ARE MADE TO ACCREDITED SCHOOLS AND SEMINARIES. BOTH FINANCIAL AND NARRATIVE REPORTS OF GRANT ACTIVITIES ARE REQUIRED.

The university's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and continuing eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need and criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: All WellSpan entities follow WellSpan policies and procedures regarding grant projects to ensure that the use of grant funds are consistent with WellSpan's commitment to endeavor to improve the health status of the communities that we serve.The WellSpan foundations are supporting organizations and substantially all of the grants and other assistance they make furthers the exempt purposes of their "supported organizations", each of which are exempt affiliated organizations within the WellSpan Health system. Because the supported organizations identify the projects and exempt activities that will be funded by the foundations' grants and other assistance, and because there is a cross-over between the respective governing bodies and management of the foundations and their supported organizations, the foundations are able to effectively monitor that the grants they make are used for their intended purposes.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY QUEENS UNIVERSITY OF CHARLOTTE TO STUDENTS BASED ON THEIR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, TALENT IN THE FINE ARTS, AND PARTICIPATION IN INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS. THE AWARDS ARE BASED ON THEIR PERFORMANCE LEVELS. STUDENTS ARE ALSO AWARDED NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON THEIR NEED AS ESTABLISHED BY COMPLETING THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND, IF APPLICABLE, BY SPECIFIC CRITERIA AND GUIDELINES FOR OTHER INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS.

REGIONS HOSPITAL (REGIONS) MANAGEMENT STAFF REVIEW THE MISSION AND PURPOSE OF POTENTIAL GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSURE CONSISTENCY WITH REGIONS' MISSION AND PURPOSE. AMOUNTS SUBSEQUENTLY GRANTED ARE SUBJECT TO REGIONS' FORMAL SPENDING APPROVAL AND DOCUMENTATION PROCESS BASED ON AMOUNT OF THE EXPENDITURE.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID GRANTS THAT MAY BE USED FOR TUITION AND FEES ONLY.

SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON ESTABLISHED MERIT AND NEED BASED CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT HEADS WORK TOGETHER TO SELECT RECIPIENTS OF IN-HOUSE SCHOLARSHIPS. QUALIFICATIONS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS VARY. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES IF A STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A SCHOLARSHIP FROM THE UNIVERSITY AND, IF ELIGIBLE, WILL APPLY THE APPROVED SCHOLARSHIP PAYMENT TO THE RESPECTIVE STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT. NO CHECKS ARE ISSUED TO THE STUDENTS DIRECTLY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS TO ENSURE THEY ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The grant to organizations is to a 501C3 organization with which the hospital works closely and regularly throughout the year. This close relationship allows for monitoring of the grant on a regular basis. Grants to individuals are in the form of free and reduced cost memberships to our wellness center based on financial need.

Smith College awards scholarship grants and loans to students who are able to demonstrate financial need. Each student is required to submit a parent's confidential questionnaire which becomes the basis of determining need. Guidelines issued by the college scholarship service are used in ascertaining the financial requirement of the students. The financial need is generally met through a combination of loans and grants. Both are credited to the student's semester bill thus reducing the payment due to the college. The college also awards a relatively small number of merit-based grants. The college funds internships that meet rigorous academic criteria. Other financial assistance is provided to meet emergency type aid on a case-by-case basis. The college monitors all grants to individuals to ensure that funds are utilized appropriately. For grants applied to cover tuition and other fees, academic progress is required to ensure continued funding. Internships require proof of participation and satisfactory academic content. Other financial assistance requires demonstrated need. Grants to organizations are only made to those recognized by the Internal Revenue Service as being described in internal revenue code section 501(C).
All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH AN INSTITUTIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE DATABASE IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL, AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS AND POLICIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The University Foundation has established policies and procedures to ensure grant funds are distributed properly. Furthermore, the Foundation is audited annually by an independent firm and tri-annually by the CSU, Chancellor's Office to ensure compliance with these policies and procedures.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF U.S. GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE. FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPEND PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. A MAJORITY OF PAYMENTS ARE MADE VIA CHECK. FOR DOMESTIC SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE (FAO) MAINTAINS AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AID ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE FAO ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF AWARD RECIPIENTS AND RECONCILES, ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE CORRESPONDING EXPENSES WITH THE UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM. THE CASH GRANTS ARE ALSO REFLECTED ON EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE INDEPENDENTLY RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED SYSTEM-FEED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. ADDITIONALLY, ALL FEDERAL SCHOLARSHIP ACTIVITIES ARE MONITORED SEPARATELY BY THE SPONSORED ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT (SPA). FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A SPONSORED RESEARCH ACCOUNTING (SPA) DEPARTMENT WHICH HAS FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. SPECIFIC GRANT-RELATED EXPENDITURE ACTIVITIES ARE PROCESSED BY THE UNIVERSITY ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING: A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) NEGOTIATES SUBCONTRACTS WITH SUB-RECIPIENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST. WHEN AN AGREEMENT IS FULLY EXECUTED, IT MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING (SPA) ALONG WITH A COMPLETED CONSULTANT PAYMENT FORM. ANY ISSUES REGARDING SUB-RECIPIENT PERFORMANCE ARE REPORTED TO THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST AND SPA. ALSO, SPA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 REQUIREMENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS OVER THE AWARDING, DISBURSING, AND MONITORING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE OF NEW JERSEY REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN EXTERNAL AUDIT PERFORMED IN ACCORDANCE WITH TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS PART 200 (UNIFORM GUIDANCE) AND NEW JERSEY OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET CIRCULAR 15-08.

ALL COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID PROCESS AND ARE RECORDED AS CREDITS ON THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THESE AWARDS HELP TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, FEES AND ROOM AND BOARD. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE TRACKED IN THE COLLEGE'S ERP SYSTEM AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE WITHIN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO COMPLY WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL REGULATIONS.

THE COLLEGE FIRST INSPECTS CHARGES TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE APPROPRIATE AND ALLOWABLE. THIS INCLUDES CHECKING CLERICAL ACCURACY, REVIEWING BALANCES, AND CHECKING COMPLIANCE WTIH APPLICABLE AGENCY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SURE THAT THE EXPENSE FALLS WITHIN THE REQUIRED CATEGORY AND BUDGETARY AMOUNT. THIS INCLUDES REVIEWING EXPENSE CATEGORIES, REBUDGETING OR TRANSFERRING EXPENSES AS NEEDED, AND DETERMINING IF THE AWARD WILL BE UNDERSPENT AT THE END OF THE BUDGET OR GRANT PERIOD.
ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND PAY FOR TUITION AND FEES. PER OTIS POLICY, BFA/MFA SCHOLARSHIPS DO NOT EXCEED TUITION AND FEES.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS THE GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
The university grants scholarships to eligible students and maintains records as to their eligibility and qualifications.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS RECORDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AWARDED TO NCU STUDENTS IN THE POWERFAIDS DATABASE. THIS SYSTEM TRACKS ENROLLMENT AND AID ELIGIBILITY AND ENSURES THAT STUDENTS ARE NOT AWARDED AID THAT EXCEEDS THEIR COST TO ATTEND COLLEGE. IN ADDITION THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ALWAYS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT IN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO ENSURE AWARDED FUNDS GO FIRST TO COVER TUITION AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.
THE SCHOOL APPLIES THE MONIES GRANTED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION DIRECTLY TO TUITION COSTS.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES ALL STUDENTS' FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BASED ON GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. THESE AWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL PACKAGE AND ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS ONCE ALL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID RECONCILES ALL FEDERAL FUNDS TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION COMMON ORIGINATION AND DISBURSEMENT SYSTEM ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IN ADDITION, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE RECONCILES THE AWARD DISBURSEMENT ACTIVITIES POSTED TO THE INSTITUTE'S GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE LEDGERS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDS REPORTS. THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE ALSO PROCESSES THE REIMBURSEMENT REQUESTS AND RECONCILIATION OF FUNDS RECEIVED, AND MONITORS THE SPENDING LEVEL TO ENSURE THAT ACTUAL DISBURSEMENTS DOES NOT EXCEED THE AUTHORIZED GOVERNMENT GRANT.

Vassar College raises funds for, and makes contributions to, a wide variety of 501(C)(3) organizations in the greater Poughkeepsie area. These organizations are selected annually by a committee of employees and students after review of their activities and mission. Employees and students also volunteer time at each organization. Funds are collected annually from the gifts of employees, students, trustees and friends of Vassar as part of the "Community Works" campaign. Vassar also makes small contributions to other local non-profit and governmental entities who are not part of the campaign.

Students who are awarded scholarships have funds credited to their account and the use is restricted to purposes related to enrollment in a program of study. Recipients of fellowships are required to submit periodic written reports of their activities to the College.

SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF PRESIDENT/CEO, DIRECTOR OF TRAINING, DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, CO-DIRECTOR OF SOCIAL WORKS & DIVERSITY AND BOARD MEMBER(S) REVIEWS THE FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION SUBMITTED BY STUDENTS. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE STUDENT'S TAX RETURN FORMS AND LETTER OF RECOMMENDATION AND DETERMINES ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED.

FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND STUDENT ACCOUNTING AND IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

Within the limits of available resources, the University makes every effort to make financial aid opportunities available to needy and academically eligible students. Students must be enrolled in full-time undergraduate or graduate degree programs to be considered for University academic scholarships, grants, and/or need-based financial aid. With the exception of some academic scholarships and graduate aid, students who wish to apply for grants, loans, or work-study must submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Awards are considered on the basis of financial need and/or a student's academic profile. Awards are packaged using a combination of grants and scholarships, loans, and work-study assignments. Students must be in good academic standing and achieve the minimum standards of academic progress. The University uses the College Board's PowerFaids software to manage our financial aid database and awarding procedures.
STUDENTS ARE VERIFIED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND FUNDS ARE POSTED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. ACCOUNT IS REFUNED IF NOT USED IN SPECIFIED TIME OR IF STUDENT WITHDRAWS.

GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS: THE UNIVERSITY MADE A GRANT OF PERSONAL PROPERTY AND CASH THIS YEAR TO PANTHER HEALTH PARTNERS, A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION, FOR THE PURPOSE OF A PROJECT RELATED TO A HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER TO BENEFIT THE UNIVERSITY AND THE ORANGEBURG COMMUNITY. THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATIONS SERVES TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE PROPERTY FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSES. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS: THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS REQUIRES THE VERIFICATION OF 1) ENROLLMENT STATUS, 2) NUMBER OF HOURS ENROLLED, 3) NUMBER OF EARNED CREDIT HOURS, 4) GPA, AND 5) HOUSING STATUS. IN ADDITION, A REVIEW OF STUDENT ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IS CONDUCTED EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE OVERALL STANDING IN RELATION TO THE COLLEGE'S ESTABLISHED SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC POLICY (SAP). FOR CARES EMERGENCY GRANTS, AWARDS WERE BASED ON NEED AS ESTABLISHED BY PELL AND TITLE IV ELIGIBILITY. THE UNIVERSITY ALLOCATED EMERGENCY GRANT AWARDS TO STUDENTS ACROSS MULTIPLE PHASES AND TIERS WITH FUNDING AMOUNTS BEING BASED ON ELIGIBILITY REPORTED ON THE FAFSA. THESE FUNDS WERE MANAGED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL PLANNING MONITORS ALL AWARDS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLEGE ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB A-133.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING STERLING COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHARLES R. DREW UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES GRANTS TO CHARITIES AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS TO FURTHER ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES. EACH GRANT HAS DIFFERENT REPORTING PROCEDURE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE RECIPIENT. OFTENTIMES, THE REPORTING IS DETERMINED BY THE GRANTEE, IF , BUT THE ORGANIZATION OBTAINS REPORTING, EITHER VERBAL OR WRITTEN, TO HIGHLIGHT THE USES AND IMPACT OF THE GRANTS GIVEN.

The College provides scholarships to students enrolled in its programs. Scholarships are awarded based upon student achievements in academics and performing arts. To be considered for scholarship assistance, students must apply for admission and submit academic transcripts of prior education work, test scores (ACT/SAT), and an application for the scholarship program. Some scholarships require additional recommendations or certifications by third parties. Academic progress of scholarship recipients is monitored, and recipients must earn both a minimum amount of college credits and a minimum GPA each semester in order to maintain eligibility. Scholarships are applied directly to student accounts.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 DONATIONS ARE MADE TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE PURPOSES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES OF LIBERTY UNIVERSITY. GRANTS TO 501(C)(4) ORGANIZATIONS ARE CONTRACTUALLY OBLIGATED TO USE FUNDS SOLELY IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH APPLICABLE PROVISIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE GOVERNING 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS. FUNDS ARE PROHIBITED FROM BEING EXPENDED FOR ELECTION PURPOSES, INCLUDING CONTRIBUTIONS TO ANY CANDIDATE OR POLITICAL ORGANIZATION, OR TO INFLUENCE ANY ELECTION FOR PUBLIC OFFICE. Schedule I, Part III, Column B GOVERNMENT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ARE MADE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AS PRESCRIBED BY FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. PRIVATE AND INSTITUTION FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON PROGRAM CRITERIA, WHICH INCLUDED SCHOLASTIC MERIT, ATHLETIC EXCELLENCE, ARTISTIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED, HIGH SCHOOL ATTENDED, AND FIELD WORKED.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING OF SCHOLARSHIPS - THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE NOTIFIES THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF AMOUNTS AVAILABLE TO AWARD TO STUDENTS EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE SELECTS RECIPIENTS BASED UPON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR EACH TYPE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE OF EXPENDITURES FOR EACH TERM DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR. AT YEAR-END, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ACCOUNTING OFFICE RECONCILE ACCOUNTS FOR ALL FUNDS. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE PROVIDES ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE DONORS REGARDING THE USE OF DONOR-CONTRIBUTED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS (ENDOWED OR ANNUALLY FUNDED). PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING RESEARCH GRANTS: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING RESEARCH GRANTS VARY DEPENDING ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE AWARDING ENTITY AND THE GRANT. HOWEVER, MONITORING PROCEDURES TYPICALLY INVOLVE WRITTEN AND/OR VERBAL REPORTS ON THE RESEARCH PROJECT ARE SUBMITTED DURING AND/OR AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT; FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE PREPARED BY THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE AND SUBMITTED FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF PROJECT EXPENDITURES. FINAL PAYMENT OF GRANT FUNDS IS OFTEN CONTINGENT ON THE AFOREMENTIONED ITEMS. DEPARTMENTS AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS OR GRANT ADMINISTRATORS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING OF GRANT FUNDS WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE OFFICE OF GRANTS AND STRATEGIC INITIATIVES AND THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE. PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING OTHER AWARDS AND PRIZES: AWARD/PRIZE RECIPIENTS ARE DETERMINED BY CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE RESPECTIVE DEPARTMENTS. DEPENDING ON THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, DEPARTMENTS PARTNER WITH A VARIETY OF UNIVERSITY OFFICES INCLUDING FINANCIAL AID, ADVANCEMENT, GRANTS AND STRATEGIC INITIATIVES, AND ACCOUNTING TO MAKE SURE THAT THE AWARD FUNDS ARE DISBURSED CONSISTENTLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANT OR RESTRICTED FUND.

BETHANY LUTHERAN COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT OF POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS. THESE AWARDS ARE MONITORED AND AWARDED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

Hiram College awards aid per the regulations set forth by the appropriate governing body. The aid is administered by professionals and the programs comply with all regulations as attested in the Single Audit.

STUDENTS FILL OUT A FAFSA TO SEE WHAT GOVERNMENT AID THEY QUALIFY FOR. THE DIRECTOR FOR FINANCIAL AID AWARDS THE GOVERNMENT AID BASED ON TITLE IV RULES AND REGULATIONS AND AID FROM THE COLLEGE BASED ON COLLEGE POLICY. RECORDS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN STUDENT FILES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS AUDITED ANNUALLY.

Moravian College follows state and federal regulations in administering scholarships and grants as well as institutional policy when administering college funds. The college follows federal methodology to determine financial need for awarding federal funds and need-based institutional funds. All students applying for financial aid follow an annual application process by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Files are reviewed for conflicting information and to complete required verification of application data. Moravian credits all financial aid awards, except for work study, directly to students' receivable account offsetting charges for tuition, fees and campus room and board. Changes in student enrollment status are reviewed to ensure that students remain eligible for financial aid and awards are adjusted as necessary. Any refunds from student accounts are done in compliance with state and federal regulations.

The Organization provides grants/contributions to other organizations which are tax-exempt under IRC Section 501(c)(3) and governmental divisions that benefit the community and region through programs and activities.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS IN THE UNITED STATES PRIMARILY CONSIST OF NEED-BASED GRANTS. STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THESE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BY COMPLETING TWO FORMS THAT ESTABLISH ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID. THESE ARE STANDARD FORMS USED IN HIGHER EDUCATION FOR THIS PURPOSE: COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE FINANCIAL AID PROFILE AND FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR AMOUNTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS AS FINANCIAL AID ARE APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. HAMPSHIRE COLLEGE GRANT AID ASSISTANCE IS GENERALLY LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT OF TUITION. THE COLLEGE ALSO OFFERS FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE ARE SIMILARLY APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE AND DO NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT OF TUITION.

ALL AWARDS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHO REVIEWS EACH APPLICATION TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS GPA, CREDIT HOURS, AND ENROLLMENT STATUS ARE MET. AWARDS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AS A NON-CASH CREDIT, TO ENSURE EACH SCHOLARSHIP IS USED FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSE.

For federal and pass-through grants for programs, each grant has a grant manager. On a monthly basis, the business office staff reconciles expenses incurred for each grant and verifies with the respective grant manager. Once confirmed, the business office staff requests reimbursement from the respective awarding agency. For scholarships, financial aid office staff reviews the specific criteria for awarding to students. The business office staff does a reconciliation of expenses (financial aid awarded) before drawing down actual dollars from the endowment and federal financial aid. For program endowments, there are two different methods used. Some programs have "budget managers" who are aware of the funds available via the business office staff and spend accordingly. For those programs without "budget managers and for unrestricted endowments, the business office staff ensures that there are expenses incurred in those specific departments before drawing down actual dollars. In all cases for the endowments, the business office staff does a reconciliation to ensure that the proper dollar amount is calculated, awarded/expensed, and drawn down.

Each year, the organization awards scholarships to qualified individuals wishing to seek an education or degree in the healthcare field. Clinical and medical staff, nurses and physicians are essential to the Hospitals goal to provide high quality patient care. Scholarships are awarded on the basis of financial need, academic achievement, and the goal of pursuing a healthcare career.

STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. IN EACH CASE THE STUDENT CAN RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR FUNDING FOR AS MANY AS EIGHT SEMESTERS AS A FULL-TIME STUDENT, PROVIDED THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA SUCH AS GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND GRADE PROCESSION AS OUTLINED IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOGUE. INDIVIDUAL AWARD AMOUNTS ARE BASED UPON THE STUDENTS' COST TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY IN A GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. FACTORS INCLUDED IN THE CALCULATED COST INCLUDE TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD, AND ESTIMATES FOR THE COST OF BOOKS AND PERSONAL EXPENSES DURING THE NINE MONTH ACADEMIC YEAR. AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT MAY NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THE COST OF TUITION FROM THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANT FUNDS. HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.
AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All grant expenditures are reviewed by the Grant Accountant for reasonableness, allowable expenditures, and compliance to the grant regulations and criteria. All scholarships and assistance are provided as a credit to the student's tuition account.
THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS AND MAINTAINS RECORDS REGARDING ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS.

Pitzer College awards scholarships only to individual undergraduate students. These scholarships are awarded based upon academic achievement and/or demonstrated financial need. The Financial Aid Office, with the assistance of the Registrar's Office, monitor student enrollment each semester to ensure that students remain qualified for financial aid. The College also awards tuition to dependents of its employees who meet the requirements of the College's Tuition Remission Program. Employee dependents must be enrolled at one of the undergraduate schools of The Claremont Colleges. Tuition is paid directly to the undergraduate college after grades are submitted to the Human Resources Office as evidence of course completion.

ORGANIZATION PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT GRANT PROGRAM OF REID HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC. DEMONSTRATES THE COMMITMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION TO COMMUNITY SERVICE THROUGH FUNDING ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE REID HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC. SERVICE AREA WHICH FUNCTION TO MEET AN IDENTIFIED HEALTH NEED OR NEEDS AND/OR REDUCE A GOVERNMENT BURDEN THROUGH THEIR EFFORTS OR PROGRAMS. GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE ACCEPTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA WEB APPLICATION ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. UPON SUBMISSION OF A GRANT BY A COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION, A REPRESENTATIVE FROM REID HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC.'S COMMUNITY BENEFIT DEPARTMENT MAY CONDUCT A SITE VISIT TO GAIN FURTHER KNOWLEDGE OF THE ORGANIZATION AND PROGRAM TO BE FUNDED. ALL GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND SCORED BY THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT DEPARTMENT MEMBERS. SCORING FACTORS INCLUDE THE ABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION OR PROGRAM TO: - IMPROVE COMMUNITY HEALTH - ADVANCE HEALTH KNOWLEDGE THROUGH EDUCATION - ADVANCE HEALTH KNOWLEDGE THROUGH RESEARCH - RELIEVE A GOVERNMENT BURDEN - FOCUS ON ONE OF THE TOP PRIORITIZED HEALTH NEEDS BASED ON THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT INCLUDING: - MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE MISUSE - PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, NUTRITION AND WEIGHT - ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES - FOCUS ON ANOTHER IDENTIFIED HEALTH NEED THE SCORES ARE THEN DISCUSSED AND AVERAGED FOR AN OVERALL SCORE OF THE GRANT REQUEST. THESE REQUESTS AND SCORE SHEETS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL AND MODIFICATIONS TO THE AWARDED AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED. FOR AWARDS EXCEEDING $15,000, THE GRANT REQUEST MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR FINAL APPROVAL. ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT QUARTERLY REPORTS DETAILING: - THE PROJECT FUNDED - THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE AND TARGET POPULATION SERVED - HOW THE FUNDS WERE UTILIZED - OUTCOMES OF THE ORGANIZATION/PROGRAM TO DATE ATTEMPTS WILL BE MADE BY THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT TEAM MEMBERS TO CONTACT ORGANIZATIONS WHO FAIL TO SUBMIT REPORTS IN AN EFFORT TO RESOLVE THE DEFICIENCY. FAILURE TO SUBMIT QUARTERLY REPORTS BY AN ORGANIZATION MAY JEOPARDIZE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR FUTURE COMMUNITY BENEFIT GRANT FUNDING TO THAT ORGANIZATION. LIKEWISE, ORGANIZATIONS WHO FAIL TO DEMONSTRATE POSITIVE COMMUNITY IMPACT MAY FORFEIT FURTHER FUNDING OPPORTUNITY.

THE STUDENT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS DETERMINED EACH STUDENT WAS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS THEIR LIST, PRIOR TO ENTERING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT, AS PAYMENT. FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PROVIDED MONTHLY REPORTS AS THESE AWARDS ARE EXPENSED OUT OF THE FINANCIAL AID BUDGET. STUDENTS ARE AWARE OF THESE AWARDS THROUGH VARIOUS PUBLICATIONS. STUDENTS HAVE DIRECT ACCESS TO ALL DETAILS OF THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN U.S.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE FUND EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FURTHER MONITOR THE USAGE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THESE AMOUNTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY AGAINST STUDENTS TUITION ACCOUNT AND THERE IS NO OPPORTUNITY FOR THE STUDENT TO DIVERT THESE FUNDS TO NON-EDUCATIONAL USES.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC TALENT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED THAT DOCUMENT THE STUDENTS' FINANCIAL NEED, ELIGIBILITY TO QUALIFY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS, AND THE AMOUNTS AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE IN THE FORM OF TUITION ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING USE OF FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: Grants are provided on the basis of verified financial need or merit. The university does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age, sex, disability, or prior military service. Financial assistance is monitored so that it is in compliance with awarding terms and conditions. Expenditures are reviewed for permissibility and compliance. Students are required to submit appropriate documents for approval.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN(B) - NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: Cash grants are credits to student accounts. The number of recipients represents only the number of students receiving institutional funding and Federal Supplemental Opportunity Grants. Outside grants, or application of funds provided by outside organizations, are not included.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AUDITED ANNUALLY BY THE A133 AUDIT.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH CONTROLS WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING AND INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT OFFICES. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR RECEIVES, VETS AND COORDINATES SUBMITTALS FOR GRANTS. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR MONITORS THE AWARDS OF FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR AND ACCOUNTING OFFICE MONITOR WORK PERFORMED, BILLING, GRANT CLOSE OUT, AND POST GRANT REPORTING.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA ON AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT BASIS.

GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED IN TWO AREAS, DEPENDING ON THE USE. GRANT FUNDS FOR FINANCIAL AID ARE MONITORED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE, WHICH OVERSEES THE AWARDING AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FINANCIAL AID TO UNIVERSITY STUDENTS. GRANTS FOR RESEARCH AND FACULTY DEVELOPMENT ARE MONITORED BY THE ASSISTANT TO THE PROVOST. ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE AND PROPER REPORTING BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY, OVERSEEN BY THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND OPERATIONS.

GRANT MONITORING PROCESS FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS BASED ON THE GENERAL CRITERIA FOR INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID. GPA AND ENROLLMENT ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THESE CRITERIA ARE MET.

Awarded grants and scholarships are directly credited against the student's tuition balance; no cash changes hands. The Financial Aid Office tracks the amounts awarded and periodically runs reports to check for changes in eligibility for all outside grants or scholarships.

STUDENTS REQUESTING FINANCIAL AID ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A FINANCIAL AID FORM FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THIS INFORMATION TO DETERMINE WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS (FOR EXAMPLE - PELL, PERKINS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY, SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, ETC.)

FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS APPLICABLE TO THE SPECIFIC PROGRAM. INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES ALLOW FOR SEPARATION OF AWARDING AND DISBURSING OF FUNDS. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AND FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED BY AN EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL PROGRAM GUIDELINES.
GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE NETWORK'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF COST CENTERS AND OTHER INFORMATION; INCLUDING WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION AND RECEIPTS.

1. AIE - WA provides non-cash grants to its scholarship recipients. Scholarships are awarded to both first and second-year students in the form of reduced tuition, generally to those with the highest need. Grant/scholarship funds are tracked on the scholarship spreadsheet. This spreadsheet is maintained and monitored by the Financial Aid Administrator, Controller - U.S. Operations, CFO, and CEO. Approved/Awarded scholarship information is also recorded in the Student Payment Record spreadsheet, accounting software, and academic software, where it is applied to the student's invoice/ledger reducing the tuition balance. These systems are regularly monitored by the Financial Aid Administrator, Controller - U.S. Operations, CFO, and CEO. 2. Grants to affiliates - Grants to affiliates are typically awarded as unrestricted funds and may be used for any purpose. Nonetheless, spending is closely monitored by the U.S. Controller, the CFO and the Board of Directors through budgets, monthly reviews, and ad hoc internal audits.

A REPORT IS RUN AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER TO REVIEW EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AND PROGRESS TOWARD THEIR DEGREE. STUDENTS RECEIVING MERIT AWARDS WHO FAIL TO ACHIEVE GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING ARE REVIEWED FOR ALTERNATIVE INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. EVERY EFFORT IS MADE TO FIND ALTERNATIVE FUNDING FOR STUDENTS NOT MEETING GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.
STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION, WHICH IS APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST A STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT IT IS USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS POLICY INSTITUTED BY THE INSTITUTION. BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS EACH SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT THEY INDEED ARE CORRECT ON THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AND IN THE G/L SYSTEM.

BAKER UNIVERSITY MONITORS ALL GRANTS WITH SPECIFIC INQUIRIES AND REVIEWS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. ALL GRANTS ARE PLACED UNDER THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ONE INDIVIDUAL WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION. THE BUSINESS OFFICE WILL THEN ASSIST IN PREPARING DOCUMENTS WHICH ARE TYPICALLY REQUIRED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

Biola University awards both merit and need-based scholarships to students at the graduate and undergraduate levels. Merit awards are based on elibility criteria such as academic, athletic, and music abilities. These typically have academic or participation requirements for renewal. Continued eligibility based on stated requirements is monitored by the Financial Aid office or by the office that makes the awards. Need-based awards are typically awarded based on specific formulas that are based on an institutional or federal cost amount combined with the federal EFC determined by the FAFSA. Continued eligibility is normally contingent on ongoing need in subsequent years. Most of the grants and scholarships awarded by Biola are funded from general funds; however, a portion are funded from restricted funds that have been provided by donors, and are awarded based on the eligibility criteria established by the donors. Some of these funds are awarded by various campus departments, and some through an application process administered by the Financial Aid Office. The Financial Aid Office works closely with accounting and finance offices to monitor availability of funds from both the general fund and restricted fund accounts. No cash changes hands and funds are directly tied to student accounts.

GTU'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS NEED BASED AWARDS AND ASSISTANCE USING THE FAFSA DATA AND STANDARD RANKING TO DETERMINE NEED. GTU'S FACULTY DEAN'S OFFICE AWARDS MERIT BASED AWARDS USING ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AND/OR ANALYSIS BY COMMITTEE OF WRITTEN APPLICATIONS. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS POSTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEE EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

MONITORING GRANTS SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. TOURO UNIVERSITY NEVADA MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND UNIVERSITY GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

THE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL OF CINCINNATI, OHIO ("HOSPITAL") PROVIDES GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS ON A VERY LIMITED BASIS. IN THOSE INSTANCES, THE DEPARTMENT GRANTING THE FUNDS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OBTAINING AND STORING ALL NECESSARY INFORMATION FROM THE OTHER ORGANIZATION AND INDIVIDUALS RELATIVE TO HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE SPENT. GENERALLY, GRANTS ARE PROVIDED, ON BEHALF OF HOSPITAL THOUGH TRIHEALTH, INC. ("TRIHEALTH"), A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION OF HOSPITAL, WHICH PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SERVICES TO HOSPITAL. AS SUCH, TRIHEALTH IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE SPENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants and other assistance awarded to individuals in the U.S. represent student financial aid. Student financial aid awards are determined by the university's assessment of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Student financial services continuously monitors student eligibility for these awards. Student financial services is responsible for regulatory compliance.
