ALL GRANTS REPRESENT INTERNAL TRANSFER OF FUNDS FROM ENDOWMENTS OR OTHER ACCOUNTS TO A REVENUE ACCOUNT FOR TUITION PAYMENTS. NO FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO INDIVIDUALS. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND SMU GRANT LEVELS ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ENTERING GPA AND NEED. FOR INCOMING FRESHMAN, TEST SCORES ARE ALSO A FACTOR. PROVIDED THAT EACH STUDENT MAINTAINS THE REQUIRED GPA, DOES NOT EXCEED THE MAXIMUM TIMEFRAME FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID AND SUBMITS EITHER A FAFSA OR FAFSA WAIVER BY THE MARCH 1ST DEADLINE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR HIS/HER MERIT SCHOLARSHIP OR SMU GRANT. DURING THE YEAR, THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED A FEDERAL ALLOCATION OF $1,252,197 FROM THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY (CARES ACT) RELIEF FUNDS, OF WHICH HALF $606,186 WAS PROVIDED DIRECTLY TO OUR STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS WERE PROVIDED DUE TO THE SPREAD OF THE NOVEL CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) AROUND THE GLOBE WHICH HAS AFFECTED THE UNIVERSITY. ON FEBRUARY 29, 2020, THE GOVERNOR ISSUED PROCLAMATION 20-05, DECLARING A STATE OF EMERGENCY FOR ALL COUNTIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WASHINGTON AS A RESULT OF COVID-19. DUE TO THE CONTINUED WORLDWIDE SPREAD OF THE VIRUS, ON MARCH 13, 2020, THE GOVERNOR EXERCISED EMERGENCY POWERS UNDER RCW 43.06.220, WHICH PROHIBITED ALL PUBLIC AND PRIVATE UNIVERSITIES, COLLEGES, AND TECHNICAL SCHOOLS FROM CONDUCTING IN-PERSON CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION AND LECTURERS. DUE TO THE STATE OF EMERGENCY, THE UNIVERSITY CLOSED RESIDENCE HALLS AND ISSUED HOUSING REFUNDS. THE UNIVERSITY WENT TO A COMPLETELY ONLINE MODE, AND HAD TO CHANGE QUICKLY TO ADAPT TO THE CHANGING ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: INDIVIDUALS REQUESTING ANY FORM OF FINANCIAL AID MUST COMPLETE PERSONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND IF THEY'RE DEPENDENTS, THEY MUST ALSO PROVIDE PARENTAL OR GUARDIAN FINANCIAL INFORMATION. ONLY INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL AT THE TIME OF DISBUSEMENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS MAY ONLY BE USED TO DEFRAY THE EDUCATIONAL COSTS OF MARTICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. NO STUDENT MAY DEFRAY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR PERSONAL MATTERS; ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT UNDERTAKE FURTHER MONITORING ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED.
MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED WHICH SUBSTANTIATES ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.

The college's financial aid office awards scholarships to students based on eligibility criteria predetermined by donors and college policies. All awards are applied to tuition and related education expenses only.

ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS BY THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE. STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. IN EACH CASE THE STUDENT CAN RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR FUNDING FOR AS MANY AS EIGHT SEMESTERS AS A FULL-TIME STUDENT, PROVIDED THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA SUCH AS GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND GRADE PROCESSION AS OUTLINED IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK. AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT MAY NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THE COST OF TUITION FROM THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANT FUNDS. A RECONCILIATION IS DONE REGULARLY BETWEEN THE TWO DEPARTMENTS/SYSTEMS TO ENSURE ACCURACY AND PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS. IN ADDITION, AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM TO REVIEW COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

THE UNIVERSITY MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO NORTHWESTERN FOUNDATION, A RELATED ORGANIZATION UNDER COMMON MANAGEMENT. FOR THE GRANTS TO UNRELATED ORGANIZATIONS, SENIOR MANAGEMENT GENERALLY MONITORS RECIPIENT SPENDING VIA COMMUNICATION WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS TO SEE HOW OPERATIONS ARE RUNNING. A SITE VISIT BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT MAY ALSO BE CONDUCTED TO CHECK THE STATUS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND/OR MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THE INTENDED PROJECT. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE UNIVERSITY. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY.

Scholarship recipients are selected based on established merit and need-based criteria. The Financial Aid Director and Academic Department Heads work together to select institutional scholarship recipients. Qualifications for scholarships vary. All scholarships are monitored by the Financial Aid Department and are applied directly to each student's account.

ALL GRANTS REPORTED IN PART III OF SCHEDULE I ARE TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR COSTS OF ATTENDANCE. GRANTS ARE ELECTRONICALLY TRANSMITTED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID INTO THE ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE SYSTEM OF THE BUSINESS OFFICE BASED UPON SYSTEM IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS FOR INDIVIDUALS. EACH STUDENT IS ABLE TO COMPARE THE AID POSTED AGAINST HIS BILLING STATEMENT FOR TUITION AND FEES TO THE AWARD LETTER HE RECEIVED FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. ADDITIONALLY, DURING THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL AUDIT, THIS PROCESS IS TESTED FOR ACCURACY NOT ONLY OF AMOUNTS AND ASSIGNMENT TO CORRECT INDIVIDUALS, BUT ALSO FOR ANY RESTRICTIONS OF GRANT FUNDING REGARDING AWARDEE ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED TO QUALIFY FOR ANY PARTICULAR AWARD. LINE THREE IN PART III REPORTS THE FEDERALLY FUNDED SUPPLEMENTAL GRANTS; THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY CONTRACTS FOR AN AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE.
THE FUNDS ARE PROVIDED TO THE RELATED FOUNDATION AND THEREFORE ALL FUNDS ARE USED IN THE US.

Regarding grants and assistance to students in the U.S.: the College determines the students' eligibility prior to releasing the grant, and then monitors their enrollment status and satisfactory academic progress.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AS DETERMINED THROUGH INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE STUDENT FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). MANAGEMENT AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS THAT QUALIFY, BASED ON DONOR STIPULATIONS (I.E. SPECIFIC MAJORS, LOCALITY, ETC.) AND AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE NEED BASED AWARDS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO STUDENTS FOR THEIR HIGHER EDUCATION EXPENSES. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING AWARDS ARE ON CAMPUS AND MEET WITH FINANCIAL AID COUNSELORS TO ENSURE STUDENTS ARE RESIDENTS WITHIN THE US AND ENROLLED AT THE INSTITUTION.

A list of recipients of scholarships is on file at the college and is available on request. Although there may be recipients who are related persons having an interest in the college, such recipients are selected on an equal, objectively determined basis with other recipients. That is all students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the college's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other standards. Approximately 1,390 students received $35,287,951 in institutional scholarships and $1,100,794 in other financial aid.
Students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES: ALL FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLE BALANCE. NO CASH IS PHYSICALLY TRANSMITTED. CREDIT BALANCES THAT RESULT FROM FEDERAL STUDENT AND PARENT LOAN PROCEEDS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE BORROWER WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME FRAME REQUIRED BY THE REGULATIONS GOVERNING THESE PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED GRANTS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY FORMS OF FEDERAL STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. STUDENT AID AWARDED FROM BOTH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES ARE MONITORED CONTINUOUSLY THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR USING VARIOUS BUDGET STATUS REPORTS, STUDENT ACCOUNT STATUS REPORTS, AND DEFERRAL AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM RECONCILIATION REPORTS.

Financial aid to individuals is awarded by the College's financial aid professionals in accordance with College policies. Financial aid is electronically disbursed and credited to the individual student's account for tuition, fees, room, board, and other eligible charges. Awards to sub-recipients are in accordance with College policies and provisions under Uniform Guidance.
THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN A SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.: ALL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE WHICH IS TO PROVIDE AID TO STUDENTS WITH FINANCIAL NEED TO COVER THE STUDENTS' COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE GRANTS INCLUDE FEDERAL PELL GRANTS, FEDERAL SEOG GRANTS, AND STATE PHEAA GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS THAT ARE PROVIDED FROM FOUNDATIONS, ALUMNI SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS, AND OTHER DONORS. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLEGE PROVIDES INTERNAL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE AWARDED AND POSTED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE RECONCILED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ON A MONTHLY BASIS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES AS WELL AS ANY DONOR RESTRICTED GRANT GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REPORTS STUDENT GRANT AWARDS TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PHEAA THROUGHOUT THE YEAR AND ALSO SUBMITS THE REQUIRED ANNUAL FISAP REPORT TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. AN ANNUAL A-133 AUDIT (FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORT OF INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133) IS CONDUCTED BY THE COLLEGES' EXTERNAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
THE GRANTEES WERE APPROVED BY THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT AND CONFIRMED WITH THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WHEN SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE, STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO MAKE APPLICATION TO THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. UPON REVIEW BY THE COMMITTEE, FUNDS ARE DISBURSED ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS. ALL STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS REGARDLESS OF RACE, COLOR, SEX, HANDICAP, AGE, AND NATIONAL ETHNIC ORIGIN.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS TO HELP DEFRAY THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND DONOR STIPULATIONS.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES TUITION DISCOUNT ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS AFFILIATED WITH CERTAIN ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT.

MONITORING PROCEDURES PART II: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR FINANCIAL AFFAIRS. RESPONSIBILITY CENTER HEADS WITHIN THE UNIVERSITY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE GENERAL USE OF UNIVERSITY FUNDS FOR APPROVED USES. DISBURSEMENT REQUESTS FOR GRANT FUNDS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM (FAIS) ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER. WHEN THE REQUESTOR IS ALSO THE FAIS ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER, THE GRANT FUNDING REQUEST MUST BE SIGNED BY THE NEXT HIGHER LEVEL ADMINISTRATOR. THE UNIVERSITY'S DISBURSEMENT PROCESS IDENTIFIES AND RECORDS PAYMENTS TO BOTH U.S. AND FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS/ENTITIES. THE UNIVERSITY EMPLOYS APPROPRIATE MEASURES TO REDUCE THE RISK THAT ANY GRANT FUNDING PROVIDED IS NOT USED FOR NON-CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR EXPLOITATION BY TERRORIST ORGANIZATIONS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, UNIVERSITY ATTENDANCE AND/OR PARTICIPATION AT SPONSORED EVENTS AND ONGOING REVIEWS OF THE SPECIALLY DESIGNATED NATIONALS LIST PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY. FOR RESEARCH SUBCONTRACTS,THE INITIAL DETERMINATION OF ELIGIBILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF THE ENTITY LIES JOINTLY BETWEEN THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI)/DEPARTMENT AND THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH. THE PI/DEPARTMENT IDENTIFIES THE ENTITY USUALLY BASED UPON THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THE PI EVIDENCED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK. DOCUMENTATION IS OBTAINED FROM THE ENTITY WHICH IS REVIEWED. UPON SUBMISSION, THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH LOOKS FOR THIS DOCUMENTATION SO THAT IT MEETS SPONSOR AND UNIVERSITY REQUIREMENTS. IF AND WHEN THE PROJECT IS FUNDED, THE DEPARTMENT INITIATES A SUBCONTRACT REQUEST. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: MONITORING PROCEDURES PART III GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE INSTITUTION DOES MAINTAIN RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE. THE RECORDS, ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED BY EITHER THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID, THE STUDENTS' SCHOOL DEPARTMENT, THE BENEFITS SECTION OF HUMAN RESOURCES, OR THE FACULTY RECORDS OFFICE. GRANT FUNDS THAT ARE RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE NOT REFUNDABLE IN CASH TO THE STUDENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SYSTEM. GRANTS THAT ARE NOT RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE REFUNDABLE TO THE STUDENTS ARE NOT MONITORED.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REFLECTS THE ACTUAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES WHO RECEIVED THE ASSISTANCE.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET PROCEDURES IN MONITORING AND DETERMINING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. ELIGIBLE STUDENTS ARE CHOSEN AS GRANT RECIPIENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE BASED ON NEED AND/OR MERIT. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENTS FILES TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENT RECEIVES NECESSARY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON GRADES, COURSE OF STUDY AND FINANCIAL NEED. ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE REQUIRED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF ATTENDANCE; FUNDS MAY NOT BE SPENT ON DISCRETIONARY ITEMS. The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ("CARES") Act Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund allocated funding of approximately $1.7 million to the College. During the year ended June 30, 2020, $860,913 was disbursed to qualifying students and recorded as revenue and expense within "Government, grants, contracts, and appropriations"Student services" of the accompanying statement of activities, respectively. Furthermore, during the year ended June 30, 2020, $860,912 was used to reimburse the College for refunds made to students for a portion of room, board, and fees as a result of the change to a virtual learning environment during the spring 2020 semester and was recorded as revenue within "government, grants, contracts, and appropriations" of the accompanying statement of activities.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS SHOWN FOR SCHEDULE I PART III IS BASED ON THE NUMBER OF GRANTS AWARDED. THIS AMOUNT IS USED AS A REASONABLE ESTIMATE OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS AWARDED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: TEXAS WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS MULTIPLE FEDERAL, STATE, PRIVATE, AND UNIVERSITY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOAN AND WORK STUDY AWARDS. FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE U.S. LAW AND REGULATIONS PROMULGATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE U.S. DEPARTMENT HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AS WELL AS THE REGULATIONS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS. UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES OF THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IN SUPPORT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S STRATEGIC PLAN. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND A NUMBER OF SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS OF VERIFICATION TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL NEED BASED PROGRAMS. ADDITIONALLY, STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BASED UPON ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS, SPECIAL TALENTS, AND DONOR STIPULATED REQUIREMENTS. POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ENSURE THAT THE DETERMINATION OF AID ELIGIBILITY AND THE SUBSEQUENT DELIVERY OF AID IS DELIVERED IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.

GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE ARE PREDOMINANTLY AVAILABLE AS MERIT OR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO PAY FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. THEY ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE, BOTH OF WHOM ARE NOTIFIED IF THE STUDENT'S NORMAL ENROLLMENT STATUS CHANGES DURING THE SEMESTER. THESE OFFICES MONITOR WHETHER THE GRANTEE IS TAKING THE NECESSARY CLASSES AND IS THEREFORE UTILIZING THE GRANT AS IT WAS INTENDED. IF A STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT CHANGES, AWARD ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE. OTHER GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE THROUGH ACCOUNTS PAYABLE. QUALIFICATION AND USE OF THESE PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPECTIVE DEPARTMENTS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISBURSEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

POCCS gives need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based scholarships are monitored through the Department of Education FAFSA form. Students with $0 estimated family contribution (EFC), based on the Department of Education guidelines, will be automatically awarded a scholarship. Merit-based scholarships are granted to students who submit all required documentation by certain deadlines and apply with good academic standing.

PRE-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITOR: Federal awards are identified by informing each subrecipient of CFDA title and number, award name and number, award year, and name of Federal agency. If any of this information is not available, the pass-through entity shall provide the best information available to describe the Federal award. The subrecipient is advised of requirements imposed by governing laws, regulations, and provisions of contracts or grant agreements and supplemental requirements imposed by the pass-through entity. The subrecipient's activities are monitored to ensure awards are used for authorized purposes in compliance with laws, regulations, and the provisions of contracts or grant agreements and performance goals are achieved. Assurance is ascertained that any subrecipient expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards during the subrecipient's fiscal year must meet the audit requirements of Uniform Grant Guidance (formerly OMB A-133). A management decision on audit findings must be issued within six months after receipt of the subrecipient's audit report and ensure that the subrecipient takes appropriate and timely corrective action. A determination is made as to whether subrecipient audits necessitate adjustment of the pass-through entity's own records. Each subrecipient is required to permit the pass-through entity and auditors to have access to the records and financial statements as necessary for the pass-through entity to comply with this part. POST-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING: The Principal Investigator (PI) or Program Director (PD) is responsible for monitoring the activities. The subrecipient should submit progress reports, technical reports and other deliverables to the PI/PD by specified due dates. The PI/PD is responsible for forwarding copies of the subrecipient's report(s) to the Office of Sponsored Programs and Research (OSPR). Subrecipient invoices submitted to the university must contain the following information: invoice on subcontractor's letterhead, date of invoice, invoice number, period of performance covered by the invoice, itemized description of services and backup documentation, current period costs including cost sharing, cumulative project costs and subrecipient contact person with respect to invoice. Invoice must be signed by an authorized official of the subcontractor and must contain a certification that all payments requested are for appropriate purposes and in accordance with the agreements set forth in the application and award documents. The PI/PD is responsible for reviewing and approving invoices from subrecipient(s) for adherence to the budget and submitting invoices for payment in Smart Buy Plus. Grant Accounting will review the subrecipient's invoice(s) for the following: period of performance is within the contract period, appropriate invoice format and level of detail, signature by authorized subrecipient representatives, evidence of cost sharing, if applicable, and availability of funding. Grant Accounting is responsible for ensuring that subrecipients that expend $750,000 or more of Federal funds each fiscal year submit an Audit Certification Letter along with a copy of subrecipient's audited financial statements. The following is required to close out a subrecipient award: receipt of final invoice, receipt of cost share documentation, if applicable, time and effort certifications, final progress and technical reports, annual audit certification letter. Grant Accounting is responsible for tracking payments made to individuals or organizations and where payments are sent when outside of the US as required by the Schedules F and I - Form 990. EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE: Educational assistance is awarded based on financial need and merit. Need based assistance is awarded after review of the student's FAFSA, tax return information, W-2 statements, and other relevant financial documents. Students are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in order to continue to be eligible for need based assistance. Students' Grade Point Averages and earned units are reviewed each academic year to ensure satisfactory academic progress is achieved. Merit based educational assistance is awarded to students via Committee. Students who are awarded merit based assistance are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in accordance with the terms of the assistance received. Need and merit based educational assistance are funded directly to the student's accounts receivable balance to offset tuition, fees, and room and board. Any resulting refunds are issued to the student. Students are granted research awards by their academic departments and work with faculty advisors who monitor the research performed by the student.

SCHOLARSHIPS - SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON SPECIFIC CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY, STUDENT SELECTION AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP. EACH SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT WILL BE MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO CONFIRM THAT THEY HAVE SATISFIED ALL SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT. CARES HEERF EMERGENCY STUDENT AID - THE UNIVERSITY WORKED TO DETERME THE MOST EQUITABLE MANNER TO DISTRIBUTE THIS FUNDING. THE UNVERSITY CREATED A TIERED FORMULA BASED ON SOCIOECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION ON THE FASFA. ADDITIONALLY, STUDENTS ENROLLED LESS THAN FULL-TIME IN THE SPRING SEMESTER RECEIVED A PRORATED AWARD. BASED ON THE TIERED AND PRORATED SCHEDULE OF AWARDS, THE UNIVERSITY WAS ABLE TO SET ASIDE APPROXIMATELY 20% OF THE TOTAL FUNDS TO BE AWARDED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS. THE UNIVERSITY MADE AVAILABLE A SURVEY TO STUDENTS INQUIRING ABOUT THEIR ADDITIONAL EXPENSES INCURRED AND THE EFFECTS ON THEIR FAMILIES DUE TO THE DISRUPTIONS CAUSED BY THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THIS SURVEY, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WAS ABLE TO USE PROFESSIONAL JUDGMENT TO DETERMINE WHETHER ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDING COULD BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE STUDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: AS GIFTS AND GRANTS ARE RECEIVED INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ARE ESTABLISHED IN OUR GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM TO PROCESS THE GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENSE. A FINANCIAL MANAGER IS ASSIGNED TO REVIEW AND OVERSEE THE ACTIVITY OF THE FUND. IN ADDITION, OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE DEPARTMENTS ALSO PROVIDE SERVICES TO PROCESS, REPORT AND REVIEW THE GRANT INFORMATION. IN THE CASE OF PRIVATE GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS A FORMALIZED GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS TO VERIFY THAT THE UNIVERSITY UNDERSTANDS THE GRANT OBLIGATION AND PURPOSE BEFORE THE APPLICATION IS SENT TO THE GRANTOR ORGANIZATION. MANY PRIVATE AND GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE RECEIVED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. OUR ENROLLMENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS A DETAILED POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL THAT DESCRIBES HOW EACH SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED, INCLUDING SELECTION CRITERIA. THESE PROCEDURES FOLLOW GUIDELINES SET BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SENIOR LEADERSHIP. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS PROCESSED UNDER INDIVIDUAL GRANT FUNDS WITHIN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM (AS DESCRIBED ABOVE), AND THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO PROCESSED UNDER EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THIS APPROACH TO RECORD FINANCIAL AID BY FUND AND BY STUDENT ACCOUNT, PROVIDES A DETAILED RECORD OF HOW THE FUNDS ARE SPENT ACCORDING TO DONOR AND GOVERNMENTAL REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENT ACCOUNT ACTIVITY TO VERIFY THE STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT AND USE OF THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO ESTABLISHED ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE EDUCATIONAL AND/OR CHARITABLE AND THE UNIVERSITY IS IN CONTACT WITH THOSE ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE GRANTS FUNDS ARE EXPENDED APPROPRIATELY.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS IN THE U.S. IN RECOGNITION OF THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE COLLEGE AND THE CITY OF BEVERLY, AN ANNUAL GIFT IS PRESENTED TO THE MAYOR OF THE CITY TO ASSIST IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE CITY OF BEVERLY'S INITIATIVES. ENDICOTT COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH ITS OWN RESOURCES, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS. TO QUALIFY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANT AID, A STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN AN APPROVED PROGRAM AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. MOST OF THE AID PROGRAMS REQUIRE THAT STUDENTS DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. ENDICOTT AWARDS ARE MADE ON A FUNDS-AVAILABLE BASIS TO DESERVING STUDENTS. THE COLLEGE MAKES EVERY EFFORT TO ENSURE THAT A QUALITY EDUCATION IS AVAILABLE TO ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF INCOME LEVEL, RACE, RELIGION, DISABILITY, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, AGE OR GENDER.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US: EVERY STUDENT APPLYING FOR SCHOLARSHIP AID MUST FILE THE FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID) DOCUMENTING FINANCIAL NEED AND MUST SUBMIT AN APPLICATION FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP IN QUESTION. A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION PACKAGE IS SENT TO ALL NEW AND RETURNING STUDENTS EACH FALL THAT DETAILS THE CRITERIA. SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND/ OR OTHER SPECIFIC DONOR-DIRECTED CRITERIA. THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE MEETS (AT A MINIMUM) AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SEMESTER TO SELECT SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS AND TO REVIEW STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED AN AWARD TO ENSURE THAT THEY CONTINUE TO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS OF ALL FINANCIAL AID RECEIVED BY STUDENTS (INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS) FOR AT LEAST 3 YEARS AFTER THE STUDENT CEASES ENROLLMENT IN THE PROGRAM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT AT THE PROPOSAL STAGE BEFORE FUNDING IS APPROVED. UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR WILL REVIEW INVOICES AND CERTIFY AS TO ALLOWABILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF CHARGES. CENTRAL SPONSORED AWARD ACCOUNTING WILL ALSO PERFORM A REVIEW THAT THE EXPENDITURES FALL WITHIN THE CONTRACT AMOUNT AND PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.

All grant funds received by the university are overseen by our Financial Aid Department. The Director of Financial Aid works closely with the Dept of Education and our Student Accounts Department to ensure proper management of the students' funds. As funds are approved and released, disbursement reports are given to our Student Accounts Department and funds are electronically uploaded to the individual student tuition accounts and verified for accuracy. All funds are uploaded within the prescribed window of three business days and all funds are available to the student with 14 days of disbursement to their account.

THE COLLEGE ONLY GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING ITS CLASSES. SCHEDULE I, PART III, (B) - THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED. SOME STUDENTS MAY HAVE RECEIVED MULTIPLE SCHOLARSHIPS.

The Student Financial Services Department maintains records to substantiate eligibility and election criteria for students receiving awards and scholarships. Departments maintain records of selection criteria and eligibility for recipients of stipends and other awards. All payments are uploaded to their respective categories. The business office reconciles accounts and prepares departmental and grantor reports. Awards are applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING MANAGER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER. THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE INSTITUTE ENSURES THAT ITS GRANTS OF FINANCIAL AID ARE USED BY STUDENTS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY CREDITING THE AID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS OR THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE PROCESS. THE INSTITUTE ALSO PROVIDES FUNDING FOR TRAVEL EXPENSES, WHICH HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE TOTAL ABOVE, FOR A SMALL NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHOSE PROJECT PROPOSALS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT.

FOR GRANTS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE, GRANTS ARE CONTROLLED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONSIBLE PERSON ON CAMPUS, WHO IS TYPICALLY THE PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR THE GRANT. ALL PROPOSED EXPENDITURES FROM THE GRANT MUST BE APPROVED BY THAT PERSON. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE INVOICE FOR APPROPRIATENESS WITH THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, REVIEWS THE ACTUAL TRANSACTION TO MAKE SURE THAT IT IS ADEQUATELY SUPPORTED, AND REVIEWS THE TRANSACTION TO BE SURE THAT IT IS AN ALLOWABLE EXPENSE UNDER FEDERAL LAW. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED ITS OWN SET OF GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS TO SEGREGATE THE EXPENSES AND GRANT INCOME FROM OTHER EXPENDITURES AND REVENUES OF THE COLLEGE. IF THE GRANT IS A REIMBURSEMENT GRANT, THE COLLEGE PERIODICALLY DRAWS FUNDS DOWN FROM THE GRANTOR BASED ON THE ACTUAL EXPENSES INCURRED. WHEN REPORTS ARE DUE TO THE GOVERNMENT OR OTHER GRANTOR, THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON PREPARES THE REPORT WITH ASSISTANCE OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT. TYPICALLY, THESE REPORTS ARE SIGNED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON AND THE CFO OR PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE CERTIFYING THE ACCURACY OF THE REPORT. GRANTS SHOWN ON PART III ARE SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED IN TWO FORMS. FIRST, SOME SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY DONOR GIFTS OR INVESTMENT INCOME FROM DONOR GIFTS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE GRANTED AS THE DONOR HAS SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT. THE STUDENT MUST MEET THE DESIGNATED REQUIREMENTS OF THE DONOR. SECOND, THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS FROM GENERAL COLLEGE REVENUES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEEDS WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH INDUSTRY STANDARDS.
GRANT FUNDS ARE RECORDED IN A PROJECT ACCOUNT SO THAT ALL ASSOCIATED REVENUES AND EXPENSES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR RELATED TO A SPECIFIC GRANT.

GANNON AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER STUDENTS WHO MEET ELIGIBILITY STANDARDS FOR MERIT BASED AID SUCH AS ACADEMIC AND LEADERSHIP AWARDS. IN ADDITION, NEED-BASED AID IS CONSIDERED FOR STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED BY FILING THE REQUIRED APPLICATIONS AND ADHERING TO DEADLINES. AWARD PACKAGES ARE RENEWED EACH YEAR TO STUDENTS WHO REMAIN IN ACADEMICALLY GOOD STANDING AND CONTINUE TO MEET THE REQUIRED ELIGIBILITY STANDARDS FOR BOTH TYPES OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED AID. STUDENTS NEED NOT APPLY FOR SPECIFIC SCHOLARSHIPS SINCE THEY WILL AUTOMATICALLY RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR ALL FUNDS FOR WHICH THEY MAY BE ELIGIBLE WHEN THEY SUBMIT THE FAFSA.

OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS. ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SERVICE TO COMMUNITY, LEADERSHIP AND INVOLVEMENT IN SCHOOL ACTIVITIES. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE OFFERED FOR FOUR YEARS OF STUDY FOR FRESHMEN AND UNTIL THE COMPLETION OF DEGREE REQUIREMENTS FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. ALL STUDENTS MUST MEET THE STATED CRITERIA TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS EARNED BY THE STUDENT FROM EXTERNAL FUNDING SOURCES ARE FULLY CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITHOUT REDUCING ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS OFFERED BY OTTAWA UNIVERSITY. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES BASED ON A COMPETITIVE REVIEW BY THE GRANTING DEPARTMENT. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE AVAILABLE IN MUSIC, ART, THEATRE, FORENSICS, AND DEBATE. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE OFFERED ON THE BASIS OF AN EVALUATION BY THE COACH OF EACH SPORT. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS NEED BASED GRANTS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE AN EXCEPTIONAL LEVEL OF NEED AND THE POTENTIAL TO SUCCEED. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO BEING A RESIDENTIAL CAMPUS. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO LIVE ON-CAMPUS. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO HELP STUDENTS MEET A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE DIRECT COST OF EDUCATION THROUGH A COMBINATION OF RESOURCES. STUDENTS ARE HIGHLY ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR ADDITIONAL GRANTS, WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND LOW-INTEREST LOANS. THE ADMINISTRATIVE SOFTWARE MONITORS FINANCIAL AID ON AN ONGOING BASIS FOR GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER AID THAT MAY BE PENDING, AWARDED, ETC. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN POSTED TO THE GENERAL LEDGER AS WELL FOR BALANCING/REPORTING PURPOSES.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

BELMONT ABBEY COLLEGE UTILIZES VARIOUS DATABASES TO STORE AND MONITOR DATA PERTAINING TO THE AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT OF GRANTS RECEIVED IN THE UNITED STATES. ALL GRANTS RECEIVED ARE PROPERLY APPLIED AS PAYMENTS TOWARD STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS APPROPRIATELY. ALL PARTICIPATING GRANTING ORGANIZATIONS HAVE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE ADHERED TO AND AUDITED ANNUALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OFFICE OF BUDGET AND MANAGEMENT (OMB) UNIFORM GUIDANCE. AS SUCH, THE COLLEGE PRESENTS SCHEDULES OF EXPENDITURES OF FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDS SUMMARIZING ALL EXPENDITURES USING THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.

For all scholarship funds, student financial services has established specific criteria in regards to eligibility and selection. The eligibility requirements of the students are documented and monitored for compliance. The actual scholarships are credited to the student's tuition bills. No cash changes hands.
PRIOR TO AWARDING ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS, AN ASSESSMENT IS MADE ON THE USE OF THE FUNDS. FINAL DETERMINATION IS BASED ON WHETHER FUNDS WILL BE USED TO FURTHER OUR MISSION.
Scholarships are determined by FAFSA requirements, and need base

ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVE GRANTS ARE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENTS GAIN PRACTICAL EXPERIENCE WHILE ASSISTING AT THESE ORGANIZATIONS. BECAUSE OF THIS CLOSE RELATIONSHIP, THE UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. THE UNIVERSITY APPLIES SCHOLARSHIPS DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNTS.

THE UNIVERSITY DISTRIBUTES SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID). MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE STUDENT'S OFFICIAL HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND THE RESULTS OF THE STANDARDIZED TEST (ACT, SAT, ETC.). FOR STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WITH RENEWAL CONDITIONS, FULFILLMENT OF THOSE CONDITIONS ARE VERIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATOR PRIOR TO THE AWARD BEING RENEWED (GPA, YEAR OF ATTENDANCE, ETC.)
SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE IS APPROVED AND MONITORED FOR INDIVIDUALS THROUGH CAMPUS SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEES WITH CONSULTING FROM INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID STAFF.

THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS PACKAGING GUIDELINES IN AWARDING FUNDS. AID IS PAID ACCORDING TO THE STUDENT ACADEMIC LOAD (100% FOR FULL-TIME, 75% FOR 3/4 TIME). AID IS ADJUSTED ACCORDING TO POLICY. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS, STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS ALSO MONITORED TO DETERMINE IF AID SHOULD BE ADJUSTED.
THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA USED TO AWARD THE GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN THE US: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BOSTON PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY, AS PART OF THE CITY OF BOSTON, WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP DOWNTOWN BOSTON AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS PURSUANT TO COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO CAMBRIDGE STREET DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP THE CAMBRIDGE STREET AREA OF THE CITY OF BOSTON. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO EAST BOSTON HIGH SCHOOL FOR ITS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE FUND FOR PARKS AND RECREATION IN BOSTON FOR UPKEEP OF ATHLETIC FIELDS USED BY THE UNIVERSITY AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS. ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND/OR MERIT AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE, AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE FUND EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S. BALDWIN WALLACE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND MAKES NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ONLY TO ITS OWN ENROLLED STUDENTS. THE AWARDS CONSTITUTE PART OF THE COST OF ATTENDING. ADDITIONAL NEED-BASED AID USUALLY CONSISTS OF FEDERAL DIRECT STUDENT LOANS AND COLLEGE WORK STUDY FOR JOBS ON CAMPUS. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAKES NEED-BASED GRANTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED USING NATIONALLY ACCEPTED FORMS AND METHODS. THE SAME OFFICE AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS USING BALDWIN WALLACE CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY DISBURSES THE GRANTS AS CREDITS TO STUDENT RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS, OFFSETTING AMOUNTS BILLED FOR TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: IONA COLLEGE GIVES AID TO STUDENTS IN TWO BASIC FORMS: MERIT AID AND NEED BASED AID. THE AMOUNT OF MERIT AID A STUDENT RECEIVES IS BASED ON CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) AND A RANGE OF MERIT AWARD LEVELS. NEED BASED AID IS DETERMINED BY UNMET NEED AS CCULATED BY THE COST OF ATTENDANCE LESS THE FEDERAL EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC.) STUDENTS ARE GIVEN THESE AWARDS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE COLLEGE AND THE AWARDS ARE RENEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ASSUMING THE STUDENT MEETS THE REQUIRED CUMULATIVE GPA AND THE NEED LEVEL AS DETERMINED BY FAFSA HAS NOT CHANGED. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE ARE INTENDED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY TUITION COSTS AND ENABLE STUDENTS TO MATRICULATE AT IONA COLLEGE, THE STUDENT HAS NO DISCRETION ON HOW TO EXPEND THOSE FUNDS. ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FORMALLY MONITOR THE USE OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SINCE IT IS REQUIRED THAT SUCH FUNDS BE USED TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER EDUCATIONALLY-RELATED COSTS. AS A NATIONAL COLLEGIATE ATHLETIC ASSOCIATION (NCAA) DIVISION I INSTITUTION, IONA COLLEGE AWARDS RECRUITED (AND RETURNING) ATHLETES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH NCAA GUIDELINES FOR FULL-RIDE OR EQUIVALENCY SPORT ALLOCATIONS. THESE AWARDS MAY COVER TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD, BOOKS AND LIVING EXPENSES PER NCAA RULES AND COLLEGE BUDGET ALLOCATIONS. AWARDS ARE RENEWED BASED ON ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, ATHLETIC PARTICPATION, TEAM ROSTER NEEDS AND AVAILABLE FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS TO BE AWARDED BY GRANTS ARE SCREENED BY THE SCHOOL. GRANTS ARE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS WHICH ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED BY PROCEDURES THAT INSURE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS ARE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND OTHER SIMILAR NEEDS.

The financial aid planning office requires students to complete the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based on certain academic credentials or performance in a university sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the university catalog and the university website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the university. Scholarships are applied directly to each student's account.

THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (GRANTS) ARE NON-CASH TUITION DISCOUNTS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM INTENDED USES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED ABOVE WAS COMPILED FROM SCHOLARSHIP DISBURSEMENT RECORDS FOR THE REPORTED FISCAL YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC STANDING AND FINANCIAL NEED.

The College uses a validation process to review eligibility to receive awards and to ensure compliance with grant requirements. Major grant programs are audited annually to ensure compliance with grant requirements and financial reporting.
THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD.

STUDENTS RECEIVE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SIX WEEKS AFTER THE BEGINNING OF THE SEMESTER TO ENSURE THAT THEY HAVE EARNED THE AWARD. TUITION AND FEES ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE COLLEGE, THE REMAINDER IS GIVEN TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES.

FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES. FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS RESEARCH GRANTS TO FACULTY MEMBERS AND STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND REQUIRES WRITTEN REPORTS FROM GRANT RECIPIENTS.
CARES ACT HREEF: $200 GRANTS WERE MADE TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AS PART OF THE RELIEF FUNDS RECEIVED BY FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

A REPORT IS RUN AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER TO REVIEW EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AND PROGRESS TOWARD THEIR DEGREE. STUDENTS RECEIVING MERIT AWARDS WHO FAIL TO ACHIEVE GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING ARE REVIEWED FOR ALTERNATIVE INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. EVERY EFFORT IS MADE TO FIND ALTERNATIVE FUNDING FOR STUDENTS NOT MEETING GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.
THE VP OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION STAFF OVERSEE THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THE GRANT ARE MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDELINES OR AGREEMENTS SET FORTH.

MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MODEST AND ARE APPROVED BY OUR OFFICE OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND MONITORED BY THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS TAKE THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO OUR STUDENTS. THE SOURCE OF FUNDING OF THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE UNIVERSITY INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, GOVERNMENT FUNDS OR DONOR FUNDS. UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ADMISSIONS OFFICE, BOTH GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE, AND AWARDED USING A CALCULATION DRIVEN BY PRIOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE STATISTICS. GOVERNMENT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS AND AWARD CRITERIA. DONOR FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS, WHETHER SPONSORED OR ENDOWED, ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO THE DONOR'S WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY'S DEVELOPMENT OFFICE WORKS WITH THE DONOR AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT TO ESTABLISH THE WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA AND THESE CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED FOR REFERENCE IN BOTH THE UNIVERSITY'S DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICES.

THE COLLEGE HAS A NUMBER OF FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS. WITH THE ISSUANCE OF EACH AWARD A TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED ACCOUNT IS CREATED IN THE DATABASE. AWARD LETTERS ARE KEPT IN A SEPARATE FILE WITH THE PRIMARY CONTACT INFORMATION. IF THE GRANTEE DOES NOT HAVE ELIGIBILITY THE GRANT IS NOT AWARDED. IF THE ELIGIBILITY OF THE GRANTEE HAS CHANGED THE INSTITUTION RETURNS THE AWARDED FUNDS. THE GRANTS ARE BASED ON FAMILY INCOME CONTRIBUTIONS, AND/OR ACADEMIC STANDING, AND/OR ATHLETIC ABILITY, AND/OR INDIVIDUAL TALENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University provides grants in the form of University scholarship for certain individuals attending the University. These scholarships are posted directly to the recipient's University billing account and, thus, reduces tuition, room and/or board fees billed to the to the recipient. The majority of these scholarships are need-based financial aid.

The Student Financial Services office of the University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State, and Institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the Institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Scholarships and tuition discounts are applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands.

LAFAYETTE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A POLICY DEFINING ITS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SPONSORED FUNDS BY SUB-RECIPIENTS WHO ARE PERFORMING A PORTION OF A SPONSORED PROJECT EXTERNALLY AWARDED TO LAFAYETTE. THIS POLICY PROVIDES GUIDANCE TO ENSURE THAT SUB-RECIPIENTS CONDUCT THEIR PORTION OF SPONSORED PROJECTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF AWARDS AND SUB AWARDS, AND THAT REIMBURSEMENT COSTS INCURRED BY SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE ALLOWED.

THE COLLEGE CONSIDERS THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID (PRIMARILY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY) TO ITS STUDENTS, INCLUDING NON-RESIDENT ALIEN STUDENTS, TO BE A U.S. BASED ACTIVITY AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE ARE DEEMED TO BE LIVING IN THE UNITED STATES THROUGHOUT THEIR COMPLETION OF THE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CURRICULUM AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE SELECTION CRITERIA ARE BASED ON THE CALCULATED EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION, WHICH IS DERIVED BY USING COMPLEX FORMULAS INVOLVING FAMILIES' INCOME, ASSETS, AND HOUSEHOLD SIZES INCLUDING, AMONG OTHER FACTORS, DEPENDENTS IN COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS AND MONITORS THESE AWARDS TO HELP ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS RELEVANT INTERNAL COLLEGE POLICIES AND OPERATIONAL GUIDELINES. ACADEMIC PRIZES, AWARDS, FELLOWSHIP, AND INTERNSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A REVIEW BY THE APPLICABLE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT. ALL AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AND ARE APPLIED TO BILLED CHARGES.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS & FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND/OR ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES IS DISTRIBUTED & MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERALLY APPROVED NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA OR OTHER AGENCY PROVIDED CRITERIA. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADJUDICATED BY A PANEL OF NATIONAL EXPERTS USING THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA TO EVALUATE GRANT APPLICATIONS: EXCELLENCE, ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT PROJECT, AND PROJECT IMPACT. THESE CRITERIA INSURE THAT THE FUNDING ALIGNS WITH THE GRANT-MAKING GOAL OF SUPPORTING THE PHILADELPHIA REGION'S MOST TALENTED ARTISTS AND HIGH-PERFORMING CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ACCOUNT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.

FOR ADMINISTERING GOVERNMENT GRANT FUNDS, DEAN OF STUDENT AFFAIRS REVIEWS THE DO-NOTUSE VENDOR LIST PUBLISHED BY THE GOVERNMENT TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH G5 (SAM) REQUIREMENTS. FINANCIAL AIDS DISBURSEMENTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BASED ON THE APPROVED COST OF ATTENDANCE FOR EACH STUDENT. THE POSTED FINANCIAL AID IS THEN USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND OTHER EDUCATION RELATED EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. ALL FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BASED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

The University consistently strives to place an outstanding higher education within the financial reach of all qualified applicants. The University awards millions of dollars in federal and state financial aid funds each year based upon a student's financial need. Additionally, the University provides financial aid via University grants-in-aid and scholarships. Grants-in-Aid are awarded on the basis of demonstrated financial need assessed by the use of a standard financial aid application, currently the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), which analyzes the family income data provided on the FAFSA through the mandated Federal Methodology. All need-based financial aid must be awarded according to a student's calculated financial need. Scholarship awards are primarily provided on scholastic achievement. University scholarships are highly competitive and available to students through a combination of academic achievement and personal commitment, display of values, compassion, and pursuit of excellence which embody the spirit and mission of the University. The University has many scholarships funded through special endowments and donations. In most instances, academic merit and financial need are considered along with the particular requirements of the scholarship selection process. Also, various associations, corporations, foundations and unions provide scholarships for recipients whom they select.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED DIRECT EMERGENCY AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS FOR THEIR EXPENSES RELATED TO THE DISRUPTION OF CAMPUS OPERATIONS DUE TO CORONAVIRUS, SUCH AS FOOD, HOUSING, COURSE MATERIALS, TECHNOLOGY, HEALTHCARE, AND CHILDCARE EXPENSES. $5,396,663 WAS FUNDED BY THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF) ESTABLISHED UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT).

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. WE ALSO PERFORM SPOT CHECKS THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER TO DOUBLE CHECK THAT AID ELIGIBILITY CALCULATIONS ARE MET.

The employee disaster Fund (EDF) is to provide temporary aid to employees with a disaster or other emergency hardship situation. The EDF Committee is comprised of hospital employees, with a majority of the members being in a non-management position. To be eligible for assistance, applicants must meet certain criteria as specified in the EDF policy. The EDF Committee makes awards based on the merits of each case in accordance with the policy. The EDF committee maintains complete and accurate minutes of its proceedings. The Komarmi scholarship is a health career scholarship that is administered by a committee made up of two volunteer community members, a representative from the Board of Directors, and a member of the administrative team. The committee identifies specific areas each year in the hospital which are experiencing or anticipating recruitment difficulties related to the shortage of qualified candidates. The committee works with the Ithaca High School Administration to identify a graduating senior who is planning on pursing a career in the selected health profession. The amount of the scholarship can be up to $1,000, to be awarded at graduation.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and tuition assistance are applied directly to students' tuition accounts. No cash is given to students.

THE UNIVERSITY ISSUES GRANTS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS, WHICH ALLOWS STUDENTS TO FURTHER THEIR EDUCATION. GRANTED FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY BILLING ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, AND OTHER COSTS OF EDUCATION. IN FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED DOMESTIC FINANCIAL AID TO SUPPORT 1,332 STUDENTS.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR MERIT AS DETERMINED BY SEMINARY ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL
The organization reviews that grant funds are used for their intended purposes regularly.

STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID THROUGH CAREFUL STUDY OF THE INFORMATION ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD, TEST SCORES, AND RECOMMENDATIONS. DETAILED RECORDS AND STATISTICS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE OFFICE OF ASSESSMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH IN REGARDS TO ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE, INCLUDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

WE MAINTAIN RECORDS OF GRANTS IN OUR FUNDRAISING DATABASE, TESSITURA. WE HAVE A SELECT NUMBER OF AWARDS WE GIVE TO FELLOWS AND THEIR THESIS PROJECTS. EACH AWARD HAS ITS OWN APPLICATION PROCESS, USUALLY REQUIRING A LETTER AND SCRIPT SAMPLE.

EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY AWARDS TUITION GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE GRANTS REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF TUITION AND FEES THAT THAT STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PAY TO THE SEMINARY. THE SEMINARY MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE GRANTS AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FAFSA FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE REGULATIONS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM AID MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL GRANT FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AUTHORIZED AMOUNTS FROM THE FUNDING AGENCY. THE COLLEGE ALSO IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT A-133 AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. CONTINUING STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP AID BY COMPLETING A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. ENTERING STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE COLLEGE'S AUDITION AND INTERVIEW PROCESS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM SCHOLARSHIP MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH BUDGETED AMOUNTS. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE REVIEWS ALL AWARDS EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ELIGIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP.

PART III, LINE 6 IN FISCAL YEAR 2020 THE COLLEGE WAS AWARDED $1,786,574 FROM THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF). THE FUNDS WERE USED FOR EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS UNDER THE 18004(A)(1) CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACTS (CARES ACT). THE COLLEGE DISBURSED $1,698,920 OF THE TOTAL RECEIVED TO THE STUDENTS TO ASSIST THE STUDENTS IN THEIR TRANSITION TO REMOTE LEARNING WITH THE REMAINING $87,654 TO BE UTILIZED IN FISCAL YEAR 2021 FOR APPEALS AND LATE FILERS.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - GORDON COLLEGE AWARDS THREE TYPES OF GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED GRANTS AND ENDOWMENT FUNDED RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE INCOMING STUDENT'S ACADEMIC CRITERIA DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWED ANNUALLY BY VERIFICATION OF THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE THAT CUMULATIVE GPA REQUIREMENTS ARE MET. NEED-BASED GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE STUDENT'S DETERMINED FINANCIAL NEED. WE DETERMINE FINANCIAL NEED USING INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FAFSA. WE PRACTICE LEVEL-FUNDING OF THE NEED-BASED GRANTS TO FUTURE YEARS UNLESS THERE IS A SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN DETERMINED FINANCIAL NEED. ENDOWMENT FUNDED RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. THE CRITERIA INFORMATION ON SPECIFIC ELIGIBLE STUDENTS IS PROVIDED BY THE REGISTRAR, ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICES. STUDENTS ARE EVALUATED ANNUALLY TO VERIFY THEY CONTINUE TO MEET THE DONOR CRITERIA FOR AN ENDOWMENT AWARD.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS The College has a fair, equitable and consistent awarding policy that meets federal, state and institutional requirements. Students are offered a combination of federal, state and institutional aid. Packaging parameters are periodically reviewed with the help of an outside consultant to evaluate the MMC grants and scholarship programs offered to all student populations at MMC. Students are monitored each semester to ensure they meet the requirements attached to the aid they are receiving. The review includes both enrollment and academic progress components. MMC students must maintain their gpa and complete their credits as described in the College Catalogue under academic satisfactory academic progress standards. Additionally each grant received has unique standards (see college catalogue) which must be maintained for continued awarding. A review is conducted each semester by the financial aid staff under the direct supervision of the Director of Financial Aid.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES.

THE INSTITUTION AWARDS GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH IN THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. THIS CRITERIA IS EXPLAINED IN THE COLLEGE CATALOG. ANY "NEED BASED" GRANT IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA).

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR DETERMINING ELIGBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, PRIZES AND OTHER GRANTS AND AWARDS. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS SHOWING RECIPIENT ELIGIBILITY, HOW FUNDS MAY BE USED, AND ANY RELATED PARTY DISCLOSURES. GRANTS AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS. OTHER GRANTS ARE MONITORED IN VARIOUS WAYS, INCLUDING REIMBURSING ACTUAL SUBSTANTIATED EXPENSES, REQUIRING WRITTEN REPORTS AND /OR VISITING SITES OF ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY COLLEGE GRANTS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND MONITORS GRANTING OF AWARDS TO STUDENTS AND FOLLOWS U.S. FEDERAL AID REGULATIONS AND ALL STATES' REGULATIONS FOR GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS.

The University is contributing funds to charitable oganizations in accordance with endowment agreements that govern the distribution of the underlying funds. The University also verifies that the grants given to the charitable organization are for the benefit of individual students for scholarships.
Student awards, grants and loans are awarded on basis of need. Scholarships are awarded based upon need and academic or special achievements.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: JEFFERSON HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, INC. MAINTAINED RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE, THE GRANTEES' ELIGIBILITY FOR THE GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA USED TO AWARD GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART IX, LINES 1 & 2 & SCHEDULE I, PARTS II & III
ExplntnTxt: DIFFERENCE BETWEEN SCHEDULE I & STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES: THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE CONTRIBUTIONS PAID ON SCHEDULE I, WHICH IS NOT NECESSARILY ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS BECAUSE THE ORGANIZATION RECORDS LONG-TERM PLEDGES AT THEIR NPV AND RECORDS ACCRETION OF INTEREST OVER TIME. THE PLEDGES, WHEN PAID, ARE A REDUCTION OF THIS LIABILITY AND NOT CURRENT YEAR EXPENSE WHICH MAY CAUSE A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN AMOUNT REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART IX AND SCHEDULE I, PARTS II & III.

FURMAN PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AID FOR SUCH STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT AND COVER THE COSTS OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL POLICY AND STANDARDS SET FORTH BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE COMPLIANCE WITH SUCH REGULATIONS. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY AS A REDUCTION IN FEES. AS A RESULT, THE GRANT CAN ONLY BE USED FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSE (I.E. COST OF ATTENDANCE) AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM THIS USE. OTHER TYPES OF GRANTS PROVIDED CONSIST OF RESEARCH, INTERNSHIP OR FELLOWSHIP GRANTS TO STUDENTS. SUCH GRANTS ARE GIVEN AND MONITORED BY THE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT GIVING THE GRANT OR THE UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH AND INTERNSHIP DEPARTMENT. SPONSORSHIPS PAID TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE UNDER WRITTEN AGREEMENTS BETWEEN THE PARTIES AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY EVENTS AND PROVIDE A PRESENCE FOR FURMAN IN THE AREA. COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IS A SIGNIFICANT ASPECT OF THE FURMAN ADVANTAGE. THESE SPONSORSHIPS WITH GREENVILLE BUSINESSES THEREFORE SERVE TO ADVANCE THE FURMAN ADVANTAGE FOR OUR STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.

Grant funds are managed in accordance with both the sponsor and University rules and regulations. Expenditures are reviewed on a pre and post audit basis to ensure that the costs incurred and charged to a articular grant is in compliance with both the sponsor and University policies. Schedule I, Part III The cash grants are reflected on students' accounts.

YESHIVA UNIVERSITY CONDUCTS SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE ACTIVITIES OF FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTENTIONS AND GUIDELINES OF THE FELLOWSHIP GRANT.

THE $98,651,795 IN GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, INCLUDING EMERGENCY STUDENT ASSISTANCE GRANTS. FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON ELIGIBILITY DETERMINED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC BASED AID IS AWARDED BY THE DISTINGUISHED SCHOLARS COMMITTEE. BOTH FACULTY AND ENROLLMENT SERVICES ADMINISTRATORS COMPRISE THE COMMITTEE.

LAGRANGE COLLEGE AWARDS BOTH MERIT-BASE AND NEED-BASE AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS. MERIT-BASE AID IS AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, LEADERSHIP, AND TALENT. NEED-BASE AID IS AWARDED BASED ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY FAMILY INCOME AND ASSET INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BY A REVIEW OF A STUDENT'S COMPLIANCE WITH SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS, GRADE POINT AVERAGE FOR THE CONTINUATION OF MERIT-BASED AID AND SUBMISSION OF A RENEWAL FAFSA IN AWARDING OF NEED-BASE AID. THERE WERE 855 STUDENTS AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN 2019-2020.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges finanical aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION IS A LONGSTANDING SECTION 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION CLASSIFIED AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE GRANT TO THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION IS BEING MADE IN CONNECTION WITH THE DISSOLUTION OF THE TAXPAYER. THE TAXPAYER HAS CONDUCTED EXTENSIVE DUE DILIGENCE ON THE RECIPIENT'S PLANNED USE OF FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES AND HAS CAUSED THE RECIPIENT TO ENTER INTO A GRANT AGREEMENT WITH THE TAXPAYER. UNDER THE AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT HAS AGREED TO ONLY USE THE GRANTED FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE. THE GRANT AGREEMENT CONTAINS FURTHER RESTRICTIONS ON THE USE OF FUNDS FOR LOBBYING, ANY CAMPAIGN FOR CANDIDATE FOR PUBLIC OFFICE, AND OTHER PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES. A COPY OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. CHU HAS CONTINUED TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS BY THE RECIPIENT TO THE EXTENT CONSISTENT WITH ITS DISSOLUTION ACTIVITIES, AND CHU IS SATISFIED THAT THE RECIPIENT IS ACTING IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO ITS EXPENDITURE OF GRANTED FUNDS.

IT SHALL BE THE POLICY OF THE CURTIS INSTITUTE OF MUSIC THAT NO PROSPECTIVE STUDENT WHO HAS BEEN ACCEPTED FOR STUDY WILL BE UNABLE TO ATTEND BECAUSE OF FINANCIAL NEED. SIMILARLY, IT SHALL ALSO BE THE POLICY OF CURTIS THAT NO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENT WOULD HAVE TO LEAVE SCHOOL BECAUSE OF UNMET FINANCIAL NEED. IN PRACTICE, THIS SHALL MEAN THAT CURTIS WILL DETERMINE WHAT IS A REALISTIC LEVEL OF FINANCIAL NEED BASED UPON THEN-PREVAILING COSTS FOR LIVING EXPENSES IN PHILADELPHIA AND THE EXPERIENCE OF OTHER STUDENTS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ESTABLISHED FEDERAL AND COLLEGE POLICIES. AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AS CREDITS TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP, GRANT, LOAN, AND WORK STUDY OPPORTUNITIES TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS ON AN OBJECTIVE AND NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. EACH PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT CRITERIA AND EACH CASE IS CONSIDERED SEPARATELY. THERE ARE A WRITTEN POLICY AND GUIDELINES TO ASSIST STUDENTS AS THEY SEEK THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE GRANTS AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ENROLLMENT STATUS. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS (SAP) IS THE MEANS USED TO MONITOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED. SAP MEASURES BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE PROGRESS. THE AWARDS ARE USED FOR TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE THE U.S. GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS. UPON APPROVAL, FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AS AN OFFSET AGAINST CHARGES SUCH AS TUITION AND FEES. GRANTS CANNOT EXCEED THE STUDENT'S COST OF ATTENDANCE (COA). IN THE EVENT THAT THE COA IS REDUCED DUE TO A DECREASE IN THE STUDENT'S COURSE LOAD OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES IMPACTING SCHOOL CHARGES, THE RELATED GRANT IS ACCORDINGLY REDUCED.

GRANT MONITORING: ANY ORGANIZATION THAT RECEIVES SUBAWARDS FROM FORDHAM UNIVERSITY IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT BOTH FINANCIAL AND PROGRAM PROGRESS REPORTS, EITHER ON A MONTHLY OR QUARTERLY BASIS, AS TO THE USE OF FUNDS. THE REQUIRED FREQUENCY OF REPORTING, AS WELL AS OTHER MONITORING CONTROLS, ARE DEPENDENT UPON REQUIREMENTS OF THE PRIMARY SUBGRANTING AGENCY AND UPON THE RESULTS OF A PREAWARD RISK ASSESSMENT, WHICH IS PERFORMED ON ALL SUBRECIPIENTS PRIOR TO ISSUING AWARDS. FINANCIAL AND PROGRAM PROGRESS REPORTS RECEIVED FROM SUBGRANTEES ARE MONITORED AND REVIEWED BY PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS, THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS AND THE SUBGRANTS ACCOUNTING OFFICE TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED APPROPRIATELY. IN ADDITION, PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS MEET REGULARLY WITH SUBGRANTEES, WHICH INCLUDES FIELD VISITS TO OBSERVE ACTIVITIES ON A FIRST-HAND BASIS. SCHOLARSHIP GRANT MONITORING: FORDHAM PROVIDES VARIOUS TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PROMOTE ACCESS AND AFFORDABILITY TO STUDENTS. FORDHAM'S STUDENT FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WORKS WITH STUDENTS TO HELP THEM DEVISE A PLAN TO FUND THEIR EDUCATION. ASSISTANCE MAY INCLUDE A COMBINATION OF GRANTS, LOANS AND PAYMENT PLANS DEPENDING ON INDIVIDUAL CIRCUMSTANCES AND RESOURCES. SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND ON A NON-DISCRIMINATORY BASIS. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE CERTAIN QUESTIONNAIRES AND APPLICATIONS TO DEMONSTRATE THEIR QUALIFICATION OR VARIOUS TYPES OF FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL, AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS HAVE PARTICULAR ELIGIBILITY AND MONITORING REQUIREMENTS, SUCH AS THOSE PROVIDED BY THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS. THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY INCLUDE A MINIMUM COURSE LOAD, DEMONSTRATED ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND OTHER SIMILAR REQUIREMENTS. SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TOWARD A STUDENT'S TUITION AND ROOM AND BOARD COSTS, THEREBY INSURING THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED.

THE UNITED STATES CONGRESS PASSED THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY (CARES) ACT ON MARCH 27, 2020. THE UNIVERSITY WAS AWARDED $8,147,184 THROUGH THE CARES ACT AND, IN FY2020, EXPENDED $2,175,315 OF THE AWARD FOR COVID-19 ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS, AND $2,175,315 TO MITIGATE A PORTION OF THE FINANCIAL LOSSES INCURRED BY THE UNIVERSITY FOR THE NUMEROUS HEALTH AND SAFETY MEASURES TAKEN. THE BALANCE OF THE AWARD WILL BE UTILIZED IN SIMILAR WAYS DURING THE NEXT FISCAL YEAR.

SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS ARE RECEIVED FROM INDIVIDUALS, TRUSTS, CORPORATIONS, ETC. THESE FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT, NEED AND OTHER FACTORS. THE UNIVERSITY HAS SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEES WHO MEET AND INTERVIEW STUDENTS WHO HAVE APPLIED FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS BEFORE MAKING AWARDS.
THE COLLEGE REVIEWS AND MAKES SURE ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THOSE GRANTS BEFORE DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ALL SWARTHMORE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED/POSTED ELECTRONICALLY (AND INTERNALLY) DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT. FURTHERMORE, STUDENTS RECEIVING SAID FUNDS ARE UNABLE TO WITHDRAWAL IT FROM THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO is not a grantmaking organization per se in that its fundamental mission and purpose for tax-exempt status relates to education. However, in the course of its mission-related activities, the University does make payments that meet the definition of "grantmaking" as defined by the instructions to Schedule I of IRS Form 990. These payments fall into two categories: (1) Student Financial Aid - the University OFFERS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED BY: THE UNIVERSITY; FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; SOCIAL, FRATERNAL, PROFESSIONAL, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; EMPLOYERS, BOTH PRESENT AND PROSPECTIVE; AND FRIENDS AND GRADUATES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO. The University's Financial Aid is awarded to students who demonstrate eligibility based on financial need, compete in intercollegiate athletics, demonstrate academic merit, or commit time and skills after graduation to the U.S. Armed Forces. Students and their parents complete extensive application materials, submit tax returns and other documents to support their claim for financial assistance. The Office of Financial Aid determines students' eligibility for need-based aid. Various academic departments determine eligibility for merit-based aid; (2) Charitable Contributions - charitable contributions are made in accordance with University policy and all applicable laws and regulations.

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF TUITION ASSISTANCE INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THIS OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Institutional need and merit awards, government grants and outside scholarships provided aid to 3,992 students during the year. Federally subsidized loans are awarded to eligible students based on need. Over $20 million was paid directly to students (Form 990, Part III, line 4a) with the remainder applied internally to tuition, fees, and room and board.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

ALL HOOD COLLEGE GRANTS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY AWARDS, PERKINS LOANS AND MOST STAFFORD LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED. HOOD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AS EVALUATED THROUGH THE STUDENT'S HIGH SCHOOL RECORD AND SAT SCORES. MANY SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES ALSO INTEGRATE NEED BASED AWARDS. ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS REQUIRE REPORTING OF FUND USAGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1(h) Explanation of purpose of grant or assistance
ExplntnTxt: Payments related to work performed on research subcontract related to federal, state or private grant originally made to the University and other assistance in accordance with the University's exempt mission.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS MADE FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE INITIATED BY A FORMAL SUB-CONTRACT EXECUTED BY BOTH PARTIES. THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EACH GRANT CONTAIN ALL THE GUIDELINES FOR INVOICING, BILLING, RECORD RETENTION, AUDITS, ETC. RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING ("RSPA") AND THE NOTRE DAME RESEARCH OFFICE WORK IN TANDEM TO ENSURE THE GUIDELINES ARE ADHERED TO. ALMOST ALL SUBCONTRACTS FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE PAID ON A COST REIMBURSEMENT BASIS. ALL INVOICES PAID FOR COSTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR BASED ON COMPLETION OF WORK, DELIVERABLES MET, ETC. IN ADDITION, RSPA MONITORS THE PAYMENTS AGAINST THE TOTAL BUDGET TO ENSURE PAYMENT IS NOT MADE ABOVE THE STIPULATED CEILING. THE UNIVERSITY HAS A POLICY CONTAINING GUIDELINES SURROUNDING SUB-CONTRACTS, SOME OF WHICH WERE ADDRESSED ABOVE. THIS POLICY CAN BE FOUND AT: HTTP://CONTROLLER.ND.EDU/ASSETS/91679/SUBRECIPIENT_MONITORING.PDF. CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVE CONTRIBUTIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE CAREFULLY SELECTED AND REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S INTEREST IN THE ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY WITH THE CORE VALUES OF THE UNIVERSITY.
