THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, REGISTRAR, AND BUSINESS OFFICE COORDINATE THE AWARDING AND DOCUMENTATION OF FINANCIAL AID TO INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY OF FINANCIAL AID, NOTIFICATION OF STUDENTS, CHANGE OF STATUS, AND RECONCILEMENT OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

MERIT AND ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS AND CURRENT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. OTHER INTERNAL AND ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE OF THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WASHINGTON ADVENTIST UNIVERSITY USES THE SCHOLARSHIP AND STUDENT FINANCE COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND AWARD ALUMNI DISCRETIONARY AND ALUMNI ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH BY EACH ENDOWMENT FUND. FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT MONIES ARE AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND ARE WRITTEN INTO THE BUSINESS RULES FOR THE ELLUCIAN SYSTEM. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICE'S AID PROCESSOR IS ALSO THE COMPLIANCE OFFICER AND MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL, STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR AWARDING AND DISBURSING OF AID MONEY.

MONITORING THE EXPENDITURES OF GRANT FUNDS IS DONE IN ACCORDANCE WITH STONE CHILD COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL, SECTION III - FINANCIAL. ALSO, AS A CONDITION FOR RECEIPT OF GRANT FUNDS, THE COLLEGE MUST ALLOCATE THESE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF EACH SPECIFIC FEDERAL GRANT AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR USES OF THESE FUNDS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE PROVIDES FISCAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL FINANCIAL AFFAIRS TO ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE BEING USED IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE APPROVAL PROCESS FOR ALL EXPENDITURES REQUIRE THREE SIGNATURES: THE PERSON REQUESTING THE USE OF FUNDS, THE PROJECT COORDINATOR/DIRECTOR, THEN THE PRESIDENT HAS THE FINAL APPROVAL. A MONTHLY EXPENDITURE REPORT FOR ALL PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE AND A MONTHLY CHECK REGISTER IS PROVIDED TO THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL AT THEIR MONTHLY MEETINGS.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID GRANTS THAT MAY BE USED FOR TUITION AND FEES ONLY.

JOHN F KENNEDY UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE GRANTEES AS PER REGULATIONS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. GRANT FUNDS AND GRANTEES ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE PER REGULATIONS THROUGH PERIODIC AND ANNUAL REPORTS.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS THE UNIVERSITY ACTIVELY MONITORS ALL FEDERALLY SPONSORED RESEARCH GRANTS THROUGH BOTH ITS OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS (OSP) AND ITS SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING OFFICE (SPA). OSP IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING PRE-AWARD ACTIVITIES AND CERTAIN POST-AWARD ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS HUMAN SUBJECT PARTICIPATION GUIDELINES, ANIMAL RESEARCH GUIDELINES AND EXPORT RESTRICTIONS, AMONG OTHERS. SPA MONITORS ALL POST-AWARD FINANCIAL ACTIVITY, INCLUDING ALLOWABILITY OF COSTS AND PREPARATION AND SUBMISSION OF FEDERAL AGENCY REPORTS ON GRANTS. PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES ALL STUDENTS SEEKING NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO COMPLETE THE CSS PROFILE AND THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FORM. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID STAFF ARE TRAINED IN THE REQUIREMENTS OF AWARDING TITLE IV FUNDS TO STUDENTS AND ARE REQUIRED TO ADHERE TO THESE REQUIREMENTS. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO UNDERGOES AN INDEPENDENT UNIFORM GUIDANCE SINGLE AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS
GRANTS TO MERCY HOSPITAL FORT SMITH ARE DISTRIBUTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT.

The financial aid planning office at Toccoa Falls College requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the College does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a College sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the College catalog and the College website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the College to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded. Scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts.

BOSTON COLLEGE AWARDS NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PROGRESS. AID IS ADMINISTERED BY THE STUDENT SERVICES OFFICE. STUDENTS AND THEIR PARENTS COMPLETE EXTENSIVE APPLICATION MATERIALS, SUBMIT TAX RETURNS AND OTHER DOCUMENTS TO SUPPORT THEIR CLAIM FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE MAKES A LIMITED NUMBER OF SCHOLARSHIPS AVAILABLE BASED ON ACADEMIC OR ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT. ON OCCASION BOSTON COLLEGE MAY PROVIDE GRANTS TO 501(C)(3) AND GOVERNMENT ENTITIES. THESE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED AT THE COLLEGE'S DISCRETION. PART III, COLUMN (C) THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENTS ACCOUNTS. SOME OF THE GRANTS LISTED MAY HOWEVER, BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT VIA ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AS A MONTHLY 'NON SERVICE STIPEND'. THE GRANTS ALSO INCLUDE BOOK VOUCHERS, LOAN FORGIVENESS AND CHILDREN'S CENTER AID.

THE PROCESS FOR MONITORING TUITION DISCOUNT OR GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AT LEES-MCRAE IS DONE BY UTILIZING A MATRIX THAT DETERMINES AND LIMITS THE AMOUNT OF ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ADMISSIONS AND ENROLLMENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MEET REGULARLY TO REVIEW THE MOST CURRENT AMOUNT OF AWARDS BEING AWARDED TO ENSURE THE COLLEGE STAYS WITHIN BUDGE AND AWARD GUIDELINES. A FINAL REVIEW IS DONE BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ADMISSIONS AND ENROLLMENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID PRIOR TO AWARD LETTERS BEING MAILED.

GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS FOR ANY STUDENT WHO RECEIVED A SCHOLARSHIP OR TUITION CREDIT. THE BURSAR'S OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURE THAT STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS OR TUITION CREDITS MAINTAIN FULL-TIME OR PART-TIME STUDENT STATUS AND MEET ALL OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS REQUIRED BY THE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP, SO THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES IS IN THE FORM OF DONATIONS IN LIEU OF REAL ESTATE TAXES. THE AMOUNTS ARE INTENDED TO HELP FUND SERVICES NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE ENTITIES. ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPT. OF ED., THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Grants and scholarships are awarded to students based on specific criteria detailed in the various grant/scholarship agreements. Members of the financial aid office and various scholarship/award committees review records for all potential recipients to ensure that the scholarship/award is being awarded properly.

GRANTS ARE ONLY MADE TO AFFILIATED CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS. REGIONAL WEST HEALTH SERVICES, A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION AND PARENT ENTITY MANAGES THE ENTIRE AFFILIATED GROUP OF ORGANIZATIONS, AND OVERSEES THE USE OF ALL FUNDS.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College undergoes the Uniform Guidance audit annually.

Vassar College raises funds for, and makes contributions to, a wide variety of 501(C)(3) organizations in the greater Poughkeepsie area. These organizations are selected annually by a committee of employees and students after review of their activities and mission. Employees and students also volunteer time at each organization. Funds are collected annually from the gifts of employees, students, trustees and friends of Vassar as part of the "Community Works" campaign. Vassar also makes small contributions to other local non-profit and governmental entities who are not part of the campaign.

Students who are awarded scholarships have funds credited to their account and the use is restricted to purposes related to enrollment in a program of study. Recipients of fellowships are required to submit periodic written reports of their activities to the College.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SPECIFIC DEPARTMENT RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID THAT TRACKS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED TO STUDENTS.

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS PERFORM THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF THE GRANT WHO WORK TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.

SIENA HEIGHTS UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FUNDING FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON MERIT, FINANCIAL NEED, SPECIAL CRITERIA BASED ON RESTRICTED FUND ENDOWMENTS AND DONOR CRITERIA, AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT ON THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION.

THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS NEED-BASED AND MERIT-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AS WELL AS VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE SCHOLARSHIP, LOAN, AND STUDENT WORK PROGRAMS AS PART OF ITS OVERALL FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM. THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGEMENT OF ALL FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS.

ALL GRANT ACTIVITY IS REQUIRED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC STANDARDS AND STIPULATIONS OF THE GRANTOR AND OPERATE WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AND FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN ON A MONTHLY BASIS. INTERNAL REPORTS AND AWARD LEVELS ARE REVIEWED PRIOR TO EACH DRAW TO DETERMINE IF CASH SHOULD BE DRAWN FOR INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. FINALLY, THE COLLEGE UNDERGOES AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FEDERAL AWARDS UNDER THE GUIDELINES OF THE UNIFORM GRANT GUIDANCE.

FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH FROM LEGISLATION THAT CREATED THE MERC TRUST FUND (PMAP/PGAMC DISTRIBUTION) THAT PROVIDES REMUNERATION FOR THOSE FACILITIES THAT SERVE AS CLINICAL TRAINING SITES FOR THE COLLEGE'S NURSE PRACTITIONER AND CLINICAL NURSE SPECIALIST STUDENTS DURING THE 2017-2018 ACADEMIC YEAR. THE AMOUNTS PAID FROM THE FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MERC LEGISLATION TO EACH ORGANIZATION LISTED IN PART II IS BASED ROUGHLY ON THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS THEY HAD AND THE LENGTH OF TIME THEY SPENT AT EACH RESPECTIVE FACILITY. TRAINING SITES MUST ALSO HAVE A CURRENT ACTIVE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE ENROLLMENT STATUS IN MINNESOTA.
FELLOWSHIP PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF ENROLLMENT DOCUMENTATION AND DETAILED ATTENDANCE RECORDS PROVIDED BY PROGRAM OFFICERS.

STUDENTS ARE FREE TO USE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR ANY PURPOSE. SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE (PRESIDENT & V.P. OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, DEAN & V.P OF STUDENT AFFAIRS, AND DR. PAYNE), WITH ATTENTION TO BOTH STUDENT GOALS AND PROGRESS, AND DONORS' INTENT. WHILE SOME SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENTS MAKE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR ANY IBS STUDENTS, A FEW OTHERS SPECIFICALLY DESIGNATE "MINISTERIAL CANDIDATES," A STATUS DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF THE BISHOP, BUDDHIST CHURCHES OF AMERICA.
ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH EACH GRANT. THEY ARE ALSO MONITORED BY MEMBERS OF SENIOR STAFF.
The College manages Federal Title IV grant and loan funds in accordance with Title IV regulations. The College undergoes an annual A-133 audit to monitor the use of these funds.

Grants to individuals: The University provides financial assistance to students that submit a written application and meet the University's criteria for financial assistance. Applications are reviewed by the Financial Aid Department and/or scholarship committees, depending upon the particular terms of each scholarship. Awards are applied against the student's tuition due to the University. The University monitors each student to assure that he/she remains enrolled in school and continues to satisfy the criteria for his/her specific scholarship. If the student withdraws from the University, then any remaining funds are returned to the scholarship pool to be awarded to another student.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: CAMPBELL UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT PROGRAMS. ALL GRANT PROGRAMS INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND FUND MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO EACH PROGRAM'S GUIDELINES ONCE ELIGIBILITY HAS BEEN DETERMINED FOR THAT FUND. ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED BEFORE TRANSMITTAL/DISBURSEMENT TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. EACH FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAM HAS PREDETERMINED REPORTING GUIDELINES AND STANDARDS. THE FUNDS ARE RECONCILED AND FUND BUDGETS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, FINANCIAL AID HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT TUITION BILLS.
GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ACCOUNTING OFFICES.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER.
GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF COST CENTERS AND OTHER INFORMATION; INCLUDING WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION AND RECEIPTS.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.
THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. PERSONNEL REVIEW STUDENT NEED ON A YEARLY BASIS AND AWARD GRANTS BASED ON NEED AND ELIGIBILITY.
THE COLLEGE MONITORS ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS BY ASSESSING STUDENT RECORDS, FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AWARDS.

With respect to scholarships, interested students complete an application which is reviewed by the scholarship committee to determine if they meet established criteria. Funds are then awarded to the applicants who best meet the criteria. The amount of money available will determine how many scholarships are awarded. A portion of these scholarships are awarded to students based on financial need and nationality. Students who are awarded scholarships are monitored with respect to their scholastic achievement as students must maintain certain grades to retain their scholarships.

GRANT FUNDING IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH THE ADMISSION PROCESS AS WELL AS THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF THE ANNUAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE UNIVERSITY, IF DETERMINED ELIGIBLE BY ADMISSIONS, TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS ARE AWARDED WITH INSTITUTIONAL MERIT OR PARTNERSHIP AID. WHEN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL PLANNING (SFP) PACKAGES STUDENT AID, THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENT. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS FILED THE FAFSA FORM, ADDITIONAL AID INCLUDING FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT/LOAN FUNDS ARE AWARDED AS WELL. IF FINANCIAL AID FILES ARE COMPLETED WITH MISSING DOCUMENTATION, STUDENT AID AWARDS ARE REVIEWED AND REVISED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE (SAO) TO RECONCILE INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL, AND GRANT FUNDING ON AN ONGOING BASIS THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR. REPORTS ARE RUN FROM THE SFP OFFICE AND SENT TO SAO TO REVIEW AND IDENTIFY ANY AID DISCREPANCIES. IF ANY ARE IDENTIFIED, THE AID IS ADJUSTED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE REQUESTS A YEAR-TO-DATE FEDERAL PELL GRANT FILE FROM COD EVERY COUPLE OF MONTHS TO RECONCILE THE AWARDING, DISBURSEMENT, AND CANCELLATION OF A STUDENT'S GRANT AWARDS. AS THE AWARD YEAR COMES TO AN END, REPORTS MAY BE RUN ON A WEEKLY BASIS FROM THE SFP, SAO, AND COD SYSTEMS TO BE SURE ALL THE FUNDING AWARDED IS RECONCILED ACCURATELY.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.CHAPMAN.EDU.
Policy guides, accounting software, and annual audit.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A DETAILED PROCESS FOR GRANTING SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON NEED. ONCE AWARDED, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS FOR USE TOWARD THE COST OF TUITION, FEES, TEXTBOOKS, ON-CAMPUS HOUSING AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL COSTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid is awarded to students by the office of Student Financial Aid in the Enrollment Services Division of the Student Affairs. The awards are based on factors including academic interest, demonstrated financial need and scholarly achievement that is made up to the student's financial need . Funds are provided by private donors (corporations, individuals and foundations) contributions or endowment funds, the Federal and State governments and also from the University's operating budget. Awards are monitored on an individual basis to ensure that awardees continue to maintain the criteria for qualification such as the minimum GPA, satisfactory academic progress and demonstrated need with adjustments to the aid made as appropriate.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S. ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY AT LEAST TWO DIFFERENT DEPARTMENTS WHICH CREATES CHECKS AND BALANCES TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE TRACKED, REPORTED AND USED AS REQUIRED IN THE GRANT LANGUAGE. TITLE IV GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT VIA FINANCIAL AID TRANSMITTAL. AS STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR REQUIREMENTS FOR RECEIVING AID, WEEKLY TRANSMITTALS ARE RUN AND STUDENTS, WITH THE PROPER CODING ARE SELECTED TO RECEIVE AID. THE TRANSMITTAL GENERATES A LISTING OF EACH AWARD, BY TYPE WITH TOTALS, AND IS USED TO RECORD THE GRANT EXPENSE TO THE GENERAL LEDGER. FEDERAL AWARDS AND GRANTS ARE VERIFIED TO A RECEIVABLE IN THE GENERAL LEDGER THAT IS RECORDED FROM AN AUTHORIZATION LETTER AND TO THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IN THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. IF THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IS SUFFICIENT, THE FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN THROUGH THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM INTO THE FEDERAL FUNDS CHECKING ACCOUNT. A BANK ACH REPORT IS GENERATED TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS ARE RECEIVED. THE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS ARE VERIFIED TO GRANTS BY TYPE ON THE FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM AND BILLING TRANSACTIONS ON THE BILLING FILE. THESE SYSTEMS ARE RECONCILED ON A MONTHLY BASIS.

FEDERAL CARES ACT HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF) EMERGENCY STUDENT AID The University received certain funding under the CARES Act to provide aid to students during the year that ended June 30, 2020. The University was awarded $1,342,302 from the Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund (HEERF) for this purpose. The funds were used for emergency financial aid grants to students under the 18004(a)(1) Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES Act). The University disbursed $1,313,235 to students as of June 30, 2020 to assist the students in their transition to remote learning with the remaining $29,067 to be utilized in fiscal year 2021.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The organization has rules in place to ensure that scholarship aid provided to students is used for authorized purposes. Additional detail is available upon request.

COLLEGE FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AS WELL AS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM RESTRICTED SOURCES (NEED AND MERIT BASED) WERE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS OF THE FOUR SCHOOLS OF THE COLLEGE. THE SCHOLARSHIPS WERE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AND WERE MONITORED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FINANCE OFFICE.
All assistance is in the form of grants and scholarships. These funds are applied directly to the student's account.
Grant funds consist mainly of institutional discounts for students of Los Angeles Pacific University. The scholarships are applied directly to students' accounts, and no cash changes hands.

Institutional gift aid is awarded in various forms via the following selection process: 1) Academic Scholarships: The selection of these students is made by the office of the undergraduate, graduate, Ph.D. and Law Admissions, and the student's application for admission serves as the scholarship application; 2) Talent awards (athletics and music): The decision regarding the award recipients is made by the appropriate department and/or coach. Students are either recruited or nominate themselves for award consideration. Selection is usually based upon performances and auditions, and 3) need based awards: The office of Financial Assistance determines eligibility based upon the FAFSA. Selection is made within appropriate University guidelines. Thus, the awards are not reported as grants. Student loans: St. Mary's participates in the FFLEP program, in which the student self-selects the lender and the office of financial assistance certifies eligibility based upon federal regulations.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE FUNDED THROUGH A VARIETY OF SOURCES. IT IS INTENDED THAT THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BE USED TO RECOGNIZE ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, SERVANT LEADERSHIP, AND SPECIAL ACHIEVEMENT AND TO MEET FINANCIAL NEEDS OR PROVIDE SELF-HELP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH STUDENT WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND PARENT/STUDENT LOANS. WHILE IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO GUARANTEE THAT FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EVERY NEEDY APPLICANT, THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE DESIGNED TO HELP COVER THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE DIRECT COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND THE STUDENTS OWN RESOURCES. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BASED UPON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF RESOURCES THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE STUDENT.

Each year Albany Law School awards a number of merit and diversity scholarships funded from restricted and unrestricted endowment funds and annual giving by alumni and friends and other sources. The Admissions Committee awards the scholarships to first year students in the form of scholarships in varying amounts. Financial Aid personnel, in conjunction with Development and Business Office personnel, are responsible for monitoring compliance with restrictions associated with endowment funds. All scholarships are merit-based and awarded on the basis of academic promise and individual characteristics that strengthen the applicant pool. The Admissions Committee also offers merit-based scholarships to students from diverse backgrounds including those minorities who historically have been under-represented in the legal profession. A scholarship may be retained from year to year without re-application upon achievement of grades set forth as conditions of the award. Monitoring of continued awarding for second and third year students is performed by the Financial Aid Office in conjunction with the Registrar's Office.
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED SOLELY TO INDIVIDUALS CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN LIFE CHIROPRACTIC COLLEGE WEST PROGRAMS FOR USE FOR TUITION, BOOKS, AND STANDARD COST OF LIVING EXPENSES.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE UNIVERSITY'S ESTABLISHED ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND REGULATIONS.

GRANTS GIVEN TO CSUSM ARE FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE FUNDS GIVEN TO EACH STUDENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY QUALIFIES APPLICANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON CRITERIA OVER WHICH CSUSM FOUNDATION HAS NO CONTROL. EXPENDITURES ON GRANTS AND CONTRACTS ARE CLOSELY MONITORED BY THE CSUSM FOUNDATION STAFF TO COMPLY WITH SPONSOR REQUIREMENTS.

STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. TRAVEL AND STUDENT RESEARCH GRANTS REQUIRE SUBSTANTIATION. ALL GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY THE COLLEGE TO DETERMINE THAT THE RECIPIENT'S MISSION ALIGNS WITH THAT OF THE COLLEGE. COLLEGE POLICY STRICTLY PROHIBITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO POLITICAL ORGANIZATIONS OR EVENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III: ACCOUNTING FOR CASH AND NONCASH ASSISTANCE:
ExplntnTxt: PAYMENTS/REIMBURSEMENTS DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED CASH ASSISTANCE. PAYMENTS TO VENDORS ON BEHALF OF RECIPIENTS OR THE PURCHASE OF NONCASH ITEMS TO BE GIVEN TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED NONCASH ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, COLUMN B: NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS IS BASED ON FINANCIAL AID RECORDS OF RECIPIENTS. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH PRIZES/AWARDS), AND THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS BENEFITTED OR NUMBER OF ITEMS PURCHASED (NONCASH PRIZES/AWARDS). THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT RESEARCH AND TRAVEL GRANTS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH GRANTS), AND/OR THE NUMBER OF RESEARCH PROJECTS FUNDED (CASH AND NONCASH GRANTS).

THE THREE AREAS OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS ARE LOANS, GRANTS, AND EMPLOYMENT (WORK-STUDY). THESE ARE GENERALLY AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED, DETERMINED BY AN ANALYSIS OF FAMILY INCOME AND ASSETS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ANOTHER SOURCE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, ATHLETICS OR PERFORMING ARTS, COMMUNITY SERVICE OR LEADERSHIP. CRITERIA FOR MERIT BASED AWARDS MAY ALSO INCLUDE A FINANCIAL NEEDS REQUIREMENT. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE AMOUNT ISSUED BY CALCULATING A COST OF ATTENDANCE, ASSESSING AN ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC), AND DERIVING A LEVEL OF FINANCIAL NEED. ONCE THE AMOUNT OF AID HAS BEEN DETERMINED FOR THE INDIVIDUAL, IT IS DISPERSED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AND IS CONTROLLED BY THE BURSAR'S OFFICE. SEVERAL REPORTS/SURVEYS ARE USED ANNUALLY TO MONITOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF GRANT ASSISTANCE; FOR EXAMPLE, FISAP REPORT TO USDE, A-133 AUDIT, FEDERAL IPEDS REPORT, STATE ANNUAL AUDIT, AND VARIOUS SURVEYS THAT TYPICALLY USE INFORMATION FROM THE COMMON DATA SET (CDS).

ROCKY MOUNTAIN COLLEGE AWARDS FINANCIAL AID WHICH COMES FROM FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS, ENDOWMENT FUNDS, DONATIONS, ETC. THE STUDENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL FUND REQUIREMENTS AND IS POSTED TO THEIR ACCOUNT AS A REDUCTION. IF FUNDS EXCEED TUITION AND FEES, THE STUDENT IS GIVEN THE EXTRA FUNDS FOR LIVING EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES INCURRED AT THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS. MONITORING CONSISTS OF RECORD KEEPING FOR INTERNAL USE AND REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 1:
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IN CONFORMANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES ON THE BASIS OF BOTH NEED AND SCHOLASTIC MERIT. TUITION DISCOUNTING IS BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY APU'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AWARDS TO STUDENTS WITH NEED ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID FILED WITH THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. THE APU APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION CONTAINS INFORMATION UTILIZED FOR SCHOLARSHIP AWARD. AID IS DETERMINED AND AWARDED ON AN EQUAL BASIS TO RECIPIENTS WITH SIMILAR ATTRIBUTES. PART III(B) NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS: RECIPIENTS HAVE RECEIVED ONE OR MORE AWARDS FOR WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S GRINNELL COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON FUND AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY GRINNELL COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH GRINNELL COLLEGE POLICY. STUDENTS AWARDED OTHER FUNDS MAKE VARIOUS REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS ON THEIR RESEARCH OR STUDY AS REQUIRED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUNDING. THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ENHANCEMENT AND ENGAGEMENT. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF FACULTY, STAFF AND GRINNELL COLLEGE STUDENTS FROM THE LOCAL AREA. ALL FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS FOCUS ON THE STRATEGIC PRIORITIES OF STRENGTHENING CULTURAL, RECREATIONAL, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN THE LOCAL AREA AS WELL AS INITIATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE SAFETY, BEAUTY, AND ECONOMIC VITALITY OF OUR SURROUNDINGS. GRINNELL COLLEGE HAS ASSEMBLED A DIVERSE SELECTION COMMITTEE TO EVALUATE NOMINEES FOR THE GRINNELL COLLEGE YOUNG INNOVATOR FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE PRIZE. APPOINTED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT, THE SELECTION COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE ALL RECOGNIZED INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR SOCIAL CHANGE IN VARIOUS CAPACITIES. THEIR BACKGROUNDS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND EXPERIENCES REFLECT THE DIVERSITY IN BOTH GRINNELL AND THE STATE. THESE MEMBERS INCLUDE ONE REPRESENTATIVE EACH FROM THE COLLEGE'S FACULTY, STUDENT BODY, ALUMNI, STAFF AND TRUSTEES, PLUS PROMINENT INDIVIDUALS NOT FORMALLY AFFILIATED WITH GRINNELL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS ANY CHANGES IN THE STATUS OF FINANCIAL AWARD RECIPIENTS THAT WOULD RESULT IN A CORRESPONDING CHANGE IN THE AMOUNT OF AID AWARDED. ANY SUCH CHANGES ARE AUTOMATICALLY DETECTED AND REPORTED BY A SERIES OF SPECIAL REPORTS THAT ARE RUN ON A REGULAR BASIS. MOREOVER, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS ENSURES THAT THE CHARGES TO WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE APPLIED ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTENDED USE OF THE AWARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED AND IS APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND OTHER MERIT BASED CRITERIA ALONG WITH A COMPLETED APPLICATION FOR STUDENT FEDERAL AID AND DETERMINES WHETHER A NEED LEVEL IS SUBSTANTIATED BY THE APPLICATION. THE AID AND ASSISTANCE PAYS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND BOOKSTORE CHARGES. UST PROVIDED A GRANT TO UST Realty, A RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS THROUGH MANAGEMENT AND BOARD OVERSIGHT.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE DETERMINED AND AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES. GRANTEES MUST MAINTAIN PREDETERMINED ACADEMIC LEVELS IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR SUBSEQUENT GRANTS. THE SCHOOL HAS AN ANNUAL CHARITY WEEK WHERE STUDENTS RAISE FUNDS AND VOTE ON ORGANIZATIONS TO GIVE DONATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MONITOR ANY USE OF THE ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO THE CHOSEN ORGANIZATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF CHARITY WEEK IS TO TEACH THE STUDENTS THE VALUE OF GIVING TO CHARITIES THEY BELIEVE ARE WORTH GIVING ASSISTANCE.

STUDENT ENROLLMENT IS MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. AFTER VERIFICATION OF ENROLLMENT EACH TERM, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL COSTS PER FEDERAL REGULATIONS. STUDENT WITHDRAWALS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND GRANT FUNDS ARE ADJUSTED AND RETURNED AS NECESSARY. EXPENSES AND INCOME FOR OTHER GRANTS ARE TRACKED IN ACCOUNTS SET UP SPECIFICALLY FOR THE GRANT. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A PROJECT INVESTIGATOR THAT OVERSEES THE SPENDING OF THE FUNDS AND ENSURES THEY ARE USED AS INTENDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

IN PROVIDING FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS, THE COLLEGE ADHERES TO FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES AS WELL AS INTERNAL CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC PROGRESS, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR PARTICULAR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FEDERAL FAFSA FORM IS USED. STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED AND THEREFORE, NO CASH IS EXCHANGED.

AFTER AN APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY THE STUDENT, FINANCIAL AID EVALUATES IT FOR NEED AND BASED ON THEIR ENROLLED COURSES, AND THIS IS RE-EVALUATED EACH YEAR AS NEED AND ENROLLMENT INDICATE. THE UNIVERSITY DOES MONITOR THE USE OF THE STUDENT AID AND IT IS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNT IN THE UNIVERSITY'S SIS (STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM).

THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY CLEARY UNIVERSITY ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AND FEE CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER RECIPIENTS REMAIN STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, AND CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY PROFESSORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Chief Advancement Officer communicates eligible expenses to Accounting, the Business Office, and others. The expenses are received and reviewed by the Business Office (COO) as well as reviewed by the Controller and Executive Vice President of Finance and Facilities to ensure compliance with grant requirements, coding, and if costs are allowed. A reconciliation of grant expenditures to accounting records is done monthly and a federal financial report of cash draw downs is completed quarterly. Monitoring of budgeted amounts compared to actual costs is done monthly so that allowable funds are identified and fully utilized within the funding period.

INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME THE AID WAS AWARDED. THE ABOVE IS A BEST ESTIMATE BASED ON CERTAIN ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING WHERE PERSONS WERE LIVING WHEN THE AID WAS AWARDED AND DOES NOT REPRESENT THE DEGREE TO WHICH AID IS AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS.

Subrecipient grants - Lehigh University maintains a policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to Lehigh. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of sponsored projects in compliance with laws, regulations, terms and conditions of awards and subawards, and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. Other Assistance - Undergraduate assistance offered from institutional funds to our undergraduate students is awarded on the basis of merit and/or financial need. The selection criteria is based on the calculated expected family contribution, which is derived by using complex formulas involving families' income, assets, and household sizes. The student financial aid office administers and monitors these grants using system-generated reviews, along with cross checks on an ad hoc basis. Results from these reviews are regularly evaluated. Subsequently, follow-up corrective actions are taken when appropriate, and potentially include award revisions or cancellations. These provisions are designed to help ensure that student assistance funds are awarded to eligible recipients, in accordance with applicable federal, state, institutional, and other program legislation, as well as relevant internal university policies and operational guidelines. Graduate assistance offered from institutional funds to our students consists of assistantships, fellowships and scholarships. Students can also apply for a variety of private, external fellowships and scholarships.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. EACH STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED PRIOR TO AWARDING. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS THE GRANTS DIRECTLY TO OUTSTANDING BALANCES TO ENSURE THE PROPER USE OF AWARDED FUNDS.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND/OR ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES IS DISTRIBUTED AND MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERALLY APPROVED NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA OR OTHER AGENCY PROVIDED CRITERIA. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADJUDICATED BY A PANEL OF NATIONAL EXPERTS USING THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA TO EVALUATE GRANT APPLICATIONS: EXCELLENCE, ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT PROJECT, AND PROJECT IMPACT. THESE CRITERIA INSURE THAT THE FUNDING ALIGNS WITH THE GRANT-MAKING GOAL OF SUPPORTING THE PHILADELPHIA REGION'S MOST TALENTED ARTISTS AND HIGH-PERFORMING CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS IS MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ACCOUNT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.
Institutional scholarships and grants are monitored by disbursing funds from financial aid to the business office.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ITS FULL-TIME, DEGREE SEEKING STUDENTS, BY CREDITING SUCH AMOUNTS DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS, TO BE ONLY USED AS AN OFFSET FOR TUITION.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES- THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE SERVES AS THE COORDINATING DEPARTMENT FOR ALL TYPES OF FUND RAISING PROGRAMS AND FOR SOLICITATION OF GIFTS. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS/RESTRICTIONS ARE MADE AND MONITORED BY THE DEPARTMENTS OF FINANCIAL AID AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. THE ACCOUNTING STAFF RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS.

PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A COMPUTERIZED SYSTEM WITH INTEGRATED CONTROLS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AS APPROVED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES, AS APPROPRIATE. A SERIES OF REPORTS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND ARE USED BY MANAGEMENT TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ANY EXCEPTIONS. ANNUALLY, THE COLLEGES FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL GUIDELINES IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE ISSUES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE REQUIRED TO MATRICULATE AT THE COLLEGE. THE STUDENT DOES NOT HAVE ANY DISCRETION ON HOW FUNDS ARE USED; ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROGRAM, THEREFORE, THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO FURTHER MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. IN EACH CASE, THE COLLEGE IS AWARE OF THE CHARITABLE USE OF THE FUNDS, WHICH IS TYPICALLY FOR THE GENERAL PURSUIT OF THE RECEIVING ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSES AND NOT EARMARKED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. THE COLLEGE BELIEVES IN EACH INSTANCE THAT THESE FORMS OF ASSISTANCE ARE IN THE COLLEGE'S BEST INTEREST IN PROMOTING ITS IMAGE AND THE PURSUIT OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE.

MANOR COLLEGE AWARDS STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE WITH SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT MANOR COLLEGE THEREFORE ENSURING THE PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS. FOR CARES ACT FUNDING, STUDENTS MUST FORWARD THE EMAIL SENT OUT BY THE COLLEGE TO FINANCIAL AID AND THEY NEED TO INDICATE THAT THEY HAVE RECEIVED THE MESSAGE AND THAT THEY UNDERSTAND THAT THESE FUNDS ARE ONLY TO BE USED TO HELP WITH CHILDCARE, HOUSING, TECHNOLOGY AND OTHER ESSENTIAL NEEDS. WITHOUT AN EMAIL VERIFYING THAT THEY UNDERSTAND THE ALLOWABLE USES OF THE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE WILL NOT BE ABLE TO PROCESS THE PAYMENT.
THE STAFF COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL REQUESTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENSURE THAT EACH APPLICANT MEETS THE NECESSARY REQUIREMENTS.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR OLIVET COLLEGE STUDENTS ENROLLED AND ATTENDING CLASSES. ALL RECORDS ARE RETAINED BY THE COLLEGE.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the business office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges business office staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.

CONCORDIA COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
ExplntnTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY REPORTS ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS, INCLUDING SUB-GRANTEES, OF WHICH IT IS AWARE. THIS INCLUDES SUB-RECIPIENT AWARDS, PRIMARILY FOR RESEARCH, TO GOVERRNMENT AGENCIES, ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER 501(C)(3) AND FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES FOR WHICH NO AUTHORITY FOR EXEMPTION IS PROVIDED.
FINANCIAL AID VERIFIES ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDS APPROPRIATELY. FUNDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO COVER FEES. NO OVER-AWARDING IS PERMITTED.

THE AMOUNT OF FUNDS DISTRIBUTED IS COMPARED WITH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO INSURE A BALANCE OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED IS EVALUATED TO INSURE STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE AN OVER AWARD ACCORDING TO THE GUIDELINES OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS CONCERNING GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND COMPLETED NUMBER OF COURSES ONCE A YEAR.
THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY FOR INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

CHESTNUT HILL COLLEGE DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS; HOWEVER, ON OCCASION DONATIONS ARE MADE TO OTHER CHARITABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. SINCE THESE ARE DONATIONS, THEY ARE NOT MONITORED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. THE STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE COLLEGE ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER OBJECTIVE STANDARDS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S CHESTNUT HILL COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEES. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY CHESTNUT HILL COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF STUDENT CONTINUES TO DEMONSTRATE NEED, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE, AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH CHESTNUT HILL COLLEGE POLICY. RENEWAL OF AID ALSO IS DEPENDENT ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS.

THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO ENSURE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS OR DONOR RESTRICTIONS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH IN THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. "NEED BASED" FEDERAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL AID (FASFA).
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A LISTING OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

THE COLLEGE BASES AWARDS ON FINANCIAL AID BY SEVERAL CRITERIA; MERIT, NEED, PERFORMANCE, EMPLOYEE DISCOUNT, ATHLETIC, FEDERAL FUNDED AND OTHER AID. ONLY STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN CLASSSES ARE AWARDED AID.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ESTABLISHED CRITERIA, INCLUDING DONOR RESTRICTIONS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED BY PROCEDURES THAT INSURE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS ARE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND OTHER SIMILAR NEEDS.

PACIFIC LUTHERAN UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ITS FULL-TIME, DEGREE SEEKING STUDENTS, BY CREDITING SUCH AMOUNTS DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS, TO BE ONLY USED AS AN OFFSET FOR TUITION.

AIE - WA provides non-cash grants to its scholarship recipients. Scholarships are awarded to both first and second-year students in the form of reduced tuition, generally to those with the highest need. Grant/scholarship funds are tracked on the scholarship spreadsheet. This spreadsheet is maintained and monitored by the Financial Aid Administrator, Controller - U.S. Operations, CFO, and CEO. Approved/Awarded scholarship information is also recorded in the Student Payment Record spreadsheet, accounting software, and academic software, where it is applied to the student's invoice/ledger reducing the tuition balance. These systems are regularly monitored by the Financial Aid Administrator, Controller - U.S. Operations, CFO, and CEO.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The Office of Financial Aid awards grants to students that are applied to the student's account. Grants are awarded based on need or merit.
The grants and/or financial assistance provided to the students are applied directly to the student's account, ensuring that the funds are used as intended.
THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF DIRECTLY APPLYInG SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT AT THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND FEES.
RECIPIENTS WERE GIVEN GRANTS BASED ON THE NEEDS OF THE MEDICAL COMMUNITY AND THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AT LARGE. COMMUNITY BENEFITS COMMITTEE AND CEO REVIEW ASSISTANCE REQUESTS AND APPROVE BASED ON NEED.

THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS MONITERED BY NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT NEC MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS (CFR) PART 200. NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. ONLY CURRENT NEC STUDENTS IN GOOD STANDING ARE PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS OR OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. ALL COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TRACKED SEPARATELY AND ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S STUDENT BILLING SYSTEM. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC STAFF AND THEIR ELIGIBLE SPOUSES AND DEPENDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF STAFF TUITION WAIVERS, PURSUANT TO A WRITTEN BENEFITS PLAN. STAFF TUITION WAIVERS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE CONSERVATORY'S BENEFITS SYSTEM AND, LIKE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS, ARE CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S INTERNAL ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION CHANGES. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Grants represent financial aid awarded to students from both institutional funds as well as amounts passed through from Federal and State aid programs. Students applying for financial aid must complete the Federal FAFSA form. Institutional aid is awarded according to institutional policy and is based on both academic ability and financial need. Federal and State aid is awarded consistent with applicable Federal and State rules and regulations.

PRIOR TO THE METHODIST HOSPITAL'S APPROVAL OF A GRANT TO A REQUESTING ORGANIZATION, THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA MUST BE MET: (1) THE REQUESTING ORGANIZATION MUST BE AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE; (2) THE REQUESTING ORGANIZATION MUST PROVIDE A RECOGNIZABLE OR DEMONSTRABLE BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY; (3) THE MISSION OF THE REQUESTING ORGANIZATION MUST AUGMENT THE MISSION OF THE METHODIST HOSPITAL; (4) THE REQUESTING ORGANIZATION'S MISSION AND SERVICES SHOULD NOT DUPLICATE AND MUST NOT CONFLICT WITH THOSE OF THE METHODIST HOSPITAL. PERIODIC REPORTS WERE REVIEWED TO ENSURE THE FUNDS WERE USED TO SUPPORT INDIGENT CARE SERVICE AND OR OTHER NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE, ARE EVALUATED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Olin College provides all accepted students with merit scholarships which cover half of their tuition and are credited directly to their student accounts. The scholarships are only used to offset tuition charges. The college provides assistance to certain not-for-profit organizations that support the College and/or have similar beliefs. The assistance is considered a donation.

USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE COLLEGE HAS IN PLACE ASSURANCES/SAFEGUARDS THAT INCLUDE GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, AND ADDITIONAL FISCAL PROCEDURES FOR THE SUBMISSION AND APPROVAL OF INVOICES FOR THE PROPER USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR EXPENDITURES THAT PROVIDE SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS (IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PAY FOR TUITION, SUPPLIES AND FEES), THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ON EACH INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT THAT INCLUDES DATA ON ELIGIBILITY, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND AMOUNT OF FUNDS AWARDED/DISBURSED. FOR EXPENDITURES IN SUPPORT OF PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES PROGRAM MANAGERS MUST REVIEW EXPENDITURE REQUESTS TO ENSURE THAT EACH IS AN APPROPRIATE EXPENDITURE FOR APPROVED ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED BUDGET FOR THE GRANT.
THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH OUTLINES THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY ON AWARDING FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS.

The College follows federal, state, donor, and institutional guidelines for determining eligibility for scholarships, prizes, and other grants and awards. The College maintains records showing the selection criteria, recipient eligibility, how funds may be used, and any related party. Before paying grants to other entities, the College obtains documentation showing the recipient is eligible to receive deductible charitable contributions. Grants awarded by the Office of Financial Aid are credited directly to student accounts. Other grants are monitored in various ways, including reimbursing actual substantiated expenses, requiring written reports, and/or visiting sites of activities funded by the College grants.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD FOR ITS STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANICAL AID OFFICE BASED ON A COMBINATION OF MERIT AND NEED. THEY ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDS FOR STUDENTS AS A PART OF THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT). THE UNIVERSITY ISSUED EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO APPLIED FOR EMERGENCY RELIEF AS A RESULT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.

DRAKE UNIVERSITY HAS EMPLOYEES DEDICATED TO POST-AWARD REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, DRAKE RECEIVES AN A-133 AUDIT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FROM THE EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. OUR FY20 A-133 AUDIT EXPRESSED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION WITH NO FINDINGS, NO SIGNIFICANT DEFICIENCIES IN INTERNAL CONTROL, AND NO INSTANCES OF MATERIAL NONCOMPLIANCE.
MUIH MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT AWARDED TO EACH RECIPIENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY GRANT POLICY IS CONTAINED IN ALL ADMISSIONS MATERIAL, IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, AND CAN ALSO BE FOUND ON THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE. THE UNIVERSITY USES A MATRIX MODEL TO AWARD MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP AID AT THE TIME A STUDENT IS ADMITTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE AMOUNT AWARDED IS BASED ON THE STUDENT'S HIGHEST SAT OR ACT SCORES AND WEIGHTED CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE. ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DETERMINED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC AND THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION TO DETERMINE THE EXACT SIZE AND COMPOSITION OF THE FINAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES. THE TYPICAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN A WORK STUDY PROGRAM WHICH SUPPLEMENTS EACH FAMILY'S CONTRIBUTION TO THE TOTAL COST OF EDUCATION. THE AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) CONTAINING INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND PARENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 FINANCIAL AID/GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED (AS EVIDENCED BY APPLICATION AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS), AND PROVIDED BASED ON SUPPORTED (RECEIPTS) EXPENSES FOR APPROVED TRAVEL, BOOKS AND HEALTH INSURANCE. STIPENDS FOR MEALS ARE SET BY ALLOWANCE.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Grants and Scholarships Monitored by MidAmerica Nazarene University: Institutional- Awarded based on financial need, merit, and donor criteria. Amounts will vary depending on awards and funding limits. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with institutional polices. Students failing to meet the institutional polices risk loss of institutional aid. Federal and State- Awarded based on Federal and State regulations, based on financial need, academic standards of the programs, and funding availability. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with Federal and State polices. Students failing to meet the Federal and State polices risk loss of Federal and State aid. All grants and scholarships are applied directly to student accounts.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DONOR RESIDENCE WHILE GRANTS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND STANDARDS AS DESIGNATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO KNOWN NON-PROFITS. THE ORGANIZATION SUPPPORTS ITS RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL CHARITIES AND DOES NOT MONITOR THE FUNDS AFTER THEY ARE DISBURSED.

THIS IS INTERNALLY FUNDED ASSISTANCE THAT IS FINANCED BY THE EARNINGS OF OUR WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS ENDOWMENT FUND. STUDENTS MUST MEET CERTAIN CRITERIA TO FULFILL RESTRICTIONS THAT ARE SET FOR ANY PARTICULAR SCHOLARSHIP. THIS ALSO INCLUDES VARIOUS OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIP GIFTS THAT ARE AWARDED BY THE COLLEGE.

Procedure for Monitoring Grants: Grants to organizations and individuals awarded for the purpose of conducting research are monitored as follows: Subcontracts are issued with a defined scope of work and a budget and include other terms and conditions such as frequency of required reporting. The faculty member at the University of Miami responsible for the grant monitors the scientific progress via site visits, correspondence, reports, etc. Invoices submitted for payments by the outside organization or by an individual are approved by the University of Miami Faculty member responsible for the grant.

Assistance to the University students in the form of scholarships are awarded for the purpose of aiding with the cost of attending the University (i.e., for tuition, housing and meals). Scholarships are based on need and academic achievement. Total scholarships, grants and loans cannot exceed the total cost of attendance. The University publishes criteria for the eligibility requirements needed to award a scholarship. The amount of aid awarded is based on a need analysis formula developed by the federal government and includes verification of the information submitted by the student.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ENROLLMENT STATUS. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS (SAP) IS THE MEANS USED TO MONITOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED. SAP MEASURES BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE PROGRESS. THE AWARDS ARE USED FOR TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD.

BAY PATH UNIVERSITY RECEIVES GRANT MONEY FROM FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THIS GRANT MONEY IS DISBURSED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AS IT IS RECEIVED BY THE UNIVERISITY. STUDENT AWARDS ARE BASED ON THE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES FOR EACH TYPE OF GRANT. GRANTS TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL POLICIES
THE ORGANIZATION GAVE NONCASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL, STATE & PRIVATE DONOR REQUIREMENTS. STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED ON A SEMESTER TO SEMESTER BASIS. ALL RECORDS DOCUMENTING THE AWARDING, ELIGIBILITY & MONITORING OF STUDENTS' GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS IS MAINTAINED WITHIN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO DOMESTIC ORGANIZATIONS AND DOMESTIC GOVERNMENTS FOR AMOUNTS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE I, ADVOCATE NORTH SIDE HEALTH NETWORK REPORTS ONLY NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE TAX-EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OR THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH AND COMPLIMENTARY TO THE MISSION AND CHARITABLE, TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES OF ADVOCATE NORTH SIDE HEALTH NETWORK. THE PURPOSES OF THESE GRANTS IS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY PROGRAMS. CASH CONTRIBUTIONS ARE NOT MADE TO INDIVIDUALS, FOR PROFIT BUSINESSES, OR PRIVATE PROVIDERS.

COE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS FROM NSF, DEPT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER AGENCIES OR BRANCHES OF THE US GOVERNMENT. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ARE USED FOR EACH GRANT TO MONITOR RECEIPTS AND DISBURSEMENTS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING AND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL REQUIRED FINANCIAL REPORTING TO THE GRANT PROVIDER ARE COMPLETED TIMELY AND AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM ARE DONE WHEN REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY COMPLETES FILINGS REQUIRED BY UNIFORM GUIDANCE. DISTRIBUTIONS TO STUDENTS ARE MADE ACCORDING TO GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

FINANCIAL AID/GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED (AS EVIDENCED BY APPLICATION AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS), AND PROVIDED BASED ON SUPPORTED (RECEIPTS) EXPENSES FOR APPROVED TRAVEL, BOOKS AND HEALTH INSURANCE. STIPENDS FOR MEALS ARE SET BY ALLOWANCE.

Grants or assistance provided is for scholarships and grants to Simpson College students which are applied directly to the student's tuition charges. The Office of Financial Assistance awards scholarships and grants to students based on a variety of different criteria for each scholarship.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE CREDITED TO THE RECIPIENTS' ACCOUNTS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS THE ASYISTANCE PROVIDED IS INTENDED TO BE USED FOR THE GENERAL OPERATING PURPOSES OF THE DONEE. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS NOT MONITORED AFTER GRANTS ARE GIVEN. THE FOUNDATION COLLECTS DONATIONS FROM THE COWORKERS THROUGH MERCY WAY CAMPAIGN AND THOSE DONATIONS GO INTO A COWORKER CRISIS FUND. IN ADDITION, FLEX SPENDING OVERTURES FROM THE MINISTRY ARE ALSO PUT INTO THIS FUND. A COWORKER IN CRISIS FILLS OUT AN APPLICATION, SENDS BILLS NEEDED HELP WITH AND A PAYSTUB AND A BOARD OF COWORKERS ON THE CRISIS FUND COMMITTEE REVIEW THE APPLICATION. IF A CRISIS IS NOTED, THE BOARD WILL DETERMINE WHICH BILLS TO PAY DIRECTLY TO THE VENDOR.

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES AND INTERNAL NON-DISCRIMINATORY GUIDELINES FOR INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING IS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM NEEDS AND IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE PROCESS OF AWARDING STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITHOUT EXCEEDING THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED IS TRADITIONALLY CALLED FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING. "NEED" IS DEFINED AS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE COA (TUITION, FEES, BOOKS, ROOM & BOARD, TRANSPORTATION, AND PERSONAL EXPENSES) MINUS THE EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION EFC AS DETERMINED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. THE COORDINATION OF INSTITUTIONAL GRANT AID OCCURS SUBSEQUENT TO THE FEDERAL REGULATIONS REQUIREMENT THAT FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT AID AWARDS BE DETERMINED FIRST. A DETERMINATION OF AN INSTITUTIONAL "SCHOLARSHIP" AWARD IS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT (CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE) ACHIEVED IN HIGH SCHOOL OR A PREVIOUS COLLEGE. A DETERMINATION OF AN INSTITUTIONAL "GRANT" AWARD IS BASED ON "REMAINING NEED." A STUDENT MAY RECEIVE BOTH A MERIT AND NEED AWARD. ONE-HALF OF EACH AWARD IS PAID IN EACH OF TWO SEMESTERS, WHICH IS CALLED AN "ACADEMIC YEAR." ANNUAL AGGREGATE BUDGET MAXIMUMS ARE ESTABLISHED FOR EACH INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARD TITLE. ACTUAL AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER MONITORS THE NUMBER OF, AND AMOUNTS OF, INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARDED TO ENROLLED STUDENTS ON A MONTHLY BASIS THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR. QUARTERLY STUDENT FILE REVIEWS ARE CONDUCTED TO ENSURE THAT ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARDS DO NOT EXCEED THE STUDENT'S INITIAL "NEED." ANY AWARD DETERMINED TO EXCEED NEED IS ADJUSTED IN THE SUBSEQUENT SEMESTER AS A CORRECTIVE ACTION. AT THE END OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR, A SUMMARY OF THE AWARDS AND EXPENDITURES MADE IS REVIEWED WITH THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER SO THAT MERIT OR NEED AID BUDGET ADJUSTMENTS, IF ANY, ARE IN PLACE FOR THE SUBSEQUENT ACADEMIC YEAR.

The College has established programs for each type of scholarship and awards funds according to the parameters of each program and as funding is available. The scholarships and grants are awarded to students to be used for educational expenses at the College including tuition, fees, and books. The awards are allocated directly to each student's account.
SELECTION OF STUDENTS IS BASED ON ESTABLISHED CRITERIA OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP FUND AND STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ON ACCOUNT THROUGH FINANCIAL AID.

Need Scholarships: Manhattan College awards grants-in-aid to accepted students who demonstrate financial need. These awards are renewed annually and adjusted in line with changes on the FAFSA. These awards are given for a maximum of four years (eight semesters). Grant recipients must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Full time enrollment is necessary to receive grant. Academic Scholarships: Eligibility is based on exceptional SAT or ACT scores, secondary school grade point average, and rank in class. The amount of the Scholarship is determined at the time of admission and is offered for four years (eight semesters maximum) provided the student remains eligible. Athletic Scholarships: Manhattan College has available a strictly-budgeted fund to offer grants-in-aid to students who, by the possession of certain athletic skills can add to the community spirit and morale of the campus. The College firmly states that recipients must come to Manhattan as students, with their first interest in studies. They must meet the same entrance requirements as other students and must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Manhattan adheres to and endorses the principles and policies of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference, Eastern College Athletic Conference and the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Graduate Scholarships are awarded as part of grants, grad assistance or by departments. HEOP Scholarships are awarded as part of the New York State Program. Endowment scholarships are awarded based upon the donors written restrictions. The College received aid from the US Department of Education as part of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act and disbursed Emergency Financial Aid Grants directly to eligible students.
Funds are awarded to students eligible to receive financial aid in accordance with institutional and federal guidelines.

Criteria is established for the awarding of individual scholarships. Students must complete an application and scholarships are awarded after all external scholarships and grants have been applied, not to exceed the cost of attendance. Scholarships are applied directly to the student account. A listing of scholarships and general scholarship policies can be found on the SCU website, www.swcu.edu.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. WE ALSO PERFORM SPOT CHECKS THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER TO DOUBLE CHECK THAT AID ELIGIBILITY CALCULATIONS ARE MET.

Grants or assistance provided is for scholarships and grants to Simpson College students which are applied directly to the student's tuition charges. The Office of Financial Assistance awards scholarships and grants to students based on a variety of different criteria for each scholarship.
MONITORING OF GRANT USE: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: USE OF GRANT FUNDING MUST COMPLY WITH THE INSTITUTION'S PURCHASING POLICY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. PRIMARY INVESTIGATORS ARE ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE USE OF THOSE FUNDS UNDER THE REVIEW OF THE CONTRACT AND GRANTS ACCOUNTING MANAGER THAT MONITORS THEIR COMPLIANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE IS SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT (UNIFORM GUIDANCE) ENSURING AN OUTSIDE OPINION ON THE INSTITUTION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS: THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAVEN IS COMMITTED TO ASSISTING STUDENTS IN FINANCING THEIR EDUCATION. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM, WITH THE STUDENTS RECEIVING ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AND PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT WHICH ARE AVAILABLE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS, PRIVATE SPONSORS, AND FROM UNIVERSITY RESOURCES. MORE THAN 90% OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. MOST FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE BASED ON AN INDIVIDUAL'S DEMONSTRATION OF NEED AFTER CAREFUL CONSIDERATION OF THE APPLICATION FOR ASSISTANCE. IN CALCULATING NEED, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ATTEMPTS TO CONSIDER ALL ASPECTS OF A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE TO U.S. CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. SOME FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE ON A MERIT BASIS FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL ACADEMIC RECORDS OR ATHLETIC ABILITY. STUDENTS MUST BE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID. GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ALL CREDITS FOR WHICH FINANCIAL AID HAS BEEN AWARDED, AS INDICATED ON THE STUDENT'S INDIVIDUAL FINANCIAL AID AWARD LETTER. FEDERAL, STATE, PRIVATE GRANT FUNDS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID FUNDS ARE NORMALLY APPLIED AS CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 5 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED DIRECT EMERGENCY AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS FOR THEIR EXPENSES RELATED TO THE DISRUPTION OF CAMPUS OPERATIONS DUE TO CORONAVIRUS, SUCH AS FOOD, HOUSING, COURSE MATERIALS, TECHNOLOGY, HEALTHCARE, AND CHILDCARE EXPENSES. $2,235,950 WAS FUNDED BY THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF FUND (HEERF) ESTABLISHED UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS AID, RELIEF, AND ECONOMIC SECURITY ACT (CARES ACT).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF U.S. GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE. FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPEND PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. A MAJORITY OF PAYMENTS ARE MADE VIA CHECK. FOR DOMESTIC SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE (FAO) MAINTAINS AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AID ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE FAO ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF AWARD RECIPIENTS AND RECONCILES, ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE CORRESPONDING EXPENSES WITH THE UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM. THE CASH GRANTS ARE ALSO REFLECTED ON EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE INDEPENDENTLY RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED SYSTEM-FEED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. ADDITIONALLY, ALL FEDERAL SCHOLARSHIP ACTIVITIES ARE MONITORED SEPARATELY BY THE SPONSORED ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT (SPA). FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A SPONSORED RESEARCH ACCOUNTING (SPA) DEPARTMENT WHICH HAS FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. SPECIFIC GRANT-RELATED EXPENDITURE ACTIVITIES ARE PROCESSED BY THE UNIVERSITY ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING: A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) NEGOTIATES SUBCONTRACTS WITH SUB-RECIPIENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST. WHEN AN AGREEMENT IS FULLY EXECUTED, IT MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING (SPA) ALONG WITH A COMPLETED CONSULTANT PAYMENT FORM. ANY ISSUES REGARDING SUB-RECIPIENT PERFORMANCE ARE REPORTED TO THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST AND SPA. ALSO, SPA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 REQUIREMENTS. CARES ACT ASSISTANCE: AS A RESULT OF THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC AND THE CARES ACT LEGISLATION, WHICH WAS PASSED IN EARLY 2020 BY CONGRESS, HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS WERE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE STUDENT AID RELIEF FUNDING. TRUSTEES OF TUFTS COLLEGE (TUFTS) APPLIED FOR RELIEF FUNDS AND WAS AWARDED SUCH FUNDS VIA OUR FEDERAL GRANT/SPONSORED ACCOUNTING OFFICE. THE TOTAL FY20 FEDERAL AWARD RECEIVED WAS $1,067,642 (FOR 871 STUDENTS) AND WAS DISTRIBUTED ACROSS ALL UNIVERSITY SCHOOLS AND ACCOUNTED FOR VIA OUR SPONSORED ACCOUNTING OFFICE USING SEPARATE SCHOOL DEPARTMENT ID'S. THE UNIVERSITY BURSAR'S OFFICE WAS USED TO FACILITATE THE CARES ACT AWARD PAYMENTS. THESE EMERGENCY FINANCIAL AID GRANT FUNDS WERE DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENT APPLICANTS USING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS FOR UNEXPECTED EXPENSES RELATED TO THE DISRUPTION OF CAMPUS OPERATIONS DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS. THE BURSARS OFFICE SENT FUNDS TO FAFSA ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES AND HAVE BEEN CAPTURED ON SCHEDULE I. THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE AWARDS PROVIDED WERE FOR UP TO $1,800 PER STUDENT. ALL PAYMENTS WERE MADE DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS VIA DIRECT DEPOSIT, WHEN AVAILABLE.
THE COLLEGE RECORDS AND TRACKS GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 EMERSON COLLEGE AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PRIMARILY ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. COLLEGE MONITORING OF THE FUNDS INCLUDES DIRECTLY CREDITING AWARDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS WHICH ASSURES THAT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE EDUCATIONal PURPOSE INTENDED. ALL AID RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AS OUTLINED IN THE EMERSON COLLEGE STUDENT HANDBOOK. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AID MUST HAVE A MINIMUM OF A "C" (2.0) GRADE POINT AVERAGE BY THE END OF THEIR SECOND ACADEMIC YEAR. FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS MAY NOT BE IN DEFAULT ON ANY EDUCATION LOANS, OWE A REFUND ON ANY GRANT, OR DEMONSTRATE ANY UNWILLINGNESS TO REPAY AN EDUCATIONAL LOAN.

AUGSBURG UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE UNIVERSITY OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

ALL GRANTS ARE FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. OUR ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF COMPLIANCE RUNS REPORTS, DAILY, WEEKLY, AND MONTHLY TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.
ALL GRANTS ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AT THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. THE ALLOCATION OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES IS DETERMINED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION AND TREASURER. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ELIGIBILITY FOR BOWDOIN GRANT ASSISTANCE IS "NEED BASEDDETERMINED THROUGH ANALYSIS OF A FAMILY'S INCOME AND ASSETS. FAMILY INFORMATION IS COLLECTED THROUGH THE COLLEGE BOARD'S CSS/FINANCIAL AID PROFILE FORM, FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND THE FAMILY'S FEDERAL INCOME TAX RETURNS. EXCEPT FOR NATIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT OFFER MERIT BASED AID. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A STUDENT AID OFFICE TO COUNSEL STUDENTS/FAMILIES ON HOW TO AFFORD A BOWDOIN EDUCATION AND TO ENSURE THAT AWARDS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE BASED ON APPLICATION PROCESS, EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTIONS AND COST OF TUITION.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR GPA REQUIREMENTS, ENROLLMENT REQUIREMENTS, AND OTHER ISSUES. REVIEWS ARE DONE REGULARLY.

ALL STUDENT AID, GRANTS, WORK STUDY AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN ON BEHALF OF STUDENTS ATTENDING SITTING BULL COLLEGE. THE FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE TUITION, BOOKS, AND FEES FOR THE CORRESPONDING STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT IT IS USED FOR THE APPROPRIATE PURPOSES.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS AND PRIZES ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS. THESE GUIDELINES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS ON THE SKIDMORE COLLEGE WEBSITE.

Santa Barbara & Ventura Colleges of Law provides scholarships to new and continuing students. These scholarships are dependent upon factors such as alumni recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission/participation in the program. Santa Barbara & Ventura Colleges of Law maintains records of the scholarship award amounts, evidence of good academic standing and criteria for scholarship selection.

HERITAGE VALLEY OFFERS SUPPLEMENTAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR FULL-TIME AND PART-TIME 1 REGISTERED NURSES TO OBTAIN THEIR BSN. REGISTERED NURSE CANDIDATES CAN RECEIVE UP TO A MAXIMUM OF $10,000 TO OBTAIN THEIR BSN. THE RECIPIENT MUST BE IN GOOD EMPLOYMENT STANDING, REGISTERED NURSES WHO HAVE BEEN ACCEPTED INTO AN ACCREDITED EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION OFFERING AN RN TO BSN PROGRAM, AND EMPLOYED BY HERITAGE VALLEY FOR AT LEAST ONE (1) YEAR. HERITAGE VALLEY HEALTH SYSTEM ENCOURAGES NURSES TO ACHIEVE CERTIFICATION IN THEIR SPECIALTY. FOR ANY REGISTERED NURSE WHO WISHES TO VOLUNTARILY OBTAIN AND/OR MAINTAIN A CERTIFICATION, THE HOSPITAL SHALL REIMBURSE ACTIVE FULL TIME AND PART TIME 1 EMPLOYEES MEETING THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: THE SPECIALTY CERTIFICATION OF INTEREST IS DIRECTLY APPLICABLE TO THE NURSE'S CURRENT POSITION, APPROVAL IS OBTAINED AT LEAST 30 DAYS IN ADVANCE, AND THE EMPLOYEE MUST HAVE WORKED IN THE UNIT FOR AT LEAST (1) YEAR.

EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE IS GRANTED TO ACTIVE, ELIGIBLE FULL-TIME AND PART-TIME EMPLOYEES. CURRENT AND FUTURE EDUCATIONAL, TRAINING AND STAFFING NEEDS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION WHEN GRANTING EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE. THE GRADE REPORT FOR EMPLOYEES RECEIVING EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE MUST SHOW A GRADE OF "C OR BETTER FOR UNDERGRADUATE AND A "B OR BETTER FOR GRADUATE LEVEL COURSES.
